choices: Laura gives Tanmay the ability to fly home like a superhero
Laura gives Tanmay the ability to run home at super speed
Laura gives Tanmay the ability to float home like a balloon
12233121222312.content:
The rest of the evening was uneventful for Laura. After she had given Liam his enormous orgasm, the afternoon and evening were pretty quiet. She occasionally closed her eyes and received visions of Tanmay at school and then riding the bus home after class. She picked up on the fact that he HATED to ride the bus because the kids weren’t even allowed to talk on the bus because of the old, grumpy bus driver.

“He hates to ride the bus, hmm?” Laura wondered. “I need to find some other way to get my boy to school… But, what? I need something creative…”

Laura went home and enjoyed a salad for dinner at home. She focused on the Indian teen again and saw that he was quietly studying and reading a book on his bed before dozing off. She really liked the kid a lot and she wanted to do something special for him, she just didn’t know yet what to do.

When she got up the next morning, she closed her eyes and saw that Tanmay was already at school. A couple of boys were standing in a circle and they were bopping a balloon around, in a small area just outside the entrance to the main building. The boys used their hands to volley the balloon to one another.

One boy hit the balloon too hard and the balloon drifted over to one of the trees, where it rubbed against one of the sharp branches and popped, abruptly ending the game.

“Awww man… We lost our balloon! And we still got fifteen minutes before class starts!” one boy named Eric grumbled.

“Does anybody have another balloon?” Aaron wondered out loud.

“I got a balloon but it’s at home! Dang it!” another kid named Charlie sighed.

“We need something light, that doesn’t weigh anything, just like a balloon…” Tanmay said sadly. “Something that’s practically weightless…”

Laura was following the conversation from her bedroom since she could easily tune into Tanmay’s eyes and ears. She saw everything that Tanmay saw and she heard everything that Tanmay heard.

“A balloon? Weightless? That’s IT! I’ll make him weightless!” Laura cheered. “And, I’ll change reality so that everybody will think it’s perfectly normal for Tanmay to be floating around like a balloon! YES!! He’ll love it!”

“Darn it! I wish we had something we could toss around…” Eric grumbled.

“WHAAAAHH!” Tanmay screamed as his feet suddenly left the ground. Tanmay’s body suddenly began to rise up and off the ground and remained floating in mid-air, about four feet above the floor, just as if he was… weightless!

“What the heck?” Aaron shouted.

“Check out Tanmay! He’s floating!” Eric noted, as he walked over to Tanmay and reached out with his hand and pulled him towards his own body by his right sneaker. “He doesn’t weigh anything!”

“You mean…. Tanmay’s as light as a balloon?” Charlie asked him.

Eric wrapped his hands around Tanmay’s waist and he hurled the boy in Aaron’s direction, sending Tanmay sailing through the air!

“Hey! Whooaaaa!” Tanmay gasped as he soared through the air.

“I got him!” Aaron cheered, extending his arms all the way and catching Tanmay by his waist. “Damn! He’s as light as a feather!”

Aaron lowered Tanmay a bit and looked him in the eyes.

“Dude! You gotta eat, man! You don’t weigh a thing!” Aaron giggled as he turned to face Charlie. “Incoming!”

Aaron raised Tanmay high above his head and hurled him through the air like a football, sending the boy soaring through the sky!

“Whoooaaaa!” Tanmay shouted. By now, Tanmay was actually starting to enjoy the rides. Also, he realized that his speed would slow down as he came closer to the ground so he wasn’t so scared of crashing.

“I got him!” Charlie cheered, as he ran back far enough to catch Tanmay with his hands. “Damn, dude! You’re like a balloon! What’s going on here?”

“I… I don’t know!” Tanmay gasped. “I just started to float out of nowhere!”

Just then, the first bell rang, signaling that it was time to enter the classroom.

Charlie let go of Tanmay and he grabbed his backpack. The other boys did the same, leaving Tanmay floating around in the schoolyard all by himself.

“GUYS! What about ME?” Tanmay shouted at them.

“Ohh… You can’t walk cause you’re floating…. Sorry, dude!” Aaron said. Aaron ran back and grabbed hold of Tanmay’s hand, running back inside of the building with Tanmay floating behind him like a flag blowing in the wind.

Once they got inside of the classroom, he let go of Tanmay and allowed his friend to float above the chairs and tables in the classroom until the math teacher, Mr. Woodard, came in.

“Everyone take your seats…. Uhhh… Everyone except Tanmay, of course… You just float above everybody else…” Mr. Woodard stated.

All the kids just grinned as the watched Tanmay float about 6 feet above their seats and desks, which looked really bizarre but for some reason, all the kids just accepted it as normal. When the class was over, the boys took turns holding Tanmay and taking him to their next class.

But, this was nothing, yet. Things got REALLY bizarre when classes were over and the students lined up outside to catch the school bus home… Laura was watching through Tanmay’s eyes and decided to do something very special for her favorite preteen boy…. What does she do?
12233121222312.title: Laura decided to check in with Tanmay the follo...

Laura speaks to Tanmay when he's home alone
Tanmay comes to the store and gets to show off his strength
122331212223123.content:
The most bizarre thing of all happened when Tanmay got in line for the bus ride home that afternoon. The final bell had rung and all the students were eager to get home, of course. The last thing that stood in the way of total freedom was that dreaded ride home on the school bus. Tanmay hated it with passion. He stood in line, hating every minute of it. The kids waited for the bus driver to let them in so they could all get home and enjoy the rest of the afternoon.

“Alright! Let’s get on board! Everyone, be nice and neat! Get in your seats and stay quiet so we can all get home on time!” the bus driver, Mr. James, shouted.

Tanmay started to slowly walk towards the main entrance to the bus when something super weird happened. As he strolled to the bus, his body started to levitate! He was still walking when he began to rise up and off the ground, rapidly ascending straight up and into the air!

“Hey…. Whooaaaaa!” Tanmay gasped as he ascended higher and higher. Luckily, he had his backpack strapped around his shoulders. He wasn’t carrying anything in his hands so his entire body remained still, rising upward in the perfect vertical position with his tennis shoes still pointed towards the ground!

“Hey! Where’s Tanmay going?” one of the boys shouted.

“Dang! How did he do that?”

“Ohh man! I wish I could do that!”

“That sure as hell beats riding the bus home!”

Tanmay started to drift towards his house, floating away from school as his body floated over a hundred feet above the ground!

“Holy crap! W-w-what is g-g-going on here?” Tanmay stuttered as his body slowly floated over the city, hovering above the streets, the buildings and the crowds below.

As Tanmay floated high above and looked down, he saw several people looking up at him, wondering what was keeping him afloat so high above the ground? All they could see was a preteen boy floating above the ground without any wires, parachute, wings, balloon or anything!

Tanmay recognized the buildings and the streets as he looked down. He spotted some landmarks which indicated that he was getting close to his house. At first, he felt very scared but as time went on, he started to feel comfortable. After all, it appeared as if his own body was acting like its own balloon and he was floating on his own power. There was absolutely nothing which was keeping him suspended in the air.

“My house! There’s my house!” Tanmay cheered as he started to descend and head towards the lawn of his house. He had no idea who or what was steering him or directing his flight, but this was better than riding the bus for sure! Within minutes, he hovered over the lawn and he slowly descended until he gently touched down on the sidewalk before the entrance to his house. It was awesome.

“Ohmygod…. I must be dreaming…. This is crazy! Did I really just FLOAT from school to my house?” Tanmay mumbled out loud. “How the heck did I do that?”

Just then, Tanmay saw the school bus turn into his road. It was still a few blocks away. Tanmay had beaten the bus home by floating home instead! What would his classmates say?

He decided to just stand there, before his house, and wait for his friends to arrive on the school bus, when he started to levitate again! He began to feel VERY light, as his body started to rise up and ascend into the air.

This time, a strong gust of wind came and pushed him away, sending Tanmay’s body tumbling through the air!

“Whaaaaahh!”

Tanmay spun around in the air as if he was as light as a feather! The wind blew him further away, sending him higher and higher into the air. As the kids got off the bus, they just laughed as they pointed to the sky.

“Look! It’s Tanmay! He’s blowing in the wind, again!”

“It must be nice to be weightless! Lucky guy!”

A strong wind gust took Tanmay and blew him over a mile away from his house, sending him tumbling and spinning around through the air. Tanmay closed his eyes because he was getting dizzy but he opened them again when things calmed down. Then he gasped when he saw that he was hundreds of feet above the ground!

“Holy crap! I’m like…. Very high up…. How am I gonna get home?”

Suddenly, he felt something pulling him down… Very gently… His body started to float back towards the house again… Minutes later, his shoes touched down on the front lawn, very gently. He let out a sigh of relief.

“I’d better go inside before I get blown away!”

Tanmay dashed and found himself floating again, once in the house. His mother walked up to him and greeted him, gently holding him by the arm.

“Hey, sweetie! Did you have fun at school today?” she asked him.

“Yes, mom! I just… uhh… floated around…” he giggled.

“Good, boy! Now, go and change in your room so we can have dinner!” his mom ordered.

Tanmay used the walls and the furniture to push himself off to move around the house. He would also inhale and exhale forcefully, using his breath to make his body propel forward or backward. His feet would not touch the floor at all since he would just float around the house like a human balloon and everybody would find it completely normal!

Meanwhile, at her house, Laura was just enjoying all the fun she was having with Tanmay.

“Ha ha ha ha! Tanmay’s floating to school and back again! That’s just hilarious!” Laura laughed to herself. “Maybe his mom will have him come by the store to buy something one of these days? That will be fun! In the meantime, he will float to school and back to the house every day!”

Laura realized that the day would come that she had to reveal herself to the boy. She just had to figure out how, where and when to do it. Having Tanmay come to the store was one neat way of accomplishing it. But, she wasn’t in a rush. She was just having way too much fun making the kid feel special. What does she do next?

1223312122231231.content:
The day had finally come when Tanmay’s dad had to get some more supplies for the house at Wilko. Tanmay was home studying as always so his dad invited the boy to come along. His big, muscular son could always help carry some things, after all. They had to get a few cans of paint since the backyard fence needed painting, so Tanmay was more than happy to tag along.

Once they arrived at the store, dad went off to the paint section while Tanmay just wandered around near the entrance of the store where all the tools were located. Laura knew that the boy was in the store and decided that it was time to reveal herself.

Without anyone else noticing anything unusual, Tanmay suddenly started to hover in inch off the ground and he began to float to the cashier counter where Laura was working. Luckily, there were no customers there at the time.

“Hey! What am I doing here?” the boy wondered as he touched down right in front of Laura.

“Well, I finally get to meet you in person, Tanmay!” Laura smiled as she greeted the teen. “I hope you have been enjoying your daily flights to school and back home again!”

Tanmay immediately recognized her voice!

“Oh wow! Are you…. God, or… my Goddess? “Tanmay grinned as he walked up to her.

Laura and Tanmay embraced one another briefly. Laura then ran her hand through his black hair as she finally was able to look him in the face.

“Yes, it’s me! I’ve been having fun with you over the past couple of weeks! I can tell you have been enjoying those rides over the city! It beats riding the bus, huh?”

“Ohh yeah! This is the coolest way to go to school… Or anywhere, for that matter!” the boy grinned. “Thank you so much!”

“Well, I’m going to keep an eye on you! Maybe you can come here and work here over the summer, alright?” Laura suggested.

“I’d appreciate that!” the boy smiled just as his father walked up with two cans of paint.

Laura greeted his dad and rang him up. He paid promptly and she waved goodbye to the friendly, Indian boy. She knew that she would continue to see him again as time went by.

In the meantime, Laura decided to focus on her goofy co-workers for the time being. They desperately needed her attention. She had a large store with plenty of coworkers who had different personalities. So, who would she mess with, first?

132.content:
Easily described as a spontaneous, gradual swapping event that only effects the employees of Wilkos. And instead of entire bodies being swapped, random body parts will be swapped. The staff will then have to adjust to their changes. Some might like their swaps, others definitely won't.

Also, anyone outside of Wilkos, including the employees' friends and families will NOT notice anything out of the ordinary. Of course this will make some adjustments a lot more difficult for our intrepid protagonists.

Shall we start this arc?
132.title: A localized 'swap event'.

1321.content:
The evening started as it always did at Wilkos, everyone gathered at the Help Desk listening to Liz giving them information on the store's performance. And this time Elizabeth was showing her face, having left her office. Paperwork was bound to get anyone down, including management. When that was done, Liz gave everyone their work assignments.

The employees were glad trading hours were almost over, since a lot of them actually hated dealing with customers. Charlotte and Becca mostly. But now Charlotte had another reason to complain. "I'm working toiletries... on my own?" she asked Liz, mouth agape.

Liz sighed, stashing her papers under the Help Desk. "I know there's a lot of work on there, but I'll send someone to help you as soon as some of the other sections get worked okay." she responded.

"Fine!" Charlotte groaned, tipping her head back and rolling her eyes. She may have been twenty, but she still acted like a teenager.

Liz then smiled at the two new starters, Jade and Suki. She was going to pair them up with other staff, just until they learnt the ropes more. Jade was put to work with Nicola, and Suki with Waggy. "If you need help with anything, just ask okay." Liz assured the two 'newbies'. She then went back to the Help Desk to have a chat with Elizabeth.

Everyone else settled into their usual work routines without problem.

None of them had any idea what was going to happen to them in the coming hours...
1321.title: Off we go.

13212.content:
...But perhaps they should've seen it coming.

Charlotte stormed off to the toilets, grumbling and overall, thoroughly pissed off at her lot in life. Why did she have to put up with this? Working on toiletries on her own until "some of the other sections get worked?" Yeah, knowing Liz's opinion of her, the chances of her getting any help was practically zero.

Suddenly, Charlotte froze. A chill crept its way up her spine, causing her to shiver. She fearfully peered around when-

Boom!

The world exploded into colors. Red, green, blue, violet. They danced across her eyes. The chill ran up into her head, causing a gradually increasing ache. She was about to scream when-

It stopped. Charlotte stood right where she was before, as if nothing had happened. She looked around. Nothing had changed around her.

"What was that about?" she muttered to herself.

She shivered when she thought back to that... vision. It was something beyond human experience, something that was not meant to be seen by human eyes. It was beyond comprehension.

Unbeknownst to Charlotte, much of the rest of the store also experienced visions. Maybe not to the intensity she had, but enough that it would soon become a main topic of conversation.

Charlotte took one last look around before she scurried off. She had the odd feeling that something horrible was about to happen, but she had no idea what. However, one thing was for certain.

She wasn't that worried about working alone on toiletries anymore.
13212.title: A sudden sense of foreboding.

132122.content:
When she ermerged back out onto the shop floor downstairs, Charlotte was quickly approached by Rebekah, who seemed concerned... even apprehensive about something. "Charlotte, something weird just happened, you should have seen it..." the blonde employee started in a frantic tone.

"Let me guess, colors all around you and a chill up your spine?" Charlotte responded, a frown still etched on her face.

"How did you..." Rebekah gasped.

"It happened to me upstairs while I was in the toilets." Charlotte explained. "I thought I was tripping at first, but when that shiver went up my spine and into my head, I don't know... I just have this terrible feeling something bad is going to happen." she continued.

"Me too!" Rebekah nodded slowly, glancing around.

The two of them caught sight of Nicola and Rob, working on their respective aisles, and they looked a little 'confused' as well. Clearly, whatever had just happened - had occurred throughout the entire store.

Suddenly, the click clack of high heels heralded Elizabeth's arrival nearby. Charlotte immediately made a move towards the toiletries section, not wanting to get told off for 'slacking' again. But she was curious... She stopped and instead waited for her manager to round the corner. Then she decided to ask her something. "Did something strange just happen to you?"

Elizabeth's eyes narrowed a little, she seemed edgy too. "Define 'strange'." she said.

"A display of colors all around, a cold shiver up your spine into your head, and a feeling deep down that something is going to happen." Charlotte repeated herself.

Elizabeth didn't immediately reply. "Yes, but don't be concerned. It might be the faulty air conditioning releasing fumes or something. I've phoned head office and asked them to send someone out tomorrow to look at it." she said to Charlotte. "I've also told Liz to get a few carbon monoxide detectors off the shelf and to get one of the lads to fit them on the ceiling through the shop."

"Fumes?" Charlotte mumbled incredulously.

"Just get back to work please Charlotte. I'm sure there's nothing to worry about." Elizabeth sighed, before walking away and behind the Help Desk to check something on the computer.

Charlotte just shook her head, shrugged... and rolled her eyes at Rebekah.
132122.title: Staff interactions.

1321221.content:
Work is one powerful aphrodisiac.

Charlotte couldn't remember the actual quote, but she thought that this described her day pretty well. At first, she did her work quietly and without complaint. Her mind was still on that strange, acid trip-like vision. She only knew one thing about it.

That was some lame-ass excuse by Elizabeth.

But after maybe ten minutes, the stress of the work day caught up and she was back to grumbling. Working on it alone? In a job that she felt was really meant for three people? Charlotte got the feeling that Liz just really didn't like her.

Maybe an hour or so of labor in, her backup had finally arrived.

"Nice of you to come." Charlotte muttered, trying to not to lace too much venom in her voice.

"Nice to see you in a good mood." Luke replied with an offhanded shrug. The trivializing shrug that made Charlotte involuntarily clench her fists.

Still, she held back her anger. "Just... get to work."

Luke pursed his lips and nodded. Charlotte and him mixed like oil and water. His easygoing "nothing matters" personality clashed with her sometimes "drama queen" level of intensity. Whenever Charlotte would whine, rather than snarking back, telling her to shut up, or even sympathizing; Luke would just shrug it off.

Once again, she was positive that Liz just really didn't like her.
1321221.title: Charlotte starts work.

13212212.content:
Meanwhile, in the DIY aisle, Steven was up the top of a ladder fitting a carbon monoxide detector to the ceiling. Liz was holding the ladder steady for him as he reached up. Liz didn't want him falling off... again. "Why am I doing this again?" Steven grunted, as he fiddled with the detector, trying to make the thing stick to the foam ceiling tile.

"Because Elizabeth wants it done. End of discussion." Liz replied bluntly.

"Yeah I know, but... you think a few fumes could cause all those freaky lights and that chill we all felt?" Steven muttered skeptically. He thought the whole reason for putting these detectors up was crap.

"I don't know." Liz sighed. "It won't hurt to have them set up in any case."

When he was done, Steven carefully descended the ladders and folded them up, carrying them to the last spot where a detector needed to be fitted. The fitting only took a few minutes, and when that was finished Steven took the ladders in the back and Liz resumed her rounds, checking up on the other staff. It was obvious that whatever had happened had unnerved everybody, Liz included.

Moments later, Steven arrived back on his section and carried on working. But he just didn't feel right. He couldn't put his finger on it, but there was something definitely 'off'. It was like something was hanging in the air, waiting to drop like the Sword of Damocles.

"Hey Steven, you okay?" Rebekah asked as she nipped down Steven's aisle.

"Oh, hey Becky." he mumbled, though he failed to make eye contact. "Yeah, I'm okay." he nodded. Though he obviously wasn't. Rebekah didn't push though, because she knew what he was feeling like. Instead she just smiled at him, then continued on her way.
13212212.title: Elsewhere in the store

132122123.content:
Steven wasn't the only one who felt things were off, who felt a sense of impending doom. Elizabeth herself, who was doing rounds, felt an odd sense of foreboding run through her body.

She shook her head. "Faulty air conditioning." What BS. She doubted anyone had bought it for a minute. Still, it was the only explanation she could come up with on short notice. As manager, it came with the job to keep order, and giving everyone some explanation, no matter how contrived seemed the best way to go about it.

"Elizabeth." Liz announced as she approached. "The carbon monoxide detectors are up and running."

"Thank you." Elizabeth said offhandedly. "Continue your rounds."

Liz looked as if she was about to say something else, but she relented.

"Understood."

Elizabeth watched as Liz disappeared down the aisles. She doubted that Liz brought the "faulty air conditioning" story either. At least she obeyed, that was nice, even if she wished that Liz would loosen up around her.

Elizabeth continued toward her office. She sincerely hoped that the lights and headaches were nothing...
132122123.title: Elizabeth's thoughts.

1321221232.content:
Back on toiletries, it was like Charlotte and Luke had taken a vow of silence. Not another word had been muttered between the two of them, and both were focusing on their jobs for once. But all the time they were both filled with an impending sense of dread, and neither knew why. All they knew was that they wanted this day to be over ASAP.

Luke had just finished 'throwing' some bars of soap onto a shelf, when he started getting to his feet. All of a sudden he began feeling strange. The feeling was accompanied by a strange tingling sensation in his hands. The spare box of soap he was carrying suddenly got heavier and he found himself unable to hold onto it. It fell to the floor with a thud.

Simultaneously, Charlotte started knocking over some deodorant cans as her hands also began tingling. The hell... as she pulled her hands from between the shelves and shook them, waiting for the tingling to subside.

After about a minute or two, the weird feeling went off, and Luke bent down to pick the box up he had dropped. But for some reason it seemed a little bigger as he tried to lift it. He frowned... and then he noticed the purple nail polish on the end of his fingers. "Holy..." he mumbled, standing up straight and lifting his hands up in front of him. They were a lot smaller than they had been... more... feminine.

That was when Luke saw Charlotte recoil at the sight of her own hands, falling onto her ass as she stared at them in horror. Charlotte's hands had grown in size, become more 'coarse' and her nail polish had vanished.

"Charlotte..." Luke gulped, getting his co-worker's attention for a second. "What's happened??" he asked her.

"Oh my... GOD!" Charlotte cried out when she saw Luke's new hands. She recognized them immediately... as hers.

For both of them, the feeling of foreboding had been instantly replaced with one of disbelief and shock.
1321221232.title: Back with Charlotte and Luke.

13212212323.content:
"Are you sure we-"

"I don't know. Everything will be fine." Liz growled, causing Jessica to flinch. Liz didn't mean to lose her temper, but after hearing the same question over and over again, it became very grating.

"And you there." Liz pointed at Liam, causing him to flinch. "Get back to work."

Liam immediately scurried back to his post. Liz took a long exhale before she turned back to Jessica.

"Look, I'm sorry about that. I'm just as much in the dark as you are. For that matter, I really doubt Elizabeth knows anything either."

Jessica nodded slowly. Satisfied, she went back to work.

Liz continued her rounds. Wherever she had gone, it had been the same questions. First starting with Steven and then ending with Jessica just now. What caused the multicolored light show and chill down the spine?

Why did something like this have to come up? It was looking to be such a good day, too. She got up early and feeling refreshed, got to work early, and the two newbies she got today looked to actually be nice people for once. Then this thing had to come and disrupt her tempo.

Well, she might as well get used to this, she had a few more posts to check before she would loop back around. Next up was Luke and Charlotte...
13212212323.title: Liz is terribly distracted.

132122123233.content:
Liz's tour of the aisles was interrupted suddenly when there was a knocking on the front window. She made her way there and was surprised to see Carly and her best friend Zoe standing there. It was obvious both had just finished work at the salon and they had dropped by for some reason. "Hi Liz, my mum asked me to drop by and pick up any old pay slips she may have missed here when she left." Carly smiled, revealing why she was there.

"Oh, okay. Yeah I'll run up and get them. Take a seat if you want." Liz replied, gesturing to the many seats around, including the ones that the cashiers sat on during the day.

"Thanks Liz." Carly said gratefully.

As soon as Liz had disappeared upstairs for a moment, Zoe looked around and shuddered. "Brrr, is it cold in here or what?" she asked Carly, as she paced back and forth.

"Colder than usual I think." Carly responded, rubbing her arms.

As the two beauticians progressed further into the store to browse some of the goods, they didn't hear the lock on the door automatically click behind them. "We should pop in here at lunch tomorrow and buy some more nail varnish Zoe, we're running low." Carly suggested.

"We need some more wax strips too." Zoe murmured as she fiddled with her phone.

Meanwhile upstairs, Liz had rumaged through all the drawers and filing cabinets, gathering up all of Andrea's old pay slips. With that done she made her way back downstairs to find Carly and Zoe.
132122123233.title: Carly and Zoe drop by

choices: Someone walks by and Zoe/Carly get another weird feeling
1321221232333.content:
Looking over the shopping list she had on her cellphone, Zoe was about to suggest they also buy some hand cream. However, she suddenly froze. A strange tingle slowly crawled up her spine. When it went up her neck and crawled into her head-

Boom!

The world exploded into color. Red, blue, green purple. It was like a firework had gone off inches in front of her. The tingle grew into a dull ache, growing stronger and stronger until she felt a scream rise through her throat-

And then it abruptly stopped. The pain, the explosions vanished and she, once again, found herself standing in the store, staring at the cellphone in her hand as if nothing happened.

She blinked a couple times, and then looked around. Nothing about her surroundings had changed. There were still rows upon rows of shampoo and conditioner bottles lying on the shelves, extending off into the distance.

Her eyes fell on Carly, who stared forward with a blank look on her face.

"Carly. Carly! Are you okay?"

Carly blinked a couple of times and then shook her head.

"No, no, I'm fine, just saw something... weird." She nodded. "Acid trip level weird."
1321221232333.title: Zoe starts feeling 'funny'.

13212212323333.content:
"This is NOT happening!!" Charlotte freaked out on Luke as she continued staring at her new hands. Luke had already identified them as his, just as Charlotte had identified Luke's new hands as hers... as if he needed her to. The purple nail polish gave it away. "What the fuck is this? Why??" she gasped.

"No idea." Luke shrugged, acting pretty much as relaxed as he always did, despite the swap.

Charlotte was at a total loss what to do. "We should tell Liz what's happened, ...show her. I mean... she can't accuse us of making it all up." she suggested to Luke in a panic, as she put her hands behind her back briefly, as if by hiding them the problem would go away.

"And what can Liz do??" Luke responded.

Charlotte snapped at that point. "At least I'm trying to think of something to do instead of stood there looking fucking stupid." she barked, while at the same time trying to keep her tone down a little. She didn't want any of the others seeing her like this. She couldn't have known that her swapping hands with Luke was just the start of it. Things were about to get a whole lot weirder, both for Charlotte and Luke, and for everyone else in the store.

"Charlotte... you need to calm down." Luke advised as he frowned at Charlotte.

Charlotte just sighed and then started grumbling under her breath, pacing back and forth.

Looking around, Luke was also unsure of what to do next. But he did know he needed a piss. "I'm going to the toilet." he stated casually, causing Charlotte to spin around and stare wide eyed at him.

"No you're not! You're not touching your 'thing' with MY hands." she told him straight.

Luke bit his lower lip. He could see why that could actually upset her. "Well you can come and hold it for me if you want?" he quipped, which only served to infuriate Charlotte more.

"LUKE!! Take this fucking seriously!" she wagged one of her manly fingers at him.

Luke fell silent, not wanting to make Charlotte any more angry than she already was.
13212212323333.title: Charlotte is still freaking out

choices: Carly and Zoe get another weird feeling.
132122123233332.content:
Zoe pursed her lips. "Did you feel a tingle up your spine, and then see some flashing lights?"

"Yeah, I did. How did you-" Carly raised an eyebrow. "You saw it too, didn't you?"

Zoe gave a stiff nod. Both of them felt it? That was... odd, to put it in mild terms. What did it mean though? Did... someone put hallucinogen's in the air conditioning unit?

No, that was pretty unlikely. Much to Zoe's shame, there was one time in her youth where she gave drugs a shot, LSD to be specific. She hadn't taken anymore since then, but she knew from that experience that this was NOT drugs.

The room seemed to have grown a couple of degrees colder. And a sense of foreboding crept through her. The type she got when Kay tricked them into watching those slasher movies and one of the characters was about to die...

Carly seemed to have a similar feeling, as she turned back to Zoe, face ashen.

"Right after Liz comes back, we're leaving." Carly said. Zoe rapidly nodded in response. They hadn't exactly run out of hand cream, nail varnish, or wax strips yet. They could last a day, heck, Zoe could go buy some on her way back.

Really, though, if they fled right at that moment, it would've been too late.
132122123233332.title: Carly and Zoe recover.

1321221232333322.content:
When Liz finally returned from upstairs, she found Carly and Zoe looking a little 'troubled'. They wore the same expression that she had seen on the faces of her employees. "Is... everything alright?" she mumbled, handing Carly her mother's old pay slips.

Carly took them and slipped them in her purse, then she answered Liz's question. "To tell the truth, no we've been better. We just had a 'moment'." she said, as Zoe nodded.

"Um... let me guess, colored lights, nausea and a cold chill up your spine?" Liz's eyes narrowed.

"But... how did you know?" Zoe inquired.

Liz let out a sigh. "Everyone here experienced the same thing a while ago, including me. It was bloomin' weird." she explained. "And now everyone is walking around expecting something bad to happen."

"Seriously?" Carly forced out a chuckle, even though she also had that impending sense of dread.

"Sounds like paranoia to me." Zoe added her voice to the conversation again... nervously.

Liz nodded. "Yeah, you're probably right. Anyway, is that all you came for?" she asked Carly, as Zoe began looking around her like she was expecting someone or something to jump her."

"Hm hm." Carly nodded. Then as Liz set off walking towards the exit, Carly followed, her high heels clicking on the floor. Zoe brought up the rear. "Tell your mum I said hi will you." Liz smiled at Carly.

"Will do." Carly nodded.

At that moment...
1321221232333322.title: Liz returns.

choices: Liz runs off to tell Elizabeth.
Elizabeth realizes the phones aren't working.
13212212323333221.content:
Liz just happened to turn her head forward at the right moment to stop herself from colliding against the automatic sliding doors. For some strange reason, despite being nearly an inch away, they had not opened.

"Um, Liz?" Carly said as she and Zoe slowed to a stop, looking quizzically at the exit.

Liz let out a sigh. Great, more things to fix. And unlike the carbon monoxide detectors, she would actually need to call a specialist. Elizabeth was going to be ecstatic to hear about this.

Still, Liz didn't allow any of these emotions to appear on her face, as she gave both her charges a warm smile.

"Oh, it seems to be broken." she said as she walked over to the push door...

...which didn't yield.

"Huh?" Liz tried to push against it again. Didn't budge.

"Hm..." She went to try the other push door. Once again, it did not budge in the slightest...

"Liz?" Zoe asked, kneeling down to examine the door across from her. "You might want to see this."

Liz walked over, her eyes following Zoe's finger. The doors were welded shut. Nay, it almost looked as if these were walls rather than doors. It was a smooth transition between the door and the rest of the wall.

Furthermore, now that Liz paid some attention to the glass, she didn't have any perspective on the outdoors. Almost as if all the glass had been replaced with a painting.

"Well." Liz slowly said. "We might have a problem."
13212212323333221.title: ...the door wouldn't open.

choices: Liz checks a nearby fire exit.
132122123233332211.content:
Liz left the two beauticians standing by the door as she went to find Elizabeth, who was in the Goods Inwards area tapping on the wall-mounted phone repeatedly. "Elizabeth, we have another problem." Liz said, a little out of breath.

"Yes I think we do." Elizabeth murmured, as she put the receiver down. "The phones are out. No signal whatsoever." she said.

Liz looked that little bit more panicked hearing that news. But then she informed Elizabeth what else had been occurring. "Yeah well, the doors seem to be welded shut, and... I just looked out of the window and..."

"What...?"

"It's as though there's no outside, it's like someone's stuck a bloomin' great oil painting in front of the building." she finished telling her manager.

"So we're stuck in here, with no way to contact anyone?" Elizabeth muttered, biting her lower lip.

"Pretty much, yeah. Oh and Carly and Zoe are here too. They dropped by the pick up Andrea's remaining pay slips, and now they're stuck too. Someone or... something doesn't want us leaving." Liz's eyes were wide with alarm. "I don't think we should tell the others yet, it will only panic them further." Liz then suggested, and Elizabeth readily agreed.

Just then the rapid approach of footsteps heralded Charlotte's arrival behind the two senior staff. They both turned to look at her, and at Luke who was some way behind her, not moving nearly as fast. "Liz... you've got to see this."

"Charlotte, slow down, what's wrong?" Elizabeth reacted quickly

Charlotte held up her hands in front of her two superiors... only to then turn them around and frown. Her hands were back to normal, her familiar purple nail polish on the ends of her fingers. What the fuck...

"Hey, I got them back." Luke exclaimed vaguely behind Charlotte, holding his own hands up. Then he slowly wandered off as though nothing had happened.

"What is it Charlotte?" Liz asked her staff member.

Charlotte just shook her head and continued looking at her hands. Had she and Luke both imagined it? It didn't seem possible they'd both been tripping. Eventually Charlotte looked at Liz and swallowed. "Um... it's nothing." she mumbled, suddenly feeling very stupid. There was an underlying feeling however that she was being 'toyed' with.

"Charlotte!" Liz sighed angrily. "Don't waste our time! And get back to work."

Not uttering another word, an utterly perplexed Charlotte did as she was told and went back to work.
132122123233332211.title: Liz runs off to tell Elizabeth.

choices: Carly and Zoe begin to panic.
1321221232333322113.content:
Liz watched Charlotte disappear out the door. She may have yelled at Charlotte, but she couldn't shake that look of panic in her and Luke's eyes. It looked so genuine. Had something happened that she didn't see?

She smothered those feelings. She had more important things to worry about.

"I'll check the fire exits." She said, and before Elizabeth could state her approval, she was off, taking a right turn and running down the row of lockers.

"Please be open." She muttered just as she turned the last corner.

Her heart dropped. The fire exit... or what was left of the fire exit, looked like a painting of a fire exit that someone drew on the wall. She could feel the cold metal and the smooth glass, but it was all 2D. No depth to it. The scenery outside, once again, just looked like some highly realistic oil painting.

Her heart rate picked up and she felt sweat on her back. What was going on? What thing had the power to so thoroughly trap them like this? Hell, to manipulate the very shape of the store. What did it want with them?

She took a gasp of air in and then hurried back to the Goods-in area. By the time she returned, Elizabeth had given up on the phone and was pacing back and forth.

"Fire exit no good?" Elizabeth asked.

Liz just nodded in response. "We're trapped in here."
1321221232333322113.title: Liz checks a nearby fire exit.

13212212323333221133.content:
"Carly, what's happening?" Zoe said in a panicked tone. "I have to get back to Chris and Arissia." she added, referring to her husband and four-year old daughter.Being stuck in Wilkos by a mysterious force was not on her schedule. Then again, it wasn't on Carly's either, or anyone else's. The added niggle was the fact that neither Carly or Zoe worked in the store.

"I don't know. But let's try and stay calm." responded Carly. But her own panic was evident. She ran her fingers through her stylish blonde hair and and walked towards the help desk to try the phone. It was dead. "Nothing..." she mumbled, holding the receiver out by her side as she looked at Zoe. Walking back over to her friend, Carly's shoulders slumped and a long sigh escaped her lips. "I suggest we make ourselves as comfortable as we can." she suggested.

That was easier said than done given the sense of foreboding hanging over them. It was impossible to relax, as the Wilkos employees had found out.

"I'll go and get us a drink of water." Zoe muttered, before heading upstairs to the tea room alone.

Carly decided to see where Liz had disappeared to, and so she set off through the aisles, stiletto heels clicking on the floor as she went. It was at that point she saw Steven working on his section and so she proceeded to walk over to him. "Hey Steven, things pretty weird around here huh?" she said.

Steven was surprised to see Carly. "Oh... hey love, how's you? he smiled, trying to shrug off his own sense of dread.

"I was fine until I got stuck in here." Carly answered, folding her arms.

Steven's eyebrow arched in astonishment. "Stuck?"

Carly nodded. "Yeah, the doors are welded shut and we can't see outside anymore." she informed him. This was the news that Elizabeth and Liz didn't want the other staff to know about, for obvious reasons. But now Carly had let Steven know.

"That's... um... scary." Steven admitted, as he broke a cardboard box down. His work at least was keeping him somewhat occupied.

Carly just nodded in agreement.
13212212323333221133.title: Carly and Zoe begin to panic.

choices: Someone else had snuck into the store while no one was looking...
132122123233332211333.content:
Meanwhile, in the secluded area of the store near the plumbing section, "Waggy" and Aaron were completely oblivious to the stress that Liz, Elizabeth, and some of their coworkers were going through. Sure, they had seen the weird light show like everyone else had, but they had both chalked it up to "stress."

They worked in almost complete silence, not out of dislike for one another, but out of respect for each other's space. Neither of them had anything in common and they both knew that.

"Aaron, please put this on the top shelf." Waggy held out a pipe... thing that she did not remember the name of out to Aaron.

"Sure." Aaron said absentmindedly as he took it.

Regrettably for Waggy, she was just a couple of inches short of reaching the upper shelves. It had been a point of irritation for both the workers this entire shift.

But just as Aaron reached up to put the pipe on the shelf, a weird feeling came over him. Almost like a tingle, but it almost felt as if his insides, specifically his spine, was rearranging. It was not a bad feeling, but a strange one.

Suddenly, the top shelf grew farther and farther away. Aaron tried to get up on tiptoes, but soon it was out of reach, his hand grazing just the bottom of the shelf he needed to put it on.

"Um, Waggy?" Aaron said. He probably should've been shocked, freaking out about this, but he was having a delayed reaction.

"Hm, yes?" Waggy stopped rummaging through the box and stood up. "I..."

For a moment, Waggy and Aaron just stared at each other. Unlike what was normal, Aaron stared up at Waggy whilst Waggy stared down at Aaron.

"Oh, my..." Waggy muttered, holding up her hands.
132122123233332211333.title: The ball finally starts rolling...

1321221232333322113331.content:
At the beginning of the shift, Rob had been paired with Becca on the pet food section, much to his chagrin, and now he was suffering from a mild headache because of the girl's constant chattering. No wonder she hasn't got a boyfriend... Rob grumbled as he emptied a box onto the shelf.

"Anyway, do you know what she said to him then?" Becca went on and on, 'regaling' Rob with a story from her past that he wasn't the slightest bit interested in.

"Do tell!" Rob groaned sarcastically.

Becca set off talking again, but part of the way through she had to clear her throat. Rob noticed that Becca's voice seemed to drop in pitch slightly. She still continued talking however... only to stop again seconds later. "What's wrong... with my voice?" Becca muttered... the last word was in a distinctly male voice. "What the hell is going on?" she then said, in a voice that sounded eerily familiar to Rob.

The two stared at each other, then Rob swallowed, almost afraid to speak. But he knew he had to. "Becca?" he mumbled... in the voice that had been annoying him for the last half hour.

"You sound like me!" Becca said in her lower pitch.

"And you... like me." Rob muttered as he stood up straight. "We... we swapped voices?"

Becca nodded. "Seems like." she mumbled.

"But... how?" Rob squeaked in Becca's higher, irritating voice.

"We need to report this." Becca stated, as she ran her hand over her neck. She was sure she could feel an Adams Apple.

"Ya think??" Rob huffed. He didn't know which was worse, that he had somehow switched voices with a girl... or that he had Becca's voice in particular. Things like this didn't just happen. They had to tell Elizabeth about this.
1321221232333322113331.title: More strangeness in other aisles.

13212212323333221133311.content:
Unlike some of the other workers, Helen and Shaun actually worked together in an amicable fashion. They were far from being friends, but pretty soon after Shaun had been hired on, the two learnt that they actually had enough in common to hold a decent conversation.

"Any plans for formalizing your relationship with her?" Helen asked as she lifted another box off of the floor and onto a shelf.

"No, not really." Shaun said as he ran a mop across the floor. "She wants to take it at her own pace."

"Maybe she's just afraid of commitment." Helen muttered.

The two of them were in the home improvement aisle. Sometime earlier that day, after an incident involving a couple kids, a rogue shopping cart, some paint cans, and a bottle of soda; there was a huge mess on the floor. The two of them drew the short straw and so it was up to them to clean it up.

Privately, they wondered if this incident would be remembered in the workplace for years to come...

At least it would have if an even more unbelievable event hadn't occurred.

As Helen bent over to pick up a discarded paint can, a tingle ran through her body. This was followed by another strange feeling that she could only describe as if she were being pumped full of water. Indeed she must've been expanding, as she felt her formerly baggy clothes grow tighter on her body.

As soon as it started, it stopped, leaving a confused Helen.

"Shaun, did-" She froze. Shaun was skinnier, his clothing hung from his body in a comical fashion.

Shaun blinked when he saw Helen. She was buff, for a woman. Her poor, stretched clothing clearly outlined her muscles.

"Uh..." They looked to each other and then at themselves. For a brief moment, silence prevailed.

Thankfully, the two of them were pretty level headed people, so Helen came to the logical conclusion.

"We should tell Elizabeth about this..."
13212212323333221133311.title: Another swap occurs elsewhere.

132122123233332211333113.content:
While Carly and Steven were continuing to chat, they suddenly heard a ruckus on one of the other aisles. "Whose voice is that?" Carly asked, thinking it odd that someone should be shouting and arguing with one of their co-workers.

"It's Becca's," Steven shrugged, "she's probably arguing with Rob about something."

"They always argue?" Carly asked.

Steven threw her a certain stare. "Becca never shuts up, she gets on everyone's nerves eventually." he informed Carly. Of course Steven didn't know that the voice they were hearing most wasn't Becca's anymore, it was Rob's.

"So anyway, how've you been?" Carly then inquired, striking up a more pleasant conversation with her friend.

"Hmm, not bad. Things are fairly quiet, but that's the way I like it." Steven smiled.

Carly rolled her eyes. "Not that quiet by the sounds of it." she smirked, referring to the raised voice of 'Becca'.

"Just ignore her, she'll shut up eventually." Steven laughed. Then he started asking Carly how her salon was doing, how her personal life was, how her new boyfriend was and how he treated her, etc. Steven got that embroiled in chatting to Carly that he forgot about his work for a while. Five minutes later, Zoe finally returned from upstairs with two glasses of water. "Sorry for the wait, needed to pee as well." she apologized, handing a glass to Carly.

"We thought you were digging a well or something." Steven joked, receiving a nudge in the arm from Zoe in return.

"Oh well, my work isn't going to do itself I suppose." Steven grumbled, glancing around at the empty and half empty boxes on the floor.

"Don't let us stop you." Zoe chuckled, taking a sip of water.

The three of them, and the rest of the as yet unnaffected staff were completely oblivious to what was happening elsewhere. Rob and Becca were continuing to 'debate' their situation, shouting in each other's voices. Waggy was secretly beginning to like being taller than Aaron and most of the other employees (except for Luke, Mark and Steven), and Helen was busy flexing her new muscles while a stunned Shaun just watched in disbelief.

And things had only just begun...
132122123233332211333113.title: Carly and Steven talk.

1321221232333322113331132.content:
Liz turned the corner at the plumbing section. She threw a glance around, sighed in relief when she saw nothing, and then set off again.

Elizabeth had taken the news that the emergency exit was sealed off surprisingly well. In her practiced managerial voice, she said that they should probably start their rounds again. Be on the lookout for more weirdness and (hopefully) some means by which they could escape the cage that the store had become.

So, here she was.

What was she supposed to find, though? From a couple of those slasher films that Eric had pranked her with in her more naive years, Liz feared that around the next corner, she might find one of her coworkers, killed and hanging from the ceiling. Certainly, the situation she was in seemed to fit that-

"What the he-!"

Aaron's shout was abruptly cut off. For a couple of beats, Liz stood still. Then on reflex, she broke into a run. The aisles rushed past her as she took a right, then a left, and then ran right into Aaron and Waggy, standing right off in the corner.

Aaron and Waggy were still very much alive (thank god!), but the two's appearance caused Liz to freeze in shock. While before, Waggy was the same height as Liz, give or take an inch, she now practically towered over her, while Aaron's eyes were just level with Liz's eyebrows.

The two stared at Liz for a moment before Waggy broke the silence.

"We have something to report."
1321221232333322113331132.title: Liz investigates a commotion.

13212212323333221133311323.content:
Elizabeth had taken the opposite side of the store to Liz, and the first two employees she came across were Mark and Jade. The latter was learning the ropes off the former of course. "Everything alright you two?" Elizabeth asked them.

Mark paused from his task a minute, giving it a moment's thought. "Apart from the constant feeling that something's about to happen, yeah." he shrugged.

Jade nodded silently, waving at Elizabeth. "Hope you're keeping him working." Elizabeth chuckled at the newbie.

"Hey!" Mark frowned.

"Carry on, and... come and find me if you see anything 'weird' happening okay." Elizabeth then informed the two of them. Her tone seemed suspicious. Mark realized that even their manager was expecting something untoward to happen as well. That didn't really fill him with confidence. He let out a sigh, then nervously glanced at Jade before continuing to lift boxes onto a cage.

Meanwhile, Elizabeth made her way to the aisle where Shaun and Helen were working together. As with Liz at the other side of the store, Elizabeth was totally unprepared for what she saw. "Oh... my!" she gasped, as Helen and Shaun both looked at her.

"Elizabeth... I don't... I mean... we don't know what happened." Helen mumbled in her demure tone.

Elizabeth looked over the quite muscular physique 45-year old Helen now possessed. Her Wilkos shirt was taut across her breasts, shoulders and arms. Even her pants seemed tighter on her now muscular legs. Elizabeth was speechless...

"What kind of shit is going on in this place?" Shaun grumbled, causing Elizabeth to look at him. In contrast to Helen, Shaun's clothes were now much looser on his body, which clearly lacked any kind of muscle.

Elizabeth just shook her head at Shaun. "I have no idea." She was stating the obvious. "Erm... I need to go and do something." she thought up a poor excuse to leave the aisle and her two swapped employees behind. Elizabeth hurried back in the direction of the help desk, her high heels clicking on the floor as she ran. She hoped Liz would be there for her to talk to.
13212212323333221133311323.title: Meanwhile, on Elizabeth's end.

132122123233332211333113231.content:
Just like before, Charlotte and Luke worked quietly. However, whilst the previous atmosphere had an underlying air of hostility came from two opposite personalities clashing, this time, a dark, foreboding cloud seemed to hang over them.

Neither of them said it to each other, but they were both united in the belief that the mischief that occurred with their hands was in no way a drug-induced hallucination. Something bigger was definitely afoot here. It was a strange, unifying factor between the two of them as they threw paranoid glances in opposite directions down the hallway.

This arrangement abruptly ended when Charlotte put down her tools.

"Bathroom."

"Knock yourself out." Luke replied.

Charlotte walked as fast as she could without running. While she really needed to go, she also wanted to spend some time away from the toiletries section. Spend some time pondering what she just saw.

She ducked to the side as she heard the sound of a miniature stampede approaching her. Just down at other end of the aisle, she saw Becca and Rob racing towards her.

"What is that about?" Charlotte wondered, unaware that the frantic voices she heard belonged to the opposite people.
132122123233332211333113231.title: Meanwhile, on Charlotte's section.

1321221232333322113331132311.content:
After Rob and Becca had passed, narrowly avoiding trampling on Charlotte, things seemed to fall quiet. Charlotte resumed her trip to the door that lead upstairs, only to stop in her tracks after a few more steps. A brief dizziness overcame her, then she felt what felt like a knot in her stomach. She winced and put her hand to her abdomen as she bent over slightly. "Oof!" she mumbled. She'd never felt like this before.

She managed to keep walking, unaware that behind her on the toiletries aisle... Luke was experiencing the same kind of feeling. Charlotte stopped halfway upstairs and adjusted her trousers. "What the hell..." she grumbled. She was feeling a 'bloated' feeling that extended down to her groin, which was tingling.

By the time she got into the toilets, Charlotte's face was flushed and she staggered over to the mirror, leaning on the sink. Suddenly there was a peculiar 'swelling' sensation in her crotch. It was as though there was something in her knickers... a 'something' that seemed to be part of her.

She looked down, her brow furrowing intensely as she prodded her swollen groin... and it seemed to swell a little more.

Charlotte quickly unfastened her trousers and pushed them down to her knees, along with her knickers.

A blood-curdling scream echoed out in the ladies toilets... while downstairs on the shop floor - an equally horrified Luke was actually reaching around in his trousers frantically trying to locate his 'equipment'.

It was definitely gone...
1321221232333322113331132311.title: Charlotte suddenly feels weird.

choices: Back at the front, Steven, Carly and Zoe languish
13212212323333221133311323113.content:
"Elizabeth!"

The manager of Wilkos couldn't help but let out a sigh. Once again, Becca's natural loudness preceded her. She didn't mind the girl so much, but she really wished at times that she could be much less chatty, more quiet, and wouldn't bother her over minor affairs.

"Elizabeth!"

She straightened up a little. That time it was Rob's voice. She did assign the both of them to the same section but... what were they both doing here? Didn't she make it explicit that only one of them was to leave the section at a time.

"Yes?" Elizabeth turned to face the two. Both slowed to a stop, clutching their knees and panting.

Did their breaths sound a little out of sync with their mouth movements?

"Something horrible has happened!"

Wait, what?

Elizabeth twitched. For a moment, she could have sworn that Becca's mouth moved when she heard Rob's voice.

"Our voices have been swapped!"

Okay, that time it was Becca's voice out of Rob's mouth...

No, she was the manager! Elizabeth needed to set an example in front of her subordinates. She took a deep breath in to calm herself.

"How?"

"We're not sure, we were doing nothing, just minding out own business putting up tin cans on the shelf when suddenly. I got this strange feeling and... poof!" Becca demonstrated her point by spreading her fingers. "We swapped voices!"

Elizabeth nodded slowly. "Anything to add, Rob?"

Rob shook his head.

While such a phenomenon had occurred, it was increasingly obvious that Elizabeth wouldn't get much in the way of information from the two. She felt a pit in her stomach when she wondered if this might be widespread...
13212212323333221133311323113.title: Becca and Rob locate Elizabeth.

132122123233332211333113231131.content:
When Nicola approached the restroom door she thought she heard a quiet sobbing from within. She didn't want to intrude on someone's privacy, even though they were in the ladies room, and so she knocked on the door first. "Hello, who's in there?" she asked, and she instantly heard a shuffle of feet and the slamming of a cubicle door. Nicola took a deep breath and walked into the toilets.

She heard periodic sobs and sniffs from one of the three cubicles, and eventually she managed to work out who was in there. "Charlotte?" Nicola said, knocking on the cubicle door. She was obviously concerned.

"Go away!" Charlotte snapped back.

"Are you okay? Why are you crying?" Nicola asked. "Can I help love?

Charlotte was insistant. "NO! Just... leave me alone." the girl cried, eliciting a worried frown from Nicola. She had a couple of teenage children of her own, and she saw herself as a type of mother even to her teenage co-workers.

"Please Charlotte, just open the door. It's best not to keep things to yourself if they're making you upset." Nicola persisted.

There was a pause, then Charlotte spoke in a calmer voice. "You can't help me." she stated, sniffing again.

"I might be able to if you tell me what's....

At that moment the cubicle door flew open and Charlotte was stood there, cheeks reddened from crying too much and her trousers and underwear down around her ankles. Nicola's mouth dropped open in shock and horror when she saw an average-sized penis between Charlotte's legs, with two obvious testicles slung underneath. Oh god... Nicola thought, as she wondered what kind of reaction the scene in front of her warranted.

"I told you, you can't help me with THIS!" Charlotte growled, wiping her tears away.
132122123233332211333113231131.title: Meanwhile, someone enters the restroom

choices: Back with Carly, Zoe, and Steven
1321221232333322113331132311311.content:
"Ugh... this is getting bothersome." Liz quietly growled to herself.

Earlier she had been feeling fear, especially after she had talked to Aaron and Waggy. Somehow, the two of them had essentially swapped heights. She had no idea how such a thing could've happened. While searching around some more, she had run into Helen and Shaun and learned the two had swapped muscle mass.

Some time after that, between having to reassure employees that they were safe and yelling at Liam to get back to work, the novelty began to wear thin. Her fear was gradually replaced by irritation. She had already walked through all the pairs she could think of, and still no sign of Becca and Rob. What, had they gotten an embarrassing swap and now were too embarrassed to show their faces?

She looked down the aisle and...

Hark! Was there light down the tunnel?

Her manager and the two she had been looking for seemed to be having a very animated conversation.

Liz picked up the pace, rushing down the aisle towards the group.

"...Until further notice, please continue work. I will do my best to figure out what is going on."

The two gave affirmative noises and walked back the direction they came. Liz had only shown up for the tail end of the conversation.

Elizabeth looked up slightly and acknowledged Liz with a curt nod.

"Voices swapped." She preemptively answered Liz's unspoken question. "What have you seen on your end?"

After slowing to a stop, Liz told Elizabeth of the other two pairs she had found. Between the two of them, they both held the feeling that this was far from the last they would see of this...

1351.content:
It was a beautiful day...

...Last Tuesday. Today on the other hand, was a little less fair in the weather department, given the crash of thunder and the downpour of rain that sounded more like bullets raining down on the roof.

On this particular day, Steven was in the tea room of the Wilkos department store, trying his best to wring the water out of his uniform.

He had made a terrible mistake to think the wide-brimmed umbrella was enough.

"Hey." Rob pulled up a chair right up at Steven's table, setting down a hot cup of coffee.

Steven returned Rob's gesture with a smile and wave. Despite their age difference, the two found something that they could mutually bond over. Video games. Specifically, at this point, Mass Effect (with a sprinkling of Battlefront here and there).

It had almost become a ritual. Both of them usually arrived fairly early to work. As such, they spent the first twenty-thirty or so minutes going over their latest achievements.

"So, how is Mass Effect 3 so far?" Rob asked, leaning closer to Steven.

"Its great. Right now, I've just..."

And on and on they talked. This was one of the few times that Steven was thankful to live alone. Even if his budget was pretty tight, unlike Rob, he did not have his parents policing his wallet.

This was not to say those two were the only ones who arrived early. In fact, an unexpectedly large number of people got to the store early. Mona and Laura stood next to each other, the former leaning in to see something the latter had on her phone. Charlotte sat off on her own, sipping a cup of coffee and Luke and Aaron shared brief pleasantries before walking their separate ways. Even Liam had arrived early, to many raised eyebrows, soaked from head to toe from his unexpected shower. These were but a scant few of the people who occupied the tea room.

However, the tranquil scene eventually had to come to an end. Liz noted this as she took a few deep breaths outside the door, internally bracing herself to give a rousing speech before stepping in.

"Alright." she shouted in order to get everyone's attention. "I know that... that..."

Suddenly, a wave of drowsiness hit Liz. No, exhaustion was a better word. It was the type that not only made her muscles ache, but also clouded her mind. She stumbled about trying to stand up.

"You...What...Is..." she slurred he words as she lazily glanced around. She was not the only one to suffer from this malady. For Aaron and Luke had already hit the floor with a crash, Steven fought a losing battle with his eyelids, and Charlotte drunkenly spun in a circle, no doubt trying to fight the effect.

"I..." That was all that came out of Liz's mouth as she succumbed. She unceremoniously crumpled into a heap of limbs onto the floor. Soon, the whole room fell silent save for the quiet breathing associated with sleep.

Which meant no one was awake to see the blue light envelope the vicinity...
1351.title: Sounds great!

13511.content:
Steven was not sure what he was seeing.

It was a seizure inducing array of flashing lights that would have put the aurora borealis to shame. Occasionally a shape would appear. Large jellyfish-like shapes. The way they glistened made him think they were made of metal, but he was not sure.

Occasionally, he could make out other shapes. Tiny, stick-like....

Were those humans?

No, something about them. The way they moved, the way their heads were shaped was distinctly unhuman. Yet, they moved in large crowds, away from the light show.

For just a moment, the lights cleared up, and Steven saw what was actually going on.

It was a massacre. An orgy of death.

Corpses lay in piles, to the point he couldn't even see the ground. It was a mess of shattered bodies and limbs strewn out over a battlefield. The living, scarred, battered, and broken, crawled over the corpses in a vain attempt to get away.

Only one glimpse of this horrific image and then a red flash of light...

Steven awoke with a gasp, shooting up into a sitting position.

"I! Wha-! oh?" A deep sigh. "Just a dream."

For a couple moments, Steven just sat there, able to do little more than take breaths in, if only to calm down his pulsing heart. His head hurt badly, as if he had drank a few gallons of beer and passed out onto a concrete floor.

...But that was ridiculous. He never drank anything yesterday. Last he remembered, he was...

was...

For the first time since he woke up, he took in his surroundings. He was in an alleyway. The type that popular media showcased raping and muggings occurring in.

What am I doing here? He thought groggily.

He then frowned. For that matter, what was that soft thing his hand was touching?

He looked down...

Only to be confronted by two large 'pillows' attached to his chest.

Either that, or this was the biggest practical joke that had ever played on anyone in history and Liz was decked out in some realistic make-up.

She ruled out the practical joke thing when she reached up and felt one of her 'tentacles', and she felt is move ever so slightly, react to her touch. Liz quickly brought her hand back down and let out a deep sigh. She had to calm down.

And then there was the locale in which Liz found herself. A stunning city illuminated by the lights of commerce and trading, and a city that also sated the lusts of beings from countless species, in a number of ways... including sexually. Liz peered out of the large panoramic window in front of her at the trading area below. Aliens and humans were everywhere, interacting as normal business partners and friends.

The flying cars was partly what told Liz that she was no longer in her time, she had to be in the future. But where?? It certainly wasn't Earth by the looks of it.

"Excuse me Dr. T'Soni, but there's a Volus merchant requesting to speak with you." Another blue-skinned woman with a facial tattoo said as she walked into the office, startling Liz out of her trance."

"Er...a whosey whatsit?" Liz replied, shaking her head and frowning. She had no idea what a 'Volus' was even was.

And Liz had an idea this was only going to get weirder...
1351121313.title: Meanwhile, in a different district of Illium.

13511213132.content:
"Goddammit." Steven muttered as he took in his surroundings. He seemed to be in some sort of residential area as the shops had thinned out and he was now surrounded by Empire state building-sized apartment complexes. He could have sworn he passed by the one with the billboard that depicted a sunny meadow about three times.

Steven hated to admit it, but he was hopelessly lost.

Lost on an unknown planet in the middle of the night with next to nothing on me and being a girl on top of that? Could this day get any worse?

The universe was glad to answer Steven's questions.

Just as Steven took a turn into one of the smaller plazas, he suddenly became aware of two approaching figures. Two burly men, both with shaved heads and dressed in identical red suits leered at Steven. The one to the left was swarthy, whilst the one to the right was almost white as a sheet. Their hands glided to their belts.

Adrenaline seemed to wash over Steven as he turned around-

Only to bump into one more of the same attired man, this one more of a medium between the two in terms of skin color. He smiled and shook his head in Steven in a rather condescending manner. Out of each of their pockets, each man produced what seemed to be some futuristic pistol.

A laser gun?

Steven shot a wild glance at all of them.

"W-what do you want!?" Steven called out, utterly failing to hide his growing fear.

"Miranda Lawson." The dark-skinned thug grinned. "I am quite sure you know full well what we want."

All three men raised their guns.

"Careful." The lighter-skinned thug spoke in a scratchy voice. "No money unless she's breathing."
13511213132.title: Steven notices he has 'pursuers'.

choices: Rebekah continues her search for answers.
135112131322.content:
As Steven was busy facing off with his three would-be assailants, Liz had refused to meet with the Volus merchant, whoever he was, and she had sat down behind what was obviously her desk and was now staring at the computer in front of her. She figured that maybe searching whatever this world had in place of the Internet would be a good place to start finding some answers to all the questions she had.

But the computer looked way more advanced than anything she'd ever seen before. It was touchscreen of course, but most of the text seemed to be in a foreign (or rather alien) language. Liz's eyes scanned the screen as one of her hands caressed the swept back tentacles on her head. It was weird not having real hair... human hair.

Eventually, she was drawn to a 'button' at the lower right of the screen, and she tapped on it. The alien text on the computer instantly translated itself into English and Liz found herself able to read it. She began her search in earnest...

========

30 minutes later she had made some progress. She was on a world called Illium, in the Crescent Nebula of the Milky Way galaxy. It was a classic garden world, and one of many colonies founded by the Asari, the Azure-colored, all-female race that Liz apparently was now a member of. Liz had also discovered the name of the body she now inhabited... Doctor Liara T'Soni, an archaeologist. "She was born in... 2077??" Liz frowned, checking up on what the current date was, 2185. "Woah, wait a minute, I'm 108 years old?" Liz muttered to herself skeptically.

But further research revealed to Liz that she was 'young' by Asari standards, a mere Maiden.

========

"Thank you Nyxeris." Liz said as he assistant brought her in a drink.

"You're welcome. Oh... and the Volus merchant refuses to take no for an answer. He's still requesting to meet with you Doctor T'Soni." Nyxeris smiled. After quickly researching the 'Volus' species, Liz let out a sigh and sat back in her chair. "Fine, I'll see what he's got to say. Show him in please."

The fact was, Liz didn't know what else to do, or where to go. She knew nobody around her, everyone was a stranger. And she'd only get answers maybe if she talked to people, human or not...
135112131322.title: Liz searches for answers.

choices: Steven needs to run from the scene of the crime
1351121313222.content:
Steven's heart pumped like a jackhammer. No money unless she was breathing? What the hell did they mean? Did they...

A chill ran down Steven's spine. Did Miranda have a bounty on her?

One of the thugs took an experimental step forward, causing Steven to flinch and stumble backwards. As confident as these thugs were, they had received the memo. Miranda Lawson, ex-Cerberus employee. Biotic. One of the best in her field. Best to use extreme caution.

Steven sucked a breath in as a red dot of a laser sight materialized on his chest.

What do I do? What do I do? What do I do?

...

"Bah! To hell with this!" The red dot veered down to Steven's leg and the thug squeezed the trigger.

Something within Steven snapped.

He wasn't exactly sure what he did next or how he did it, but it felt as if he were flexing some unknown... one that he wasn't sure where to pinpoint in his body. He was suddenly sheathed in a blue aura which deflected every single shot.

"What the-"

And then all hell broke loose.

Every single thug opened fire, their blue laser shots ricocheting off the barrier and burning holes into the walls and floor. Yet, an icy calm seemed to take Steven. His body seemed to move on autopilot.

Steven flicked his wrist.

"Guagh!"

A blue missile struck the first thug in the chest, tearing through his clothes and into his chest. He flew backwards spraying blood as he went.

"You'll pay for that you bitch!"

Steven darted across the battlefield, shots ricocheting off of him, and planted a fist right into the face of another thug. The thug crumple to the ground, his hand loosening on his gun, allowing Steven to wrench it out of the man's hand. He then turned the gun on the last thug, burning two holes right into the man's head. He then aimed the gun at the groaning man on the ground and planted a few glowing bolts into him.

...

Steven's breathing slowly returned to normal and with it, the ice in his mind slowly began to melt. With a start, Steven realized what had happened. The cold, dispassionate look he had given to the mutilated corpses on the floor morphed into a look of horror.

"Oh god..."

A wave of nausea hit him as he stumbled to lean against a wall...
1351121313222.title: Steven is still cornered...

choices: Steven bumps into an acquiantance of Miranda's.
Liz is getting information from the Volus merchant.
13511213132221.content:
His breathing finally slowing, Steven looked down at the two large breasts heaving on his chest. He dropped the gun onto the ground and looked around, trying to think of what to do next. There were three bodies on the ground, and he was the one responsible. But he had more important things going through his (or rather Miranda's) head at that moment. Like... what the hell had just happened to him?

What was the blue aura around him? How did he conjure it? And mrore importantly, since the only fighting he had ever done was back in school with his fists, how was he able to take out three men so quickly?"

Hearing the faint engine of one of the many flying cars above him approaching, Steven knew he had to get out of here before security picked him up again. He knew he wouldn't be walking out of the HQ again after what he'd just done. He made a bolt from the scene, knowing he wouldn't have left any fingerprints on the gun because of of the tight black gloves he wore.

After fleeing in a random direction for about 10 minutes, and sticking to the back alleys, Steven finally stopped and took a seat on a step. From the increase in security activity around him, he knew the bodies had probably been found by now, and maybe he was now being hunted... by yet more people... or aliens, whatever. Then again, nobody had seen him kill those men, no cameras were there to witness him become a... 'murderer'? No, it was self-defense, I had no choice. Steven told himself, shaking his head and then sweeping his long black hair behind his ears.

After another few minutes of calming himself down, he decided to exit the alleway he was currently in, taking a precautionary look around first. He took a deep breath and started walking down the bustling Illium street.

Steven just had no idea what he should do next, his thought process had been totally derailed by his encounter with the three thugs. He wasn't really looking where he was going when he rounded a corner.
13511213132221.title: Steven needs to run from the scene of the crime

choices: Meanwhile, with Liz and the merchant.
135112131322211.content:
While Steven blindly fled the scene of his "crime," Rebekah had taken to wandering the streets of the mysterious city she had found herself in. At first, it was in mere confusion, a blind search to find someone who might give her answers. However, she soon found herself gazing in both wonder and awe at every futuristic thing she came across.

Is this the future?" She thought as she gazed in wonder at a young human couple who were talking to a holographic, female humanoid. "Or did I just end up in some faraway galaxy?

She quickly ducked to the side, just in time to dodge a large group of these large, hunched-backed, reptilian creatures. Five of them in total, and they all seemed to be wearing some sort of armor... or was that just "future clothing?" The biggest in the group, a tan scaled one, shot her a glare that caused her to flinch.

She didn't start moving again until the last one had disappeared around the next corner.

"How rude..." She muttered. She had seen all sorts of alien species, from blue-skinned women, to bird people, to lanky frog people... but these guys were by far the scariest. They just exuded a certain ferocity that made her instinctively want to flee, to take cover.

With these thoughts swirling through her mind, Rebekah was not paying attention when she turned the corner.

Two loud "Oofs!" echoed throughout the backstreets followed by a pair of thumps.

"Oh god! I'm sorry!" Rebekah reflexively said as she rubbed the bump on her head.

"No, don't worry about it. I should have been paying attention to where I was going." Said the woman clothed in a skin-tight white and black suit across from Rebekah as she also rubbed her head.

Steven blinked a couple times, to clear away the haziness that came with her new headache. Goddammit! Can't he catch a break!

However, he froze when he saw the woman across from him.

Appearance-wise, she was nothing special. Black hair running down to her shoulders, blue eyes, well-structured face. It went without saying that Steven had never met this woman.

However, right when he saw "Oriana," he felt a strange tearing sensation in his chest. His eyes immediately dampened.

"Are you alright?" Rebekah asked, now rubbing at her eyes.

Steven had never met this woman. Why did he feel like this? As if he were reuniting with a long-lost friend. It was taking almost every fiber of his willpower not to tackle the woman in front of him in a bear hug.
135112131322211.title: 'Miranda' bumps into 'Oriana'.

choices: Liz finishes her meeting with the Volus.
Steven and Rebekah find a secluded place to chat.
Meanwhile, a long way from Illium.
1351121313222111.content:
"Erm... I think so, yes." Steven nodded, his Australian-type accent coming through strongly. "Sorry for bumping into you, I was - distracted." Steven then apologized, and the feelings that he somehow knew the woman stood in front of him persisted. But how could he? He'd never set eyes on her in his life.
