Then again... he wasn't living 'his' life anymore, but that of a random, sexy... and obviously powerful woman in the future. Steven was still recovering from his earlier encounter with the three thugs.

"Have we met?" The woman stood in front of him suddenly asked Steven.

"I don't think so, well... I'm not really sure to be honest." Steven replied.

"Oh, I must be mistaken." Rebekah sighed. Then she decided to introduce herself with her new I.D. "Er... I'm Oriana by they way. Oriana Lawson!" Rebekah held out her hand, and Steven politely shook it. Then Steven realized the woman's surname was the same as that on his new I.D.

"Lawson?" Steven frowned.

"Hmm hm." Rebekah nodded, not knowing who she was actually talking to, yet.

"I'm... Miranda." Steven then said, and he retrieved his I.D holder and opened up the back to look at a picture that was on a miniature, hi-tech photo album he had seen earlier while finding out his new name. Sure enough, there 'he' was in his skin-tght, white and black suit and high heeled boots, stood next to the woman he was now talking to. Come to think of it, there was a resemblence between the two of them. "Okay then, I think we're sisters." Steven said, showing the photo to the woman.

"Oh my god, but wait... if neither of us knew that..." Rebekah started asking, getting her hopes up.

"You're not really Oriana are you?" Steven interrupted her.

"Are you really Miranda?" Rebekah asked back, getting a shake of the head from Steven.

"I'm... Steven!" Steven blurted out, taking a chance. "And I have no idea how I ended up in this woman's body." he added. Almost immediately, 'Oriana' leapt into Steven's arms, their breasts pressing against each other as she hugged him tight.

"Oh thank god!! Steven I'm so glad you're safe. It's me... Becky."

Steven was overly relieved, and continued embracing his friend - and now sister - tightly. "Good to know you're safe love." he whispered into her ear. It felt like they were one small step closer to finding out what the hell had happened to them.
1351121313222111.title: 'Oriana' and 'Miranda's' re...

choices: Miranda and Oriana are in a pickle
Liz finishes her meeting with the Volus
13511213132221112.content:
After the two's reunion, Rebekah had invited Steven to the room she had woken up in... which she assumed to be Oriana's apartment. It took a bit of fumbling around, but Rebekah did find that she had a key on her. It looked like any standard card key from her time. Surprisingly mundane, all things considering.

Still, the scene behind the door was by no means mundane. Whatever futuristic stuff that colored the outdoors had inevitably seeped indoors. Lots of strange dials and holographic stuff on top of what would normally pass as a living and sleeping space back in the two's era.

"Nice place." Steven said.

"Um... thanks, I guess?" It was Oriana's apartment, not Rebekah's. She really wasn't sure how to respond. "Take a seat anywhere."

Steven sat in the office chair that Rebekah motioned to, while Rebekah took the bed. An awkward silence filled the next couple moments. Both knew what to say, but not exactly how to start.

Is that really Steven? The Steven Rebekah remembered was not unattractive by any stretch of the word. He was just sort of forgettable. Like any random guy who walked down the street. However, the woman in front of her was... stunning, breathtaking, flawless, immaculate. Those were but a few words she could use to describe "Miranda." Yet Miranda was just so perfect looking that it seemed... a little off.

"Wanna start?" Steven asked, shattering Rebekah's train of thought.

"Oh, right! Sure!" Rebekah cleared her throat. "When I woke up..."

Both she and Steven recounted everything they could remember from the past day. It was a breath of fresh air for the two of them. Rather than having to wonder what was going on on their own, they could do it together. Even if their discussion uncovered next to nothing about how they got here. Rebekah hadn't done much but wander around the futuristic town, marveling at... basically everything. Steven admitted he had essentially done the same thing, but there was the encounter with the three thugs...

"There's a bounty on you?" Rebekah bit her lips. Crap.

"I don't know." Steven sucked in a breath of air. "But, we're going to have to be careful. I mean, Oriana is Miranda's sister. Who knows if she is also wanted."

"I guess it was a good thing I ran into you." Muttered Rebekah. "What were the chances?"

"Yeah..." Steven trailed off. What were the chances of the two of them appearing on this corner of the universe. He wasn't particularly close to Rebekah back at their time in Wilkos... but it still seemed to be a little convenient.

Come to think of it, what if there were others that-

A couple loud booms echoed off the front door. Almost causing the two 'girls' to leap up in surprise. They turned to each other.

"I'll go check." Quickly said Rebekah as she rushed to the door. Thankfully, even in the future, even though there were all kinds of wires and other screens attached to the door, there was still a peep hole.

Rebekah squeaked in surprise at what she saw on the other side.

There were at least twelve people. All of them were dressed in what looked to be some strange cross between space suits and stormtrooper armor. They crowded around the door, in a semi-circle, yet from the shadows Rebekah saw in the side of her vision, she guessed there were more hidden away.

One of them stepped forward. He was mostly indistinguishable from the others, but Rebekah noticed that his armor seemed a lot bulkier than the others. He spoke in a dull-robotic voice.

"Your father wishes to have a word with you."
13511213132221112.title: Steven and Rebekah find a secluded place to chat.

135112131322211123.content:
As Rebekah and Steven found themselves in a 'tight' corner (for Steven it was the second time that day), back in the Nos Astra port district, a beautiful Asari matriarch was striding into the area not far from where Liz was just finishing up getting information out of a Volus merchant. The Asari was dressed in a sort of 'stylish' armor, black and dark red in color. And the 'armor' left a large proportion of her generous breasts exposed.

The outfit the Asari wore certainly didn't match her sheepish attitude as she walked around. She glanced at people, other Asari and 'alien' alike, and she couldn't help but feel self-conscious with her azure blue tits practically spilling out for all to see.

"Right, where to go, who to talk to?" The Asari - Samara - muttered.

Inside the Adari's voluptuous, centuries-old body was none other than Jessica, the ginger-haired co-worker of Steven, Rebekah and Liz. And just like her friends, Jessica was feeling completely lost in this literally 'alien' world, not to mention in the 'freakish' yet sexy body she now occupied. For some reason, Jessica looked up at a large window, and saw another blue skinned. tentacle-haired woman, dressed in a mostly white outfit, pacing in the elevated office that overlooked the area. For some reason she felt drawn to that office, and she didn't know why.

Jessica had to wonder whether her new body was having unknown, peculiar effects on her mind. Jessica didn't yet know the immense biotic ability that resided within her experienced new body. She was now wearing the body of an Asari Justicar after all, though she didn't even know what one of those was.

Not knowing what else to do, Jessica walked up the stairs to the raised office, and saw stopped when she saw a small, 'roundish' alien in body armor leaving. "Strange woman!" The Volus shook his head, muttering to himself in between heavy breaths.

"Okay..." Jessica frowned, before approaching the desk where Nyxeris, 'Liara's' assistant was sat.

"Greetings. It is such an honor to have a Justicar visit us." Nyxeris bowed slightly at Jessica, who felt vaguely important for a moment.

"Er... Hi." Jessica waved demurely, definitely lacking the confidence and professionalism of the woman whose body she currently inhabited.
135112131322211123.title: Elsewhere...

choices: Miranda and Oriana are still in a pickle.
The Justicar and the scientist discuss things
1351121313222111233.content:
Liz waited for the footsteps to disappear away from "her" office before she let out a sigh in relief.

"Finally, he's gone."

Those past ten minutes had been the most stressful of her life. Not even her first job interview came close. It was as if the universe gave her a test on everything she had learned climbing up Wilkos' hierarchy. She needed to keep herself composed when the small, round alien stepped into her office then she needed to bullshit how that she was definitely this "Liara" and that she was definitely the information broker he was looking for.

Surprisingly enough, finding the information for the Volus wasn't too difficult. This "Liara" had prepared everything for the meeting. Just give the merchant a little disk and send him on his way.

She wiped a bit of sweat off her brow (apparently, whatever type of alien she was still had sweat glands), flinching a little when she brushed past her sensitive "head tentacles," and then got up.

She needed a fresh air, badly.

*****

"Greetings. It is such an honor to have a Justicar visit us." Said a voice that Liz recognized as being Liara's secretary.

...She still didn't know the woman's name.

"Er... Hi." While it was a voice that sounded like it should be barking commands on a battlefield, this "justicar" spoke in a very demure fashion. It sounded very strange.

Another one of those blue-skinned women stood at the front desk. While the red and black armor, despite seemingly being crafted to show off the women's ample bosom, did give her a rather intimidating air, the way the woman twiddled her fingers did not. A touch of purple had colored the woman's cheeks and she glanced around before speaking again.

"Um... I... it's nothing. I was just going." She mumbled.

Did she come to see me... Liara? Liz thought.

Revealing herself would probably lead to yet another stressful meeting, a daunting proposition as she had barely recovered from the first one. Yet... this woman seemed so... well... it just made her feel bad to leave the timid girl alone.

Thus, she chose to reveal herself.

"Honorable justicar, have you come to speak with me?"

Liz bit her lips. She gathered that the one in the armor, the justicar, was important, but she hoped she had not embellished it too much.

The two blue woman turned to look to Liz.

"Uh... yeah..." The Justicar mumbled.
1351121313222111233.title: Liz exits her office.

choices: Steven decides to take a big risk.
13511213132221112331.content:
Steven nervously glanced back over to Rebekah and they two shared a look of concern. "Why don't we try leaving out another door?" Rebekah muttered quietly, not sure what to do.

"Whoever these cretins are, they're professionals, well armed ones. They've probably covered all the exits." Steven shook his head, speaking in his sexy new voice as he again brushed his long dark hair behind his ears. His new hair was beginning to irritate him to be honest. "I think... we just have to go with them. That guy did say 'our' father wanted to speak with us. Can't be that bad right?" he shrugged.

Rebekah frowned. "What kind of father sends armed men out after his daughters?"

Steven grimaced a little, reminded once again of his female status. "Well, I could always try to fight them off?" he mumbled, know himself that it didn't sound as crazy as it probably did to Rebekah, given his 'hidden powers'.

"Don't be ridiculous!" Rebekah admonished him. "Open the door, we should go with them."

Steven reluctantly agreed. They both thought that maybe this was they would get some more answers to the questions they had. Steven unlocked the door and opened it, the lights on the several suits of armor stood in front of him momentarily blinding him. "Miss Lawson, your father politely requests an audience with his daughters." One of the armor-clad men then said again, not sounding quite human underneath all the metal and composite material.

"Huh... fine I guess." Steven nodded, not wanting to give the men an excuse to attack him.

The men stepped aside, opening a passage to two small armored, yellow and black 'ships' parked nearby. Each ship had an open area like a helicopter, with laser cannons mounted on either side. Steven again nervously glanced back at Rebekah. "Lets go Oriana, daddy wants to speak with us." he said, slightly mocking the presence of the man beside him.

Rebekah sighed, then moved close to Steven, and the two 'women' were escorted to the waiting ships. Once aboard, they secured themselves with seatbelts and the ships took off. Both Steven and Rebekah instantly felt their stomachs doing somersaults due to the speed of the aerial craft.

They both had to wonder how much weirder this whole situation could get...
13511213132221112331.title: Miranda and Oriana are still in a pickle.

choices: Nope, make a run for it!
135112131322211123311.content:
The whole flight went by in silence, under the emotionless gaze of the "stormtroopers." Steven and Rebekah avoided even looking at each other. Neither of them knew who Oriana and Miranda's father was, but there was a couple things that was certain. The "escort" that they had been sent had looked quite prepared to use force had they not complied and the two felt much more like prisoners than guests.

As they flew on, a growing pit of dread formed in Rebekah's stomach. Had they done the right thing? Maybe they should've just run while they had the chance.

...No. That was impossible. A dozen or so soldiers vs. two defenseless women? They would have been shot down before they could take a step.

Similar thoughts ran through Steven's head. Yet he tried to distract himself by watching one of the glowing dials by the cockpit. The ship didn't have windows he could look out of so that was the only thing that could help him take his mind off of the situation.

The shuttle lurched to a whiplash-inducing stop.

Before either of the girls could do anything, two of the armored men had got up and were hastily undoing Steven and Rebekah's seat belts.

"Alright, move it." One man waved his gun at the door. It seemed that now that the two were in their custody the soldiers saw no reason to be polite. "Your father is waiting."

Rebekah and Steven shared a glance before they got up and made for the exit.

"Wow." Rebekah muttered as she stepped out.

They were on the top of one of those high rise buildings, standing on what looked suspiciously like a helipad. To one direction, there was one of those circular-shaped doors which probably lead down into the building. To the other direction was an utterly breathtaking view of the city being lighted by a sunset (or was it sunrise?).

Steven and Rebekah, once more, glanced to each other...
135112131322211123311.title: Arriving at their destination.

choices: Steven and Rebekah make a run for it.
1351121313222111233113.content:
"Er please... have a seat." Liz mumbled nervously, as the 'Justicar' followed her into her new office. Liz didn't even know what a Justicar was, but from her 'sultry' appearance she gave off both a dangerous and sexy vibe. Well... Samara would have given a vibe exactly like that off had the human now inhabiting her body (Jessica) not been even more nervous than Liz was.

"T-thank you!" Jessica stuttered in her husky voice.

"And, what can I help you with?" Liz asked, not knowing if she could even help anyone with anything. She was still lost herself, trapped in a strange body, in a strange time, and on a strange planet too. It was all too bizarre.

Over the next 10 minutes, not much progress was made, and little was talked about. Nothing major anyway. The nightlife on Illium, the aliens walking around... even the weather, which was calm (due to being controlled by atmospheric technology). "You look... lost?" 'Liara' suddenly blurted out, drawing 'Samara's' gaze.

"Excuse me?" Jessica replied.

"I mean, not that I think you... you just look like you don't belong here." Liz clarified her statement, decising to pry a little deeper. She figured that was the only way to get the answers she needed.

"News flash! You don't sound like a local yourself hon." 'Samara' commented to Liara'.

Liz immediately frowned, recognizing a somewhat familiar tone to Samara's speech pattern. Liz was an excellent judge of character, always had been, and she also had a keen eye and ear as well as a good memory. "You sound like someone I know." she chuckled, getting the Justicar's attention again.

"Oh... really? Who?" 'Samara' asked, raising an eyebrow as she reached up nervously to caress her sensitive hair tentacles.

"Um... her name is Jessica." Liz revealed, biting her bottom lip.

Jessica's eyes widened in shock and her jaw fell open as she stared at the equally azure-skinned beauty sat across from her. "Er... wow, I-I'm Jessica!" she exclaimed, not knowing quite what 'Liara's' reaction would be.

At this point, Liz jumped up from the desk and ran around it, causing Jessica to leap up, partly out of alarm. "Oh, sorry Jess, didn't mean to frighten you. It's me... Liz." Liara said, putting her hand to her chest.

Another moment of silence befell the room, then the two shared a relieved, passionate embrace, glad to know they were safe and had found each other. At that moment, Nyxeris entered the room. "Oh forgive me Dr T'Soni, I did not mean to interrupt, but you have a message from 'Source 13' on Omega." The assistant then left the room, as the console on Liz's desk started flashing.

"What's Source 13?" Jessica asked, a tear in her eye.

Liz sighed, just smiling at Jessica. "I have no idea!" she chuckled, now in somewhat higher spirits.
1351121313222111233113.title: Meanwhile, with Liara and Samara

choices: Miranda and Oriana make a break for it.
13511213132221112331133.content:
"Liara" sat down at her desk to read the message at her console, with "Samara" leaning over her shoulder. Some things never change. The format of the message reminded her of the email services back at home. The sender was, sure enough, labeled as "13," and it started by saying that "Omega" had fallen to "Cerberus." It then gave detail about how control of the "relay" gave Cerberus greater mobility as well as how it would negatively affect import and export this month.

Liz threw a glance at Jessica, who shrugged. The message meant little. While Liz could theorize that "Omega" might be situated in some trade route, she had not really studied much economy... or military for that matter.

Liz closed the message.

"What now?" Jessica asked as she swung back around the desk and sat in a chair. "I don't know what a 'Justicar' does or who I am supposed to be. For that matter-"

Jessica gestured to herself. "What are we?"

Liz frowned. "I think we're supposed to be a race called the 'Asari.' I don't really know much other than that Asari are all female and that they are the dominant species on this planet."

Liz decided to wait a bit before admitting that "she" was now 75 years older.

Jessica supposed it was a start... hopefully, there was nothing really weird about their biology. She certainly hoped that chocolate was not poisonous.

"Jessica." Liz said slowly and deliberately. "What if we're not the only ones?"

Jessica froze. She supposed this could be true, but...

"I suppose you could be right..." She cringed. "But how would we even find them? They could look like anything."

Jessica recalled a pair of hulking lizard men who she had scrambled out of the way of her on her way here, as well as the rotund merchant that had exited the office. If those were the type of people they would have to shake down...

"I have an idea of where to start." Liz rummaged a bit with the desk, eventually pulling open a drawer and pulling out two pieces of paper. "I found these when searching for answers earlier."

She placed the two pictures on the table. Both were group photos. The first had a blonde-haired (human) woman dressed in what looked to be a military uniform front and center.

"So humans exist here." Jessica let out a sigh in relief.

Most of the people surrounding this woman were human, but there were a couple oddities. A hunched over lizard like the one that Jessica had seen earlier, a bird-lizard man, a woman in a complete body suit, and-

Jessica squinted at Liz before looking back at the picture.

-Liz's current body.

The second picture was pretty similar, though there were even more people than the last one. There were a couple familiar faces, like the woman in the body suit and the bird-lizard man, however, standing with chest puffed out off to the right, Jessica recognized her current body...

"I don't know if any of them might be in the same situation as us," Liz moved a hand over to the computer. "But even if they aren't, they seem like the best bet if we want help. I'm going to see if I can track any of them down..."
13511213132221112331133.title: More with Liz and Jessica.

choices: The 'sisters' run into someone who knows them.
Liz runs her search on the computer.
135112131322211123311332.content:
Steven didn't know what it was that told him to stop walking, that meeting this 'father' of his would be a bad thing, but he trusted his gut instinct. "Keep moving!" One of the armored guys behind him grunted through his mask, pushing Steven with the barrel of his laser rifle. At that moment, Steven was able to take in his surroundings as if time had slowed. Their precise location on one of the top floors of a skyscraper in the center of Illium. Off to his right was a large window made of strong glass, to the left was an elevator that had been intentionally sabotaged, probably by his and Rebekah's captors.

"I said, keep moving!" The 'trooper' repeated, causing a concerned Rebekah to step forward and touch Steven's arm. Even she wanted to know why he had suddenly stopped in his tracks.

As two more troopers stepped towards 'Miranda' and 'Oriana', Steven closed his eyes, summoning the power inside him that had surfaced with his encounter with the three thugs earlier. In an instance he quickly outstretched his right arm... and a blast of biotic energy shot out... propelling two of the troops straight through the window and down over 80 stories to their deaths.

A split second later, a protective shield formed around Steven and Rebekah, as the latter moved in to 'cower' alongside her friend. The biotic shield Steven had thrown up deflected dozens of rounds of gunfire, then he turned and scowled at the troops behind him and held up his hand - clenching his fist. The trooper immediately started to choke as his air passage was shut off. He dropped down dead moments later.

The last three troopers didn't last much longer, suffering internal haemorrhages and broken bones as Steven effortlessly bounced them off a wall with another fierce biotic blast.

"Oh my god, Steven... WHAT ARE YOU DOING?" Rebekah screamed, as the biotic field dropped.

Steven took a deep breath and calmed himself down. He didn't know what the power was he was using, but it was a rush whenever he did. "Come on, we're not meeting with 'daddy dearest'." Steven explained, grabbing Rebekah's arm and leading towards the disabled elevator.

"But... what... how did you do that?" Rebekah asked, clearly scared as she looked back at the four bodies left in Steven's wake (not counting the two that had gone out of the window).

The sound of armored footsteps was then heard as more Cerberus troops converged on the sound of the gunfire. Steven used his biotics to pry the elevator doors open and he peered down the elevator shaft into the dark depths below, so great was the height.

"Great, now what?" Rebekah panicked, seeing that the elevator was somewhere above them and clearly not working.

"Trust me!" Steven sighed, holding Rebekah close to him, so that their breasts pressed together. He then took Rebekah with him as he leaped into the elevator shaft, plummeting down... and slowed only by another field of biotic power that intensified the further down the building their dropped. When they touched down gently at the bottom of the shaft, Rebekah looked at Steven in complete astonishment.

"I'm gonna wake up soon aren't I? This can't be real." Rebekah gasped, shaking her head.

"We can talk later. And believe me, it's real." Steven responded, once more flicking his hair out of his face. "Now come on, we've got to find one of those flying cars or something to get us out of here before our new father sends reinforcements after us." he said, as he pried the doors open at the bottom of the shaft and climbed up before helping Rebekah.

They fled the building together, with Rebekah entrusting 'her' life to 'Miranda'...
135112131322211123311332.title: Miranda and Oriana make a break for it.

1351121313222111233113322.content:
To Steven, the whole experience felt strange, to say the least. Within the last few minutes, he had faced down a squad of soldiers, doing superhuman feats that he believed to be impossible without thousands of dollars of computer animation, and ducking and fleeing down alleyways. He knew that he should be panicking, yet for some reason, he felt... alive. Excited.

Even dragging along a wild-eyed Rebekah did little to stem his excitement.

He and Rebekah turned left, bursting out of the alley and into what looked to be a plaza. Oddly enough, the place was completely abandoned. Seemed like the time of day that it should be bustling.

Steven wondered if "his father" had something to do with this...

"There she is!"

Steven and Rebekah immediately darted down another street.

"Don't let them get away!"

As they ran, Steven began to hear the soft panting of Rebekah beside him. She was beginning to lag behind him a bit. Steven inwardly cursed. If they kept this up, then-

"Over here!"

Upon hearing a non-computerized-sounding voice, Steven spared a glance ahead of him. A caucasian man with a buzzcut leaned out one of the door, waving the two down.

"Get in here!"

Steven threw a glance at Rebekah, whose panting had only grown heavier. She would not last much longer. They shared a nod. They veered to the right and disappeared into the building. The man slammed the door shut behind them and locked it with a beeping sound.

The interior reminded Steven, nostalgically enough, of the lobby back in the apartment he had back in... well, "his time." A little alcove in the wall for a front desk as well as a pair of couches and a desk. It was the first place that Steven had seen that didn't look futuristic.

A stampede ran past the door, disappearing off in the distance.

"Showed up in the nick of time, didn't I?" Their benefactor smiled. Now that Steven had a better look at him, he noticed that the man was slightly taller than the two of them and wearing one of those military uniforms that was so ubiquitous in the group photo he saw earlier.

So... he was Miranda's ally?

The man held out a hand. "Thomas Hawthorne." He said. "Former private 1st class in the Systems Alliance. I doubt you remember me from back on the Normandy."
1351121313222111233113322.title: The 'sisters' run into someone who know...

13511213132221112331133223.content:
With assistance from the advanced computer in front of her, it didn't take Liz long to put names to the faces of everyone in the photos she had. The woman fron and center was apparently a celebrated soldier, her name was Jane Shepard, a Commander in the Systems Alliance. Liz already knew her new name, but she found out a hell of a lot more about the alien woman whose life she now had.

"Wait... I'm called Samara?" Jessica asked, leaning across the desk, trying to get a look at the small touchpad computer Liz was holding. To safe her from straining, Liz passed the device to Jessica.

The perfect, 20x20 vision eyes that Jessica now possessed soon shot down the list of people. "Okay, so, how to find any of these people? And what do we go once we find them? Try and convince them that we're really two human women from the past?" Jessica threw questions at Liz.

"One step at a time luv, one step at a time." Liz said in her new, demure voice.

Liz then set about finding out the current whereabouts (where available) of the people in the photos. Their addresses etc. Apparently, the woman in the white and black, skin-tight outfit and boots had a sister who lived here on Illium.

"Where's her apartment?" Jessica asked, as she began to think that maybe they were finally making progress.

Seconds later, Oriana Lawson's address popped up on the computer Jessica was holding. "Oh, cool!" she giggled, in a very un-Samara like manner.

The pair were suddenly interrupted again when Nyxeris came into the office. "Excuse me Dr. T'Soni, but you have an encrypted message from an unknown human. I'm patching it through to your terminal." The Asari said.

"Er... thank you." Liz replied with a slight frown as her terminal started flashing.

"Something wrong?" Jessica asked, after Nyxeris had left the room.

"We're about to find out." Liz sighed, opening the terminal up.
13511213132221112331133223.title: Back with Liara and Samara.

choices: Liara received another message before then.
135112131322211123311332233.content:
"So, let me get this straight." Asked Hawthorne as he leaned back on the couch. "You don't remember anything?"

Rebekah stiffly nodded. After Nathaniel Hawthorne "introduced" himself to them, they had retreated upstairs, to his very "humble abode." Rebekah noted absently that it was much more sparsely decorated than "her" apartment complex had been. It looked much more like a cheap apartment from back in the 21st century rather than one from this wacky future.

Nathaniel had waved it off by saying that this place was only temporary... until the commander came back.

"Normandy. Cerberus. Collectors. Bug people. None of this rings a bell?"

Rebekah and Steven shook their heads.

Soon after they had arrived in the apartment, then came an onslaught of questions from Nathaniel. Where had they been? What trouble had they got into now? What was the news on the commander? Steven had been internally panicking at this point. However, Rebekah had somehow managed to play it cool. She calmly informed the man that they had amnesia.

Steven supposed he could not come up with a better lie... telling him that they were both people from the 21st century would've probably been too hard of a sell.

Nathaniel slumped back onto his chair with a sigh. "This makes things much more complicated..."

"I know its a bit much to ask for after you saved our life." Said Rebekah. "But could you explain everything to us? Fill in some of the holes?"

Another sigh.

"Sure..." He took a deep breath in. "Anyways, you are Miranda and Oriana. You are both siblings... I think. Those people who seemed to be chasing you were part of an organization known as Cerberus and-

Nathaniel threw his hands up. "Ugh! I cant do this!"

Rebekah leaned forward. "We would appreciate anything you could tell us."

"I was just one of the staff back on the Normandy. I'm not really 'in the know.'" He shook his head. "Look, why don't I try calling up Liara. She could explain things better than I ever could."

"Liara?"

"An Asari." Nathaniel heaved another sigh at the blank expressions he received. "One of the blue skinned ladies. You must have really hit your head."

"Sure then..." Steven said. "Lets call her."
135112131322211123311332233.title: Meanwhile, back with 'Liara' and 'O...

1351121313222111233113322331.content:
It was Hawthorne's message that had now reached Liz's new office, but when she opened the view screen up, Liz didn't know who she was looking at. She did her best to sound competent as the man spoke, basically telling her that Miranda and Oriana Lawson were with him, suffering from apparent amnesia. And that he didn't know who else to turn to in order to stop Cerberus from hunting the sisters down.

"Um... do you know where my office is, on Illium?" Liz asked Hawthorne.

"Yes, I think I heard Shepard mention it once, the Nos Astra port district right?" Hawthorne nodded, as the communication line crackled and jumped, indicating it wasn't exactly a "legal" means of communication they were using.

"Okay, if you can, bring them here." Liz said, not knowing what else to do. She could hardly refuse to help someone, even if they were strangers to her. It just wasn't in Liz's nature.

"Okay Dr T'Soni, and thank you." Hawthorne thanked 'Liara', before the screen went blank.

"Er... what was that?" Jessica inquired with a puzzled frown etched upon her blue face. "We don't even know that bloke, or the women he's talking about. How can we help them? And what if they're in serious trouble? It sounds like they are." She continued.

"Jess, I don't know okay. It just seemed like the right thing to do." Liz defended her actions.

"Hope it doesn't bite us in the butt." Jessica sighed, as she began to slouch in a very 'un-Asari' like manner.

Liz was looking at the bigger picture right now. If they were stuck in this new world, in the future, and in their new bodies, then they would have to learn to adapt and adjust to everything, including the dangers presented to them. Liz had a slight inkling that something much bigger was going on in the world, galaxy... whatever, right now, and her responsibilities and skills as a store supervisor, however insignificant they seemed in this world, came to the forefront.

"Nyxeris, can you bring us some water please." Liz asked her assistant over the intercom.

"How about something stiffer?" Jessica mumbled, arching an eyebrow.

Liz just smiled...
1351121313222111233113322331.title: Liara received Hawthorne's message.

13511213132221112331133223311.content:
As tempting as it was to drown out this bizarre incident under a sea of alcohol, Liz resisted the temptation, instead letting a pouting Jessica sulk with her glass of water. To Liz, it seemed she was tiptoeing across a razor blade, the two needed their wits about them.

Instead, Liz passed the time by going over their soon-to-be-guest's profiles.

"Nothing on Hawthorne." Liz muttered. Was this because he was good at hiding things, or was he just considered irrelevant in the grand scheme of things?

However, she had much more luck with Miranda and Oriana...

"Wasn't this the woman with the apartment on this planet?" Jessica piped up. It was odd to think of living arrangements in terms of celestial bodies... How many more lines had to be added onto post cards. Assuming they still existed...

Liz nodded as she leafed through the data. It was such an amazing coincidence that the one person they were planning to visit was going to come right to their doorstep on her own. Something felt wrong about this...

Strange. It appeared this "Miranda" was a former member of Cerberus. Which was... some sort of human-supremacy-terrorist group?

A pit formed in Liz's chest. Was associating with someone like that a good idea?

Before she could give much more thought, Nyxeris' voice chimed in.

"Dr. T'soni. There is one Mr. Hawthorne as well as two others here to see you. Should I send them in?"

A deep breath in. No point in backing out now. "Yes. Please."

A thirty second wait. Jessica swallowed, out of nervousness.

The door opened. In stepped the man from the view screen... As well as two cloaked figures.
13511213132221112331133223311.title: Sitting and waiting.

135112131322211123311332233111.content:
"Er... come in, please." Liz muttered, stepping forward from behind Liara's desk. Jessica remained silent, but did get to her feet as the two 'cloaked figures' removed their hoods, revealing the confused faces of the Lawson sisters. Liz immediately saw how edgy the women were, especially 'Oriana'.

"I'm gonna get straight off, if that's okay." Hawthorne mumbled, gesturing back to the doorway, where Nyxeris was still stood. "Good to see you again Dr. T'Soni." He continued, before walking straight out of the office.

Once Nyxeris had also disappeared from sight, Liz and Jessica glanced at each other, then looked at their two 'guests'.

"Have a seat." Liz gestured to the couch nearby.

"Thank you. You sure this place is... safe?" 'Miranda' replied, looking nervously around. Steven then sat down, paying particular attention to the large window over looking the trading floor below the office. The room just seemed to 'open' to Steven, who was now thinking as militarily as he could, The nearest he'd come to being in the military though was a paintball contest.

"Quite safe, yes." Liz replied, without actually knowing if it was or not. "I'm Liara by the way, and this is Samara." Liz introduced her and Jessica.

As Rebekah took a seat beside her new sister, she smiled at the two Azure-skinned beauties before them. "Um... I'm Oriana." She spoke up, thinking it polite to introduce herself to their gracious hosts.

"I know." Liz smiled, nodding slightly. "And you're Miranda." She said, turning to Steven. Liz then had to ask the question on her mind. "So, who is after you?" Liz asked the two women sat on the couch.

Steven and Rebekah looked at each other, then the former answered Liz. "Our father, apparently.".

Liz sat down behind her desk and brought up the sisters' information again. "Henry Lawson, your father. Powerful businessman, corrupt as they come. Is rumored to be in league with the group you used to work for Miss Lawson." Liz said, looking over to Steven again. "I think we can safely say it's Cerberus who is after you, as well as your father." She mumbled.

Steven was astonished at the amount of information coming from the alien woman. He was certainly learning more about his and Rebekah's new lives. Liz was just thankful she had Liara's computer at her disposal, otherwise she'd be stumped as well.

Meanwhile, Rebekah was glancing over at the other alien woman in the room, clad in the 'provocative' armor. She was being strangely silent, and looked to be almost as nervous as she was.

Rebekah wondered...
135112131322211123311332233111.title: Getting acquainted.

choices: They decide they need a plan.
Nathaniel Hawthorne and/or Nyxeris is eavesdropping.
1351121313222111233113322331111.content:
The moment Rebekah looked at the other blue-skinned woman, "Samara" averted her eyes, a purple blush forming on her face.

...Normally, Rebekah would've dismissed it as the woman just being shy, unusually shy for considering her appearance of a battle-hardened warrior, but she assumed that there had to be some room for timidity on the battlefield. Still, her unexpected encounter with a now-busty Steven, made her wonder...

"Right..." Steven threw a glance at the corner of the room. "I-I have amnesia, as I think Hawthorne said. So, uh, could you fill us in on Cerberus?"

Liz frowned for a second, but quickly covered it up with a practiced smile. "Certainly."

A couple more clicks and Liz brought up a page labeled... "Spacepedia."

Seriously?

Liz started at the top of the page and read her way down, in a loud, monotone voice.

...

A chill seemed to fall over the room.

What the fuck is this even? Steven thought. It was as if the Klu Klux Klan formed some sort of unholy union with the injustice league. Mass murder, assassination, human experimentation- the group had done it all. What the fuck? Why did they have some of the wo- galaxy's biggest asshats after them?

The expressions of the others were enough indication that everyone else shared the sentiments. Liz winced slightly as she came across a particularly graphic image of... well... she wasn't even sure what she was looking at. It looked as if someone had been turned inside out and then had a bunch of tubes stuck in him. Jessica had edged her way towards the corner of the room. Rebekah-

"Um, I'm sorry to interrupt." Rebekah looked between the two alien women. What doubt she had earlier had been replaced by conviction. The uncertainty that "Liara" spoke in seemed completely out of character for an experienced information broker. "But... have you heard of a store called 'Wilkos' in Rotherham?"

Everyone froze. All eyes affixed to Rebekah.

...

"You're... no." Liz muttered. "It cant be..."

Rebekah gave a shy smile. "I'm Rebekah, even if I look like this."
1351121313222111233113322331111.title: Rebekah speaks up.

13511213132221112331133223311111.content:
"Er, yeah... Steven!" Steven raised his hand nervously, drawing a gasp from Liz and Jessica.

As she had done with Jessica earlier, upon hearing her friends identify herself, Liz jumped from her chair and proceeded to embrace the woman whose body now housed Rebekah's mind. "Oh Becky, I'm so glad you're safe." Liz sighed in relief, hugging Rebekah tight. And there were more tears soon flowing.

Even Jessica now had a smile on her face as she watched the hug play out. Then she walked forward and hugged Rebekah too, their breasts pressing against each other. Steven, stood off to the side, decided not to admit that seeing his friends hugging slightly aroused him (since they were all big-breasted women now, including two 'alien babes').

That feeling only increased when Liz turned to attention to him, and embraced him. Steven was the taller of the two, with his higher heels on. Liz then held Steven's gloved hands and stepped back, checking him over. "You're looking... different, Steven." She smiled. "But at least you're safe."

Steven looked down, nodding in acknowledgement.. "Yeah, just a couple of 'additions'." Steven managed to laugh.

"Nice to see you again Steven, "Jessica told him next, "even in such a 'feminine' body'" She smiled warmly.

Not liking all the attention being on him all of a sudden, Steven quickly changed the subject. "So, okay then, either of you know what happened to us? Or is this just going to remain one big confusing mystery?" He asked Liz and Jessica.

"We just woke up in this world, like yourself probably." Jessica replied, shrugging her shoulders.

"We have no idea why we're here." Liz confirmed, disheartening Steven and Rebekah a little.

After a few more minutes chatting, Steven took stock of the situation, out loud. "Okay so, we're all stuck here, in this futuristic world, in strangers' bodies, me and Rebekah are being pursued by a racist, degenerate group called Cerberus and our new demented father. And you two," he continued, pointing to Liz and Jessica, "are part of a race called Asari, all female, and apparently... all 'busty'." Steven finished, staring at Jessica's exposed cleavage.

"Hey, you're carrying quite a pair around yourself Steven, in case you haven't noticed." Liz reminded her friend and co-worker. "Genetically flawless too." She winked, causing Steven to blush. Liz really had scavenged Liara's computer for every scrap of information.

Rebekah decided to step in. "Never mind discussing boobs, what are we going to do next?" She asked.

After a moment's silence, and the foursome staring at each other, Liz just shrugged. "Your guess is as good as ours love." She mumbled.

Rebekah let out a despondent sigh...
13511213132221112331133223311111.title: Tearful reunion.

choices: Nyxeris and Nathaniel confront the four
They hear a large group of people coming their way...
135112131322211123311332233111111.content:
Another couple seconds of silence passed. What should they do? They were stuck in the future; on a planet that wasn't even earth; and, to top it all off, they didn't even have the correct bodies (or gender, in Steven's case). To fix this mess, to get back to their time, none of them had any idea where to even start.

...except...

A spark seemed to ignite in Steven's head. He pulled out Miranda's tablet device and rapidly punched through it. He flipped through the photo album before coming to a particular image.

"Have you seen this picture?" He asked as he turned it to the rest of the room.

Indeed, it was the image Jessica and Liz had been looking at earlier, the group photo shot of the crew of the Normandy. They could see a couple familiar faces. Miranda at the front and Samara towards the side.

"I know this is a bit of a stretch, but maybe if we can track down the people in this picture, maybe they could... I don't know, help us?"

The plan sounded pathetic, even to Steven. Yet he really had nothing else to go on. In this futuristic world, he had no connections, no familiar stomping grounds, no nothing. Hell, he didn't even know how to piss with his new body. The idea of meeting up with people who had answers was appealing, to say the least. Even if they didn't have answers, at least he would have more muscle to fight off the deranged, racist, terrorist group after him and Rebekah.

The three other women exchanged a glance. Doubt fluttered over most of their expressions. However...

"I suppose we don't have anything else to go on." Said Liz with a sigh as she loaded her computer back up. "I'll start a search."

*****

"What do you think?"

Nyxeris and Nathaniel turned to each other. It had been Nathaniel's idea to eavesdrop. While Nyxeris wasn't usually in the habit of spying on her employer, it was quite rare when she allowed large parties into her office and even rarer when she kept them in for long durations of time.

Even though they had just met, Nathaniel only needed to point this out to convince her to listen in.

"I don't know." Responded Nyxeris. Thinking back, Liara was acting pretty unusual. She somehow seemed... less sure of herself than usual. More wooden. Someone taking over Liara's body? It wasn't her first guess, but she supposed it made... actually, it made no sense, but it was at least an explanation.

Still, whoever was in Liara's place didn't seem hostile...

Nathaniel wasn't so sure himself. He supposed he could easily explain away the four's unusual behavior with insanity... but ever since that Collector's base, he had seen enough weird shit to believe that taking over someone's body was quite possible. Just like Nyxeris though, He thought the current inhabitants seemed just as confused as they were...
135112131322211123311332233111111.title: Someone suddenly gets an idea.

choices: Nathaniel and Nyxeris enter the room.
Another 'face' in the photo is located.
1351121313222111233113322331111111.content:
Liz decided to begin with the person who stuck out the most in the group photo, the woman with the partly shaved head and body covered in tattoos, Her appearance made the search for her even easier as it happened. "Jack? Really?" Liz frowned, glancing up at the others as they stood around her desk. "Also known as Subject 0, very affectionate." She continued. "Oh god, she was the main focus in one of Cerberus' experiments when she was little."

"Experimenting on children?" Jessica gasped.

"I'm beginning to feel better about killing those guys earlier." Steven chimed up in Miranda's voce.

"Killing? Who? Where, what?" Jessica responded.

Rebekah stepped in. "You should have seen it, some of the Cerberus guys were taking me and Steven to see that Henry asshole, you know... our dad, and suddenly Steven got this awesome looking power and took them all out." She explained.

"Seriously?" Liz asked, raising an eyebrow.

Steven just nodded. "Yes, but I don't know what the power is that I've got, it just seems to emerge when I concentrate enough, whenever I'm in danger." He replied. "It's like a weird, glowing blue aura around me and I can use it like telekinesis." He explained as best he could.

"That sounds so cool." Jessica said in awe, smiling a little.

What Jessica or Liz didn't know at that point, was that their bodies possessed biotic strength even greater than Steven's was. "Oh crap," Liz suddenly said, glancing back the computer screen, "Jack is on a newly-built prison ship called Purgatory, in the Osun system, Hourglass Nebula. Wherever that is."

"Well, that rules out finding her." Steven sighed.

"But what if someone we know is in Jack's body?" Liz asked, making everyone think. "We can't leave them there."

"She's right." Rebekah nodded solemnly.

"Well, lets find out where the others are first, okay?" Steven said, pointing back to the computer. And Liz obliged.
1351121313222111233113322331111111.title: Liz begins tracking them down

13511213132221112331133223311111112.content:
Liz quietly sighed to herself as she picked out the next most distinct looking person in the group, a strange hooded woman. A prison ship? Telekinesis? Human experimentation? Liz felt a headache coming on. She was just some manager at a hardware store! This all felt so out of her league.

Despite the woman's... unique attire. She could find little to no information on her. Not her face, background, nothing. All she could find was the name, Kasumi. As well as-

"Seriously?" Liz grumbled. "Her, too?"

"What? What is it?" Steven leaned forward, craning his neck to see the computer screen.

"Kasumi is also on Purgatory."

The rest of the room balked.

"So, we're going to have to break into prison to get them out?" Steven backed away, slumping into a chair. Why couldn't they both just be in a city somewhere, somewhere where they probably wouldn't have to leave another trail of bodies?

"We could try to bail them out instead." Rebekah muttered.

"Don't think that would work." Jessica said solemnly. "Jack probably has a high price, even if they were planning to let her out at all."

Liz made a mental note to check up on purgatory before she began scanning over the other rows of faces. Maybe she should try someone less... unusual looking this time.

This time, she picked out a black haired, tanned woman in a military uniform. Her name came up surprisingly quick in the database.

"Ashley Williams. Alliance military, former gunnery chief..." Liz skimmed over the rest of the military jargon, doing her best to ignore the eager stares she was getting. However, her eyes widened at a certain line. "Location... Earth?"

This caused a stir in the room. "Wait, Earth!?" Jessica leaned into the screen. "Earth exists?"

A quizzical glance from Steven. "You didn't think it did?"

"I don't know..." Jessica shrunk back. "I just thought that it was like the Star Wars universe or something. That we were in some alternate reality..."
13511213132221112331133223311111112.title: Another 'face' in the photo is located.

135112131322211123311332233111111122.content:
The search for possible friends and allies were abruptly interrupted when Nyxeris and Hawthorne barged in, and eyed the foursome up suspiciously. "What is going on here? Who are you people?" Nyxeris asked, as she held her hand out and conjured up a ball of biotic energy, as if to threaten. After all she didn't know who she and Nathaniel were dealing with.

On instinct, a blue glow momentarily surrounded Miranda's body as Steven's powers kicked in.

"What do you... mean?" Liz asked in reply, looking stunned.

"We heard you talking, and we demand to know who you really are." Nyxeris said coldly. "You clearly are not Dr. T'Soni." She said to Liz. "And no Justicar would act so nervous in the presence of her own kind, or anyone for that matter." She added, glancing over at Jessica.

"And you two, both claiming to have amnesia? Come on!" Hawthorne said, looking at 'Miranda' and 'Oriana'. "Did you steal their bodies?" He practically accused Steven and Rebekah.

Rebekah was immediately defensive. "N-no, course not, w-we just... we don't know how we got here." She whimpered.

"Then WHO are you?" Nyxeris demanded to know.

Liz looked at her each of her friends in turn as she turned off the computer, then she let out a sigh. She figured if they needed allies, why not start with Nyxeris and Hawthorne. They'd get a lot more done with their help after all. That is.. if they believed them. Liz started explaining exactly who they were and how they came to be stuck in this world... and these unfamiliar bodies. It took quite a bit of convincing, especially in Hawthorne's case.

=======

"So you have no knowledge of anything in this world? The Galactic Council? The Collector threat? Nothing?" Hawthorne frowned.

"Nope, we're totally in the dark. In fact... if it weren't for this computer... it would be pitch black for us." Liz answered in Liara's soothing voice.

"Well shit, this is going to complicate things. Shepard should know." Hawthorne said to Nyxeris, who just nodded in agreement. Not that the Asari usually bothered herself with the affairs of other races. But the fact that two of her people (Liara and Samara) were involved, she was willing to assist Hawthorne.

"We need to get to Earth, see if any more of our friends are there." Steven spoke up, hand on hips as he unconsciously struck a feminine pose.

"If any of your friends are also in this world, they could be anywhere." Nyxeris pointed out. "They could be here on Illium, on Omega, Earth, Thessia, even Tuchanka or Sur'Kesh. Or... they may be dead already. This is a very, very dangerous galaxy we live in." She informed the four friends in front of her.

And her words hit home hard...
135112131322211123311332233111111122.title: Nyxeris and Hawthorne barge in

choices: Sitting around and mingling amongst themselves...
1351121313222111233113322331111111221.content:
With Nyxeris' help, the search went by much faster. Not that their search amounted to much...

Many of the files were locked and Nyxeris was quick to inform them that only the "real" Liara had the keys. "Garrus," "Tali," "Jacob," "Legion," and "Mordin" were all locked. Humorously enough, Miranda and Oriana were also in the "classified" section.

Wrex and Grunt were on a world called Tuchunka, which, as Nyxeris pointed out, was one of the worst "death worlds" in the galaxy. The only thing written on Zaeed's profile was "AWL." And Kaiden was... dead.

"Basically." Said Steven, halting his pacing around the room. "We know that 'Kasumi' and Jack are in a prison camp and 'Ashley' is on earth."

"R-right." Said Liz as she closed the computer. She groaned slightly. That had taken way longer than expected. She even felt a certain sense of numbness in her brain.

"What do you plan to do now?" Said Hawthorne, his arms folded across his chest as he leaned right by the door. Ever since he had learned about the foursomes true identities, Steven had noticed that Hawthorne had grown much more distant. Honestly, Steven couldn't exactly blame him...

"What else?" Steven shrugged. "We go to earth first and meet up with Ashley."

Nyxeris and Hawthorne threw a sideways glance at each other. The two had grown close at an astonishing rate. It probably had to do with them having to deal with four clueless body snatchers.

"This plan still seems like a stab in the dark to me." Muttered Hawthorne.

"It's the best we've got." Rebekah piped up.

Nyxeris let out a sigh before she went for the door.

"Very well, I'll go make arrangements. There should be a ship out of Illium soon..."

As she walked out, Hawthorne and her eyes met once again. A single message channeled right through their gaze.

What am I getting into?
1351121313222111233113322331111111221.title: Help getting to Earth.

13511213132221112331133223311111112213.content:
As the foursome sat waiting in Liara's office, they were feeling a little more relaxed now that they had some assistance from two people who actually knew what the hell was going on around them. "Do you think Earth will look... different?" Rebekah suddenly asked, causing her friends to look at her.

"Course it will, we're in the last half of the 22nd century." Steven answered, sitting his shapely backside on the couch next to his 'sister'.

"It will be nice seeing it though, see if we can recognize anything." Liz smiled, while Jessica nodded behind her.

Steven smirked, trying to imagine two Asari women getting nostalgic about Earth, when they weren't even supposed to have been born there. "There might be a few landmarks left. But for all we know, there might have been a nuclear war on Earth at some point. What if they had to rebuild?" He thought aloud.

"That would suck!" Jessica muttered,

"Ya think?" Rebekah spoke up again.

Liz stayed positive, as always. "I'm sure nothing like that has happened, and at least now we're not stumbling about in the dark. We've got some help and we'll soon be back on Earth." She said. Though she knew full well it wouldn't be the Earth they knew.

========

Their conversation was suddenly interrupted by the return of Nyxeris, who sashayed into the office in her fetching gown. "I've arranged passage for you all on the next ship out of Illium. The ship is the MV Triton, a civilian freighter heading for Alliance space. She'll be passing by Arcturus Station, so you should be able to get onboard an Alliance vessel from there. No doubt you'll be recognized, at least... your bodies will be. So you should have no trouble getting to Earth." Nyxeris explained in length.

"Thank you so much." Liz responded gratefully.

Nyxeris nodded, then also passed over another tablet device, explaining that on it was all the information she could compile about Liara, Samara, Miranda and Oriana, so that the four 'strangers' could better identify with their new lives. "I suppose I don't have to warn you all to be careful out there. It's an extremely dangerous galaxy, and I would hate for any of you to die prematurely." The lovely Asari continued, as Liz took the tablet from her.

"We appreciate it." Liz smiled again

"You're welcome. Hawthorne is currently getting you transportation up to the space dock. Have a safe journey." Nyxeris said, before turning and leaving the room.

"That'll be handy." Steven commented, gesturing to the tablet in Liz's azure-colored hand.

"Don't drop it!" Rebekah then smiled, trying to sound upbeat.
13511213132221112331133223311111112213.title: Sitting around and mingling amongst themselves...

135112131322211123311332233111111122131.content:
"H-holy crap." Jessica stared in open mouthed wonder at the large, blocky, grey shuttle that stood at the docking bay. Gone was the timidity that suffused her back in the office, a certain, unshakeable excitement had filled her. It was a childhood dream come true! She would finally get to soar through space.

She felt a tap on her shoulder. "Might want to tone it down." Said Steven, barely suppressing a chuckle.

"Oh, s-sorry." Jessica immediately slumped down, a purple blush seeping across her face.

A couple of the blue skinned women glanced at Jessica before muttering amongst themselves. They were not the only ones, as seeing a Justicar act like an excited little girl was... unusual, to say the least.

Rebekah glanced around. Eyeing the particular colorful crowd made up of humans, blue women, lizard people, and many others. It sort of surprised her how much this looked like a modern (21st century) train station. Only more... future-y. There were ticket counters, ticket dispensers, even those train ticket verification machines.

She supposed some things were timeless...

It was at that moment Nathaniel elbowed and shoved his way through the crowd.

"Alright, got our tickets." He said, holding out five (not-so-futuristic-looking) paper slips. "Once again, we're getting off at the Arcturus station. After that, well..." He shrugged. "We'll find out if there's anything that can get us to earth."

As the five walked through the ticket verification machine, a figure watched them from the sidelines. Dressed in the customary blue and white colors, this man struck a completely unassuming figure. Once he saw the five disappear into the ship, he pulled out a small tablet device.

"Sheep left for station, advise."

A crackly, distorted voice responded. "Let them. We have people elsewhere."
135112131322211123311332233111111122131.title: Getting aboard the MV Triton.

1351121313222111233113322331111111221311.content:
"So what is this... Arcturus Station we're heading to again?" Liz asked Hawthorne as the shuttle began moving. Jessica held tight onto Steven's arm as it did so, feeling her stomach doing flips.

Hawthorne talked as quietly as Liz was doing. "Basically, the headquarters of the Alliance Navy. Um... Earth's military forces in other words. It's a five kilometer wide station housing about 45,000 people, including the Alliance Parliament. It's orbiting near a gas giant called Themis. It's the nerve center for every military mission and outpost that we have out here. The Second, Third and Fifth fleets are all based there. And handily, its located near the nexus of several mass relays." He explained.

"Um... mass what-sits?" Rebekah chimed in, frowning more than a little.

"It's hard to describe in words. You'll see one in action soon enough." Hawthorne smiled. "Simply put, its the means of traveling across the galaxy quickly."

"Oh, like light speed?" Liz asked.

Hawthorne nodded. "Yeah something like that. Bit more complicated though." He said to Liz in Liara's body.

"And they'll let us aboard?" Steven inquired.

"If you do your homework, I mean... read those files about the people whose bodies you're in, then yes, they'll let you aboard." Hawthorne replied, while at the same time wondering just how a man from the past was coping being in Miranda Lawson's sexy, buxom body. "You... er... Miranda and Liara, even Samara are well known throughout the Alliance for assisting Commander Shepard during her suicide mission against the Collector Base."

"Suicide mission? Sounds like fun." Steven chuckled nervously.

"Well, you... they all came back, amazingly. Speaks a ton about Shepard's leadership abilities. It was a pleasure to have served aboard the Normandy with her."

"Normandy?" Jessica now frowned, causing Hawthorne to sigh.

"Look, read the files, you'll learn everything you need to know okay." Hawthorne told them, as they were buffeted about by the shuttle exiting Illium's atmosphere. A few minutes later and they were docking with the civilian freighter the MV Triton.

"Alright, I'll show you all to your quarters, but don't get too comfortable. The trip to Arcturus through the local mass relay will only take a few hours." Hawthorne explained again as he led the clueless foursome through the corridors of the freighter.

They remained unaware that they were being shadowed...
1351121313222111233113322331111111221311.title: On the ship...

choices: They manage to get a ship off of Arcturus.
1351121313222111233113322331111111221311.content:
Even if they all had their own quarters, they all (save for Nathaniel) chose to hang out in Liz's quarters. Liz had hoped that this would be a good time to catch up, for them to come together, pool their resources and make heads and tales of the strange universe they had found themselves in.

Everyone else, however...

"Could you at least pretend to care!" Liz called out in her "authoritarian supervisor" voice.

No one made any indication that she had been heard. Steven gleefully immersed himself in the large, holographic video screen on the wall. As it turned out, videogames were still a thing in the future and he was having fun converting giant bugs into green paste with rocket launchers. Rebekah leaned over his shoulders, oohing and cringing in equal measure at what was on the screen.

"It's so... big!" Muttered Jessica as she stared out the window. To think that she was actually in space, soaring through the stars like Captain Kirk or Hans Solo...

Liz let out a low grumble and went back to her tablet. Okay, where was she? Something about "collectors-"

Suddenly, the cabin started to vibrate. Immediately, everyone dove to grab some nailed down object.

"Oh god! Are we going to crash!" Screeched Rebekah. "I'm too young to die!"

Liz and Jessica's eyes went to the window. What they saw was a large, pointed structure. A pulsating blue ball sat at its center and what looked like a stroke of electricity reached out to envelope their ship

"Relay jump imminent." Blared the voice from the intercom.

Something clicked in Steven's head.

"Is that the mass relay?" The foursome's eyes widened as a new sense of wonder came over them. None of them could hide the slight trepidation they all felt.

"Jump in 3...2...1..."

And the ship was off. The view from the windows blurred into a blue mass.

"Wheee!" Jessica threw her arms up in the air.

Meanwhile, a shadowy figure that "just so happened" to pass by their cabin shook his head in befuddlement. Seeing those four act like excited children was both surreal and hilarious in equal measures.
1351121313222111233113322331111111221311.title: Entering the mass relay.

choices: Meanwhile, aboard the prison ship Purgatory.
1351121313222111233113322331111111221311.content:
"Miss Lawson, I expected you and your sister to come to us for protection sooner or later." A gruff voiced, uniformed man said to Steven no sooner had he stepped off the ship ahead of his friends. He looked a little surprised.

"Admiral Hackett, sir!" Nathaniel saluted the officer stood before them.

"At ease soldier." The Admiral nodded, returning the salute.

"Miss Lawson and her sister are being pursued by Cerberus forces, their lives are in danger. There were two attempts to either kill or apprehend them on Illium." Nathaniel then reported to his superior.

By this time, Admiral Hackett's attention was on the two Asure-skinned beauties stepping off the shuttle. One of them he was on friendly terms with, the other he knew by reputation only. "Good to see you Doctor T'Soni." He greeted Liz. "And a Justicar too. To what do we owe the pleasure?" He added, glancing at a surprised Jessica.

"I'm um.. helping Liara." Jessica replied nervously.

"I bet you make a formidable team." Admiral Hacket said, almost breaking into a slight smile.

Nathaniel couldn't help but chuckle at that comment. Normally Liara and Samara would probably have been able to take out a small army with their biotic powers. But the two women now inhabiting their bodies... were not capable of such things, he thought. He doubted they could even control their powers, but he wasn't sure. After all Steven had been able to use Miranda's powers to deadly effect.

"Commander Shepard will be relieved to know you're all safe." The Admiral said, "Now if you'll excuse me, I have duties to attend to. I've booked passage for you to Earth aboard the SSV Orizaba."

"Thank you Admiral." Liz smiled in gratitude.

After his superior had wandered off, Nathaniel raised both eyebrows in surprise. "The Orizaba, hmm..." He mumbled.

"A special ship?" Steven asked.

"Kind of, mainly because of her commanding officer, Hannah Shepard." Nathaniel answered. "She's Commander Shepard's mother. The Orizaba is the flagship of the Alliance's Fifth Fleet."

"I hope we get to meet this Commander Shepard." A curious Rebekah smiled.

"There's a good chance of that, since we're heading to Earth." Nathaniel nodded. "And she does know you all personally, well... the people you are now." Nathaniel knew however that Shepard was an excellent judge of character, and she may be able to detect that something was 'off' about Miranda, Oriana, Liara and Samara.

The group made their way through the massive Acturus station, to where the Kilimanjaro-class dreadnought SSV Orizaba was docked.
1351121313222111233113322331111111221311.title: They land at Arcturus.

13513.content:
Natalie had no idea what hapened, as with her co-workers. One minute she was in the tea room at work, the next... god knows where. A sudden gasp escaped her lips as she stumbled backwards from the control station she was suddenly stood at. She looked around at her unfamiliar surroundings, seeing several other people, none of whom she recognized. What the hell? Where am I?

She was in what looked to her like some sort of advanced laboratory, and everyone she could see was wearing the same kind of... 'uniform'? Form hugging uniforms from the looks of them. Black, white and grey uniforms with some sort of yellow insignia on the sleeve

It was then that Natalie looked down at herself, and sure enough... she was attired in an identical uniform, her breasts perfectly emphasized by the fabric. Did someone cut my hair?? she then scowled, running her fingers through her shorter hair. By this time confusion had really set in, and panic was showing it's head. She took a closer look at her surroundings, in particular the large, glowing, 3D representation of a... something. Wow! Natalie gasped again, walking up the few steps in front of her to inspect it more closely. She stepped back immediately when several pointers on the 'image' were highlighted.

Even Natalie, with her limited knowledge of astronomy, eventually realized that was she was looking at was an advanced 3D rendering of a galaxy? "Seriously what the fuck is going on here?" she asked herself, her palms getting sweaty.

A voice behind her caused Natalie to spin around. "Are you okay Kelly?" a man asked her.

"Er... me? Um... who's Kelly?" Natalie answered with a puzzled frown. Then she had a more important question. "Where the hell am I?" She was that distressed, she didn't notice her voice now had a definite American accent.

The man wasn't sure how to respond to Natalie's odd questions. "You been hitting the ryncol?" he eventually asked with a chuckle.

"Answer me!" Natalie demanded, more out of panic then anger.

"You're... Kelly, and you know where you are, you're on the Normandy." the man said, playing along.

"Wait, what? Isn't that in France?" Natalie inquired. She'd been once for a holiday.

The man shook his head. "Very funny Kelly, you're hilarious, now stop messing around. I doubt Shepard kept you around for your sense of humor." he said dryly before walking away.

Natalie was annoyed that she had got no answers and no help from that guy. When some doors opened behind her, Natalie spun around to see another man dressed in a similar uniform to hers step out of an elevator. Thoroughly lost by this time, and in need of answers, Natalie headed into the elevator and waited for the doors to close. She now had a choice of several 'floors' to choose from, including Commander's Cabin, Crew's Quarters and Engineering. This a ship or something? Natalie scoffed quietly, randomly hitting the 'Crew Quarters' button.

The speed with which the elevator moved at surprised Natalie, and she felt her stomach churn. "Oh god!" she groaned, steadying herself. Luckily the trip didn't last very long, just a few seconds, then the elevator doors shot open.

The first thing Natalie saw when she stepped out of the elevator was some kind of plaque with the names of 20 people on it. A memorial plaque maybe? She shrugged, then resumed her search for the answers she so desperately needed.
13513.title: Natalie wakes up.

135131.content:
"What sci-fi movie have I walked into?" Natalie muttered as she stepped away from the memorial slab. The "crew quarters" only created more questions than answers. There were more people here, all wearing that same uniform that she had seen most everyone else squeezed into.

Natalie's eyes were first drawn to a man and woman who sat at one of the tables. The two were rather vocal about their dissatisfaction over the food. The name "Mess Sergeant Gardner" came up a couple times.

Sergeant? Was Natalie in some sort of military?

As if to confirm her thoughts, a rather broad looking man carrying a gun (a futuristic rifle? Natalie wasn't very good with firearms), stepped toward the elevator. Natalie got an odd look from him when she quickly scampered out of the way.

"Definitely military." she whispered. Just as she said it, a wave of panic began to set in. Crap, this was bad. In this messed up... whatever reality she woke up in, she just had to be a member of the military? She barely knew anything about normal guns, let alone any of this futuristic crap. What the hell would the captain... commander... whatever the guy in charge was called do to her if she couldn't do her job?

Natalie took in a deep, calming breath. No, no. Panicking would not do her any favors. She needed to figure out what exactly was up and then come up with a plan to fix it.

Alright, judging from everything she had seen, she was probably on some sort of ship. Considering that representation of the galaxy she saw, this was probably one of those "Star Trek" ships. But...

She walked down the crew quarters, heedless of the red lights toward the end and...

What... was that?

Something looked up at her. It was completely clad in metal a blue and black metal suit. Hell, she had seen renditions of knights that wore much less armor. But that... that was not the part that caused her to gasp.

Its head... the closest she could get to describing it was some strange cross between a lizard and a bug.

Natalie ducked out of sight, into one of the open doors of the crew quarters.

Garrus bemusedly glanced at her, before rubbing at the scar on the side of his face.

"And they told me I looked fine."
135131.title: Continuing Natalie's POV.

1351311.content:
"What the hell was that?" Natalie asked another female crew member who was exiting the sick bay nearby.

The woman just frowned. "What was what, Kelly?"

"That... thing that just got in the elevator." she pointed in the vague direction Garrus had walked.

The woman was just perplexed. "You know who Garrus is, he's the only Turian on the ship." she told Natalie.

"Turian??" Natalie sighed, totally lost. "You know what, never mind, I'll figure it out on my own." she said, rubbing her forehead.

"Maybe you should see Doctor Chakwas if you're not feeling well Kelly. What a lot of us went through at the hands of the Collectors is bound to leave it's mark on anyone, seeing innocent people liquified like that. Sickening." the woman suggested.

Liquified? People? Natalie shook her head. But the idea of a doctor sounded good. At the very least she could give her a sedative and knock her out. Then hopefully she'd wake up from this nightmare. "Thanks, the doctor sounds like a good idea." Natalie forced out a smile, then headed towards the sick bay. The automatic door opened up and she walked inside. There was only one other person in the room, an older woman with grey hair and a slightly different... and more form fitting uniform. And the one thing Natalie immediately noticed, is the woman looked as puzzled as she was. "Er... Doctor... Chakwas?" Natalie mumbled, successfully remembering her name.

"Hmm, oh... can I - help you?" The doctor frowned, fidgeting from one foot to the other.

"I certainly hope so." Natalie nodded. "How can I put this? Um... I feel like I don't belong here. In fact... I DON'T belong here." she blurted out

Doctor Chakwas took a seat, continuing to stare up at the young woman who had entered 'her' sick bay. "Go on..." she mumbled.

Natalie let out another sigh and then started pacing the room, wondering what to say. And it was then that she caught sight of her reflection in a mirror. It was the reflection of a woman she didn't know. Whose body was she in? How did this happen? The questions raced through Natalie's mind as she reached up to touch her face and then run her hands down her body.

Seeing the odd behavior of the woman in front of her, Doctor Chakwas spoke again. "Who are you?"

Natalie drew her gaze from the mirror and looked at the doctor in disbelief. "You wouldn't believe me if I told you." she murmured.

"You might be surprised." the doctor responded, arching an eyebrow.
1351311.title: Natalie asks around.

choices: One or both tries to dig up more information
13513111.content:
A short moment of silence filled the room as Natalie internally debated as what to do next. On one hand, she would probably receive that condescending lecture that doctors usually reserve for mad (wo)men.

And why shouldn't Dr. Chakwas? Looking into the mirror had given her a little bit of sympathy for the few others she had talked to ever since she woke up. If one of her coworkers began asking who she was and mistaking Wilkos for some backwater planet, she would certainly have dismissed them as insane.

But, on the other hand. Natalie was a little tired of panicking and having no idea what was going on. Natalie could get one ally, ONE ally who she could talk normally with, that would be nice. At the very least, this "Doctor Chakwas" wasn't squinting at Natalie as if she had lost her marbles.

She came to a decision.

"It's kind of complicated, but..." Natalie shifted from foot to foot. This was it, the moment of truth. She mentally prepared to receive that squinty eyed look.

"Everyone calls me Kelly, but I... well... my name is Natalie, and I..."

"...Live in England and work in a hardware store called Wilkos." Dr. Chakwas finished with a slight grin.

Natalie's eyes almost bulged right out of their sockets. "What? How did you..." A sudden epiphany hit her right in the back of her head.

She squinted her eyes. "Don't tell me..."

"Dr. Chakwas" flashed Natalie a warm and genuine smile. "I'm Nicola."

For a couple of seconds, all Natalie could do was stare at the old doctor who had identified herself as Natalie's senior in work. But then, a warm feeling of relief arose within her, causing her to break out into a wide smile.

"Oh Nicola, thank god!" Natalie ran up and hugged the older woman. "I just had no idea what was going on or why I look like this and I was afraid that...that..."

Nicola just patted Natalie on the back.

*****


"So, from what I can gather, we are on some ship called 'Normandy.'" Natalie said, pacing back and forth in front of Nicola. After Natalie had calmed down a little, what was supposed to be a therapy session had become an information exchanging session.

"We seem to be part of some sort of military group, if the uniforms and guns are to be believed." Natalie couldn't help but shudder. Despite her fiance formerly being a part of the military, she had never seen an actual gun in her life, let alone shot one. To think that she might actually have to catch bullets...

"And there was this weird bug-lizard thing walking around." Nicola raised an eyebrow at that. "A... Turian. At least that's what someone I talked to called it."

Natalie decided to leave out the part about "liquefying people." She had no idea what to think of it. Actually, she didn't even want to entertain the very thought.

Nicola nodded slowly. "Troubling." she muttered in a voice that sounded nothing like Nicola's actual voice. "I'm sorry to say, but I haven't really left this room since I, well, 'woke up.' I don't really have much to add."

Natalie couldn't really blame her. Had Natalie "woken up" in an empty room like this, she would've probably just locked the door and refused to come out until everything had gone back to some semblance of normality.

Neither of them had brought up how they might have gotten here. They somehow both knew that it would only create more questions than it would answer.

Knowing that she was not alone did a lot to help Natalie's state of mind. However, it didn't really answer the very important questions: how did they get here, how could they return everything to normal, and, perhaps most importantly, what do they do next?
13513111.title: The first reunion.

choices: Suki finds her way to the sick bay.
135131112.content:
While all this had been going off above her, poor Suki had been trying to make sense of things herself. She had found herself stood in front of a console, and there was a constant hum that seemed to be all around her. Added to that, the guy next to her who had a Scottish accent was rattling on about something or other. But that wasn't the biggest shock, when Suki looked down at her arms... she saw she was now white. "Oh my god!" she mumbled initially.

"Gabby, something wrong?" the man next to her asked, when he saw his 'ship mate' inspecting her own hands.
