Utterly bewildered, Suki was unsure what to do next. Her surroundings seemed vaguely familiar to her for some reason. Ignoring the man asking her questions, Suki left the console she was at and walked a short distance, until the Normandy's Tantalus drive core came into view. Then she realized where she was, having played Mass Effect a few times on and off. She was on board the SSV Normandy SR-2. A Cerberus-built frigate.

"Any particular reason why you're not answering me love?" the man asked again. Suki remembered his name suddenly, Engineer Kenneth Donnelly. And he was calling her "Gabby". Which could only mean... no - that was impossible. Right? But apparently not, Suki looked down at herself again, clad in a form-fitting Cerberus uniform. I'm Gabriella Daniels? she gasped silently.

"Um... sorry. " Suki finally responded, "Just not feeling myself." she added. That statement was definitely true.

"You might want to get back to monitoring the core's output just saying." Kenneth shrugged, gesturing to the vacated console next to him. "You know EDI appreciates all the help we can give her."

But Suki had more important things to worry about. She had a million questions that needed answers. First and foremost... how the hell did she end up in the body of one of the Mass Effect characters? As minor a characters as "Gabby" was, Suki was still onboard - in layman's terms - a spaceship. And that meant, everything in the video game, mass relays, space stations, aliens... were all real now. Suki wondered whether she was tripping.

"Er... Gabby?" Kenneth's voice again sounded out, causing Suki to snap herself out of her trance.

"Hold down the fort for me? I gotta pee." Suki said, scurrying out of Engineering. She knew enough about the game to navigate her way around the Normandy. Which is a lot more than Natalie and Nicola knew how to do.

When she was about to hop in the elevator, Suki suddenly had to ask herself... where was she going? If she was really on the Normandy - alone - then who would she talk to about what she was experiencing. Everyone would think she was mad. It didn't matter, she couldn't stay in Engineering right now, not with Kenneth nattering in her ear all the time. She got in the elevator and hit the button for the Crew's Quarters.

She hoped she would find help there.
135131112.title: Elsewhere on the normandy...

choices: Suki fills in some of the holes in Natalie and Nicola's theories.
1351311121.content:
The first thing Suki saw when she left the elevator was a plaque with many--about twenty--names on it.

"A memorial plaque?"

Indeed, most of the twenty names, she could not recognize, however, one name in particular stood out.

"Kaiden Alenko..." she read slowly.

This... really put the Virmire mission in perspective...

Suki snapped back to reality when the Turian she recognized as Garrus walked past her, giving her a rather odd look, before stepping into the elevator. Suki only saw him for a few seconds, but it was utterly surreal. A character from a videogame, one that was only supposed to be a collection of pixels, good scripting, and voice acting appearing, as a living breathing being.

Suki closed her eyes and sucked in a breath of air; a breathing technique she recalled her older sister teaching her.

Right, she still needed to know what to do...

Suki continued forward into the... common room-ish area. At the very least, the area that had a lot of tables and wasn't a medical bay or sleeping quarters. The only occupants in the room were a man and a woman who sat at one of the tables, sitting in silence. Suki recognized them from the Special Ingredients quest.

Suki's thoughts went back to the memorial wall. That... disturbed her a little. Not just the thought that all the time she was playing through Mass Effect, she had been watching ACTUAL people dying.

In the end, Suki wandered in the direction of the sick bay. Really, this action came out of nothing more than indecisiveness. She might have even toured the whole Normandy had she not heard, just outside the door...

"...I haven't really left this room since I, well, 'woke up.' I don't really have much to add."

Suki froze.

"But what do we do? We cant just go asking around. Everyone already would think we've gone mad."

Hope fluttered up into Suki's chest. Were there others like her? Someone else she could confide in?

Without thinking much, she rushed into the sickbay, to be greeted by a wide-eyed Dr. Chakwas and Kelly Chambers.

They all stared...

"Um..." Suki muttered. "Wilkos?"

Kelly and Dr. Chakwa exchanged a glance and then slowly nodded.

"Um... I'm Suki."
1351311121.title: Suki finds her way to the sick bay.

13513111212.content:
Jade had quite a shock when she went from being in the almost quiet environs of the tea room to suddenly being in a nightclub of some sort, loud music reverberating in her head. She was sat alone at a little table with a drink on it. It was in a funky glass, and the people around her... well, they were dressed strangely, in fact... some of them looked weird. Are they wearing costumes? Jade asked herself inwardly. Some of the people she could see resembled overgrown birds in armor, some women appeared to have blue skin and funny looking hair. "And where the hell am I anyway?"

It wasn't until Jade reached for the glass on the table in front of her to have a drink, that she realized something wasn't very wrong about herself. For a start, she had black skin, except for her palms. The strobe effects and dimmed lights didn't help her sight, but she was definitely a darker skin tone now.

Then came the biggest shock of all, she felt a certain 'swelling' sensation in her pants, The crotch of the skin-tight military-type uniform she was wearing was bulged out, which confirmed that she now had a... penis?

"Oh my god!!" Jade tried to squeal, but it came out as more of a yell. She instantly noticed her deeper, masculine voice.

I'm in a man's body... Jade gasped, patting herself down. A black man's body...

When Jade saw one of the 'blue' women frowning at her behavior, she decided to sit back down. She would have fallen down anyway eventually since she was suddenly feeling nauseous. How the hell could she be a man?? And just where was she? Closer inspection at some of the people around her revealed that they weren't wearing costumes, or if they were they were incredibly lifelike.

"This is all a dream, and I'm gonna wake up any minute." Jade repeated to herself, closing her eyes. When she opened them again and saw she was still in the club, she grabbed the drink in front of her and downed it in one shot. She coughed a little, unprepared for it's strength. But if there was ever a time for alcohol, Jade knew that this was it.

She nervously moved one hand under the table and onto her crotch. Yep... she definitely had a dick... and it was hard. This is so messed up, what the fuck is happening to me? she thought, as the alcohol immediately warmed her up inside.

Just then she caught sight of another individual in the nightclub, sat at a table some distance away. What appeared to be a woman with a dark ponytail, but her hair was completely shaved off at the sides. And she had tattoos all over her head, neck, arms and presumably the rest of her body to. The thing Jade noticed most about the woman, was she seemed to acting as puzzled and 'lost' as she was.

Jade realized she had nothing to lose, and so she stood up and walked over to the woman's table.
13513111212.title: Meanwhile, on the Citadel.

choices: Charlotte and Jade trade fake backstories.
Meanwhile, all the way in Mars.
135131112121.content:
The first thing Charlotte noticed was the music. A loud synthetic pop song blared out, hammering against her head. She let out a groan before lifting her head from the table and opening her eyes.

Her eyes immediately widened in surprise.

Flashing lights, loud music, people bouncing around in the vague approximation of a dance, and the glass of dark liquid on the table.

She was in a nightclub.

A pretty funky nightclub, too. She wasn't sure if it were a trick of the light or not, but some of those costumes were downright weird. Women with funny looking protrusions out of their heads and skinny, anthropomorphic frogs were the least of what she saw.

Best nightclub I've seen. She thought dryly. She remembered, in her younger years, she had actually gone to one. It was nothing like they were portrayed in fiction. Loud, stuffy, and crowded; the best description she could come up with for it.

This was more like the nightclubs in fiction.

So... she went to work, fell asleep... and woke up at some nightclub?

Charlotte frowned as she pondered over these questions. She reached out and pushed her glass away from her. She knew not to fuck with booze. She was a lightweight. She once passed out when drinking something that her friend, Maddy, had derisively called "water."

...

What was up with her arm?

It was harder to see under the strobes and dim illumination, but her sleeves were made of leather... and her hands were covered in tattoos.

She quickly looked down.

What the... What the fuck?

She brushed a hand up to her head, feeling her face and working up to the top of her head. She only felt a thin strip of hair that ended in a ponytail.

So... not only did she wake up in a nightclub, but someone made her over into some punkish nightmare...

No, she wasn't just redressed. Her whole body felt wrong.

She was much more lean and muscular, though her features seemed a lot... sharper. Her breasts were much larger and she was quite sure she had shrunk an inch or two.

There was also that disconcerting "tightness" in her pants.

However, Charlotte snapped out of her thoughts when she heard the scraping of a chair on the floor. A large, muscular black man sat down at the table.

Crap! Panic arose in Charlotte's chest. Was he going to hit on her?

*****

This woman truly looks bizarre. Jade thought as she looked the tattooed punk girl up.

Originally, Jade was quite determined to grill the girl for information, maybe even find out if she had a kindred spirit in what was the strangest day of her life.

However, her mouth suddenly dried up when she got a closer look. This woman, well...

She looked dangerous.

In the end, Jade decided to forego spilling out that her name was Jade and she used to be an English woman before... whatever happened happened. She decided to take a different approach to socializing.

"Um... hey?" she said, wincing slightly at the very masculine voice she spoke with. "What are you doing here?"
135131112121.title: Jade initiates the chat.

choices: Meanwhile, back in the SOL system, on Mars.
1351311121212.content:
The first thing Mona was aware of after she 'woke up' was the fact that she was wearing some kind of hood that was a part of a skin-tight outfit. Her surroundings immediately looked familiar, but... she couldn't fathom where she was straight away because of her disorientation. There were people all around her, and... aliens?? "Oh my god, that's a Turian!" she gasped, seeing a member of C-Sec armed with a Phaeston pulse rifle.

Her shock only grew when she saw a Salarian walk past, muttering to himself. "Holy crap!" Mona gasped. Then it dawned on her, when she looked up at the vast expanse of the Citadel, that she was somehow in the Mass Effect universe. How could this be?"

"First time on the Citadel ma'am?" the Turian suddenly addressed Mona, causing her head to jerk around.

"Um... hi, yeah... could say that." Mona answered nervously.

Mona was versed enough in the Mass Effect saga to know the names of the characters, the different species and some planets etc. And seeing an actual Turian in the flesh... or rather scales... was amazing.

The Turian chuckled. "Yeah she's a beauty alright. When I was accepted into C-Sec, I felt so damn lucky to be able to work here." he said, looking up as the skycars flew past one after another. The gentle hum of their engines echoing slightly. Mixed with the indistinct chatter of the people around her, Mona started feeling 'excited' a well as shocked.

Then the chat with the C-Sec guard took a different direction. "Say, you look familiar come to think of it. Haven't I seen you before?" the suspicious Turian asked as he looked at Mona.

Mona's stomch started doing flips a little. "Er... no, I don't - think so." she mumbled defensively.

"Hmm, maybe it's just the hood. It's not a good idea to hide yourself under one of those around here, might draw unwanted attention." the Turian muttered.

That was when Mona lifted up her hands and felt the material of the hood covering her head. She studied her hands for a moment. They weren't big, but they weren't exactly as small as her hands usually were either. And what about the outfit she was wearing, it looked more than familiar. She ran her hands down over her torso and inhaled a deep breath.before exhaling. "Good advice." she said to the Turian, only then realizing her voice was different also.

Something clicked inside Mona at that moment. Am I... Kasumi? The uniform matched, as did her voice. Master thief and one-time Normandy crew member Kasumi Goto. The very fact that Mona could actually be that character was... unbelievable. But then... so was being on the Citadel and so was havng a conversation with an 'overgrown bird' clad in armor.

"Well, you take care of yourself ma'am." the Turian nodded to Mona, before returning to his post.

"Thanks, you too." Mona mumbled in a quiet tone, as she walked away.

After making her way down into the main market of the area where she was, Mona suddenly stopped in her tracks and frowned. She felt a sudden and slight 'stirring' in her pants. She frowned and looked down at herself. No fucking way.....
1351311121212.title: Elsewhere on the Citadel.

choices: Back at the Citadel in Purgatory
13513111212123.content:
W-where am I?

Laura felt a strange, as if she were immersed deep in the ocean. No, more of, as if tiny bits of her consciousness were dispersed along the ocean. Along with it came a smattering of sensations that she... wasn't even sure how to describe.

But that was just the tip of the iceberg.

She couldn't feel her arms, legs, head or any familiar muscle or limb at all. There wasn't even some phantom stump or anything. Those body parts and the sensations that came with them were outright gone. She didn't even seem to be capable of breathing...

Her eyes snapped open.

Or, rather, she opened all of her "eyes."

...Only to quickly close them back up.

The sensory input was... overwhelming. And that was putting it lightly. All at the same time, she had seen at least eight different rooms.

Was this... some sort of ship?

Most of those rooms she had scene looked, to her, directly out of the set of Star Wars; complete with the crew dressed in form fitting military uniforms, a large whirring machine that she did not know the function of, and the large hologram of the galaxy.

Laura paused, floating... lying? Whatever she was doing in this "ocean."

What... was she?

She was quite sure that "human" was no longer the answer. But when thinking of something that doesn't breathe and has eyes, well, everywhere, she was at a loss.

Panic began creeping in.

What was she? What was she!? What was going on!?

On impulse, she opened her "eyes" again. This time, sound filtered through.

At least five different conversations filtered in.

Cerberus? Collectors? Heed Industries Helios... something? Almost all of the conversations were completely meaningless to Laura.

Except one.

"In that case, we don't mention Wilkos or England, we just have to keep a low profile-"

Hope!

A kindred spirit!

Somehow, Laura was able to get her consciousness to coalesce and surge right into the room she heard the conversation.

"Um, hey?" Came a bashful, synthetic sounding voice that definitely was not Laura's.

*****


In the sickbay, all the women in the room leapt in surprise when one of the terminals started glowing blue, and a blue, holographic ball popped out.

"Um... hey?"

Natalie and Nicola slowly backed away, shock etched onto their faces. However, Suki frowned slightly.

"EDI?"
13513111212123.title: And back aboard the Normandy...

135131112121232.content:
When Waggy's eyes opened again, she was shocked to see that she was no longer in Wilkos. She was some kind of hospital from what she could tell, but it was a very futuristic looking one. Certainly not one she was used to. http://www.nexusmods.com/Images/208/5449... Many people were standing around or seeing to patients, and some of them looked particular strange to Waggy.

But what panicked Waggy the most was how she was seeing all this. Her eye sight wasn't 'normal', she was seeing things differently and it was almost impossible for her to describe. But she could see well enough, her vision was excellent in fact.

"Thane Krios?" a voice suddenly got Waggy's attention. She turned to see a funny looking woman standing there in a skin tight white and grey medical outfit. Are those hair tentacles? Waggy gasped. But she couldn't stare too long, it was - rude. Besides, she had other problems. Was this 'woman' calling her a funny name? Eventually she began speaking, only to clam up instantly. She did not recognize the 'alien' voice that left her mouth. Waggy got a bigger shock when she held up her hands, seeing the ring and middle fingers on both of them were fused together. Her panic increased ten-fold.

"Are you okay?" the blue-skinned woman in front of Waggy asked, as Waggy began feeling faint. And it wasn't as a result of the Kepral's Syndrome that she was unfortunately now afflicted with.

When a weird looking 'frog-like' doctor stepped forward to help the woman calm things, Waggy's mind went into sensory overload and she passed out.

********
When she came too some time later she was in a bed, hooked up to a machine of some sort, monitoring her vital systems. Waggy gasped and held up her strange looking hands again. What was she? What was this place? And... was this a nightmare? Questions she had no answers to.

The doors off to the right suddenly opened and in walked a woman, also attired in the same medical outift. She had shoulder-length red hair and she smiled at Waggy as she entered. "I hope you're feeling more comfortable." she said.

"Where am I?" Waggy asked, suddenly feeling fatigued.

"Huerta Memorial hospital, on the Citadel. Don't you remember passng out a while ago?" the woman answered Waggy's question.

Waggy just about to shake her head, but then it all came back to her in fine detail, thanks to the eidetic memory she now possessed. She stared at the ceiling for a moment, then turned back to the woman. "Have you got a mirror I could borrow?" She just had to know what she looked like, as much of a shock as she knew it would undoubtedly be. She already knew she was an alien, and obviously a male judging from her anatomy, but she had to know. The woman smiled and handed Waggy a small round mirror.

Peering into the glass... Waggy's lips parted and a stunned gasp escaped. The reflection of some reptilian-type humanoid greeted her, with large dark eyes with two sets of lids. What the hell am I??? That one questions echoed loudly in her stressed mind.

The female doctor managed to catch the mirror as Waggy passed out again from shock.

Fate it seemed had been more unfair to Waggy than to most of her co-workers. Such was this new, dangerous universe they now lived in.
135131112121232.title: Somewhere else in the Citadel

choices: The Normandy group finally decides upon a course of action.
Back on the Citadel with Mona.
Back on the Citadel with Charlotte and Jade.
1351311121212322.content:
Had Laura still had much of a body, she would've shrunk back in embarrassment from the stares from the three women. However, Laura could not really move, so the holographic ball just sort of floated there.

The silence was starting to get pretty awkward...

"Um... EDI?" Suki took a tentative step forward.

Laura finally realized she was being addressed. "Huh?"

Suki frowned. That... did not seem like anything EDI would say. Immediately, she knew where this was going. She walked up to the hologram.

"Wilkos. England. Any of those words ringing a bell?"

"Um... yes." Laura internally frowned. How did these people know about any of that. Not only could she recognize any of them, but they all looked like they came from some sort of Sci-fi novel...

This seemed to have a big effect on Suki, as she breathed out a sigh of relief. Even the other two women seemed to relax a little. However, before Suki could talk...

"Thank god!" Natalie stepped forward with a warm smile on her face. "I know we look different but, well, I'm Natalie."

She pointed at herself.

"Suki and Nicola." She pointed at the two other women in the room.

"Who are you and where are you?"

Natalie did not know that she was talking to one of the most advanced AIs in the known universe, she assumed that this newly found coworker was speaking to them through some intercom... or maybe a high-tech telephone.

A light burst of happiness flooded through Laura. At the very least, even if she had no idea what was going on, and even if they looked different, at least she had her coworkers from Wilkos there to support her.

"L... Laura." Laura somehow stammered out despite not having lips. "And, uh, I don't know where I am. there is just kind of a... well..."

Laura trailed off. Within the last couple of minutes, she had felt so many sensations she was sure the human language did not have words for. Hell, now that she knew how her "eyes" worked, she could see into all the other rooms... with perfect clarity, while having a conversation with these three. It was as if she had multiple thought processes going at once.

She had no idea how she would even begin describing it.

"Um, Laura." Suki muttered, putting her feet together and looking down at the floor. "I hate to tell you this, but you are EDI, an Artificial intelligence."

The room fell silent, just for a couple moments, before tendrils of panic crept right back up Laura's nonexistent back.
1351311121212322.title: Back on the Normandy.

13513111212123221.content:
Suki, as the only one of the foursome who knew anything about Mass Effect, did her best to answer the dozens of questions she had thrown at her. Of course she couldn't answer them all, and calming Laura down was the first priority. She assumed that Joker was currently flying the ship, which was probably a good thing, since Laura might not be able to, at least not yet. "We all need to stay calm, I know this is a lot to take in, and I have no idea why we're here..." Suki said.

"What if we're stuck here?" Natalie interrupted,

"And what about our families back home?" Nicola chimed in.

Suki didn't have the answers, she was as clueless as they were. All she knew if that they would have to adapt if they were going to survive. She knew just how dangerous this new universe was. "I don't know." she sighed, taking a seat. "But if we're all here, then that probably means Liz and the others may be around too, somewhere. And they could be anyone, even aliens." Suki continued.

"Aliens?" Nicola gasped in shock.

Suki nodded. "Yeah, there's several major races, Humans, Turians, Asari, Salarians and Krogans. Then there's Batarians, Rachni, Drell..."

Natalie stopped her. "Okay we get the point. I suppose we should be thankful that we're still Human then." she shrugged, glancing at Nicola.

"This is very disconcerting." The glowing blue 'ball' that was Laura suddenly said. "I can see and hear everything on the ship. I have ship schematics in my memory, all the knowledge is... overwhelming." she stated.

"Maybe Laura's A.I programming is helping her adjust?" Nicola suggested, not really knowing what she was even saying.

"Could be. Cerberus designed EDI to be the most advanced A.I in the galaxy. And when Joker unshackled her during the Collector attack, she gained the ability to learn for herself." Suki nodded, having a bit of hope for Laura's situation at least.

"The what attack?" Natalie inquired.

Suki got a vision of one of the settlers from Horizon being liquified aboard the Collector base, and she grimaced. "Er... you don't wanna know, believe me."

Natalie's eyebrow arched. She probably didn't.

"Right, Laura, if you can help us, we need you to report anyone else acting strange on the Normandy, okay? And Nicola, Natalie, we need to start searching the ship for the others. And we need to find out where the Normandy is exactly." Suki said, more or less taking charge.

Laura somehow immediatey had the answer. "The ship is docked at the... Citadel?"

"Oh boy!" Suki sighed. "Our search area just increased - massively." she supported her head in her hand.

"What's the Citadel?" Nicola asked.

"Only a huge space station, in layman's terms, basically the center of civilization in the galaxy." Suki answered with a mumble.

Just then Suki heard Joker's voice over the intercom. "Er... Doctor Chakwas, you might want to head down to the port cargo bay. one of the crew just reported that Grunt is acting weird. Well, you know... weirder than a tank-bred Krogan usually acts. Please tell me they only go through puberty once." he said, being his usualy comical self.

Suki jumped to her feet and looked at Nicola. "That's you... Doctor. And it looks like the cargo bay is our first port of call." she said. "EDI... er.... Laura, meet us down on the Engineering deck will you?"

"Affirmative." Laura mumbled in EDI's voice, before her pixelated blue ball disappeared.

"Now that sounded like the orginal EDI." Suki said to Natalie and Nicola, before leading them out of the door and to the elevator.
13513111212123221.title: The Normandy group finally decides upon a cours...

choices: After introductions, they come up with their next course of action.
Back on the Citadel, with 'Jack' and 'Jacob'.
135131112121232211.content:
Being the one who was everywhere on the Normandy at once, Laura managed to beat the other three to the engineering deck. It was a simple task of just refocusing her consciousness down to the terminal down there.

"Grunt" was hard to miss.

A large lizard thing had his head pressed against the wall right next to her terminal. Apparently, whatever crew member had reported "Grunt" had fled.

"Wake up. Wake up. Wake up. Wake up." He repeated to himself, speaking rapidly in a deep, gravelly voice.

The large lizard honestly unnerved Laura a little bit. However, she had been assured that inside that scaly frame was one of her coworkers from back at Wilkos.

"Um... hey."

The Krogan made no response.

"D-don't worry, I just want to h-help you."

Still no response. The lizard brought a hand up and punched himself in the head.

Thankfully, around that time, the elevator doors cracked open and Nicola, Natalie, and Suki stepped out. They didn't have to navigate much before they too could see the Krogan's mental breakdown.

"Wow." Natalie's eyes widened. It was her second time seeing an alien. While the first one had sort of resembled a lizard. It was a bit more... bird-like in presentation. A lot more lean as well. This one was built like a tank.

Seeing "Grunt" like that reminded Suki of Shepard recruiting him back in the game. The first thing the Krogan had done was pin Shepard against a wall and threaten him/her (for some reason, she liked playing male) with violence.

Even without hostile intent behind that frame, up close, the Krogan looked big and strong enough to shatter Suki's new bones without trying.

She needed to proceed with caution.

Surprisingly enough, Nicola took the whole thing in stride.

"Don't worry, we're here. You're safe."

Something that Nicola said seemed to strike a cord with Grunt, as he stopped his muttering and the large, reptilian head turned to face them.

Nicola took a step forward. "You're from Wilkos, right?"

The Lizard's eyes widened for a second before it nodded its head.

Nicola tilted her head up, to meet the Krogan in the eye. "May I ask your name."

A brief pause. A couple of seconds passed before he finally opened his mouth.

"K-... Kiran." he stammered out.
135131112121232211.title: Checking on 'Grunt'.

1351311121212322111.content:
While Laura kept a distraught Kiran talking at her terminal, Natalie, Suki and Nicola gathered together further alone the corridor. As usual, Suki was the one with the best idea what to do. "Look, since you lot know nothing about this game... or... real life new reality thingie..." she started clumsily, before rolling her eyes and running her fingers through her shorter hair. "Just... I don't know, follow my lead, if we have to do any talking, let me do it. And we really need to try and keep poor Kiran udner control. There's no telling what damage and injury she'll cause if she loses it."

"She's huge!" Natalie commented, glancing past her friends down the hallway at the 7' 5", armor-clad lizard. "What do you call that race again?" she asked Suki out of curiosity.

"They're called Krogan. Very tribal, warlike and very dangerous. The Salarians and Turians didn't inflict the genophage on them for nothing." Suki answered, before realizing her friends had no idea what the genophage, or Salarians even were. "Though Grunt - is a special case, he was tank-bred to be the perfect Krogan. she added. "Look we need to get off the ship and search the Citadel, since I've a feeling that's where we'll find the others."

"Sounds good to me." Natalie nodded. "But what about our 'duties' aboard ship?" she then inquired.

Suki shrugged. "Kenneth has things covered down here." she said, referring to Gabriella's 'work buddy'. "Oh yeah, should explain, I'm now Gabriella Daniels, an engineer, Natalie - you're Yeoman Kelly Chambers, kind of the Commander's personal assistant, and Nicola, well... you're the ships's doctor, Karin Chakwas."

"I have no idea how to treat people. I'm not a physician!" Nicola pointed out, a worried look on her face.

"Yeah well, I'm not an engineer, we'll have to wing it, that's all." Suki shrugged again. "First thing's first, we need to find everyone else." she stated.

They were interrupted by a crewman's voice on the intercom. Doctor Chakwas please report to the sick bay. The three of them looked at each other, then Nicola sighed. "Looks like you two will have to go on without me. But don't you dare leave me for too long, I don't know anybody else on this ship." she said to Suki and Natalie, before heading back to the elevator.

"What about Kiran? We taking her with us?" Natalie asked. Her expression said everything. She wasn't keen on the idea.

Suki thought about it, then decided not to take Kiran with them to the Citadel until she had calmed down. "No, Laura and Nicola can keep her occupied here." she eventually decided, before going back over to explain the plan of action.
1351311121212322111.title: After introductions, they come up with their ne...

choices: Meanwhile, someone shady-looking eyes up Mona.
13513111212123221111.content:
"So, you remember the plan, right?" Suki asked as she and Natalie walked to the exit.

"Uh-huh."

Suki frowned. Natalie still squinted her eyes curiously at her surroundings, fascinated by the futuristic castings of the ship. Suki couldn't really explain any of them. The game hadn't really gone into specifics of every single glowing light on the ship.

The plan was simple. Suki figured she would start at the landmarks she remembered from the game and work her way down from there. Maybe afterwards, she'd probably try the stores, especially those that sold more combative stuff. Even though it seemed a likely spot for quite a few members of the crew, she wanted to look up the bars as only a last resort.

Even she would admit, it was a flimsy plan, but it was the best she had.

*****


"Crap..." Suki muttered.

Suki and Natalie had exited the Normandy, woven through security, and exited into the upper wards before she came to a terrible realization.

The Citadel was... way bigger than it ever was in the game. That wasn't even doing it justice. Suki had been to a couple of metropolis' in her life; New Delhi, New York, and London; and this thing was comparable. More of, one "arm" of the citadel was comparable

Suki was also quick to realize that whatever Citadel they ventured through in the game was a very condensed version of the real one. That was not even getting into just how much more crowded it was, as Natalie and Suki had to go stand by a wall not to get carried off by the veritable sea of people.

"Oh my god..." Natalie stared up at the "sky", absolutely floored.

At least one of us is enjoying ourselves. Suki rolled her eyes. Had she not been inhabiting a body that was not hers as well as searching for misplaced coworkers, she might have fancied walking into a real version of her video game.

Suki shook her head. God, she really misjudged all of this.

She assumed that timeline-wise, they were either somewhere towards the end of ME2, the in-between point between it and the next game, or in ME3. Who knew what companions Shepard even obtained. Hell, she didn't even know what gender Shepard was, yet...
13513111212123221111.title: The trip to the Citadel.

135131112121232211112.content:
Mona was wandering through a random plaza on the Citadel, filled with kiosks and stalls, when she suddenly caught sight of a Turian, who if he was trying to look incognito, had failed miserably. More precisely Mona had caught his eye. And it only took a few seconds before the alien walked over to her. "Well, well, well, Kasumi Goto here on the Citadel. You after pulling off a heist? With all the C-Sec guys around here, that'd be ballsy even for you." the Turian chuckled.

Mona winced. An unfortunate choice of words indeed given what Mona had discovered about Kasumi... or rather - herself. "I'm sorry, do I know you?" Mona responded with a sigh. She may have been in Kasumi's body, but that didn't mean she was a master thief.

"I have to say I'm hurt. You don't remember me - Lucibius? We did several heists together." the Turian 'tried' reminding Kasumi, without knowing of course that a hardware store worker from another reality was now occupying her/his body. Mona wasn't sure which gender she classified as now.

Mona realized she had to improvise. "Ahh, sorry, my memory sometimes fails me. Getting old I guess. So, how you doing?" she asked the alien.

"Oh you know, getting by. Haven't done a job in ages though. But with you here, I was hoping you had something lined up?" the Turian mumbled, hopefully.

The two looked away from each other, faces nearly scarlet from blushing. At the very least, Rob was sure he was looking away from Mona. It was a little hard to tell, considering she now had the cloaking field up. After the incident with the Salarian and the broom closet, they had mutually agreed such a decision to be for the best.

They were back in the commercial district, much to both of their relief. Rob was just going to pick another direction, hopefully one that didn't lead them anywhere near the shady side of town, and keep walking until they saw something familiar, but he felt a slight tug on his sleeves.

"What?"

Mona turned visible and pointed toward the ward entrance.

Out in a crowd that contained primarily Asari and Turians with the occasional human, the Quarian stood out like a sore thumb. Tali'Zorah was a sight for very sore eyes. However, she didn't appear to have noticed "Kasumi" or "Miranda" as she had her face firmly trained forward.

The two "women" shared a relieved smile. "Shall we?"

"Definitely"

The two pushed their way through the crowd, happy to finally have a way out of their misadventure.
135131112121232211112112333233.title: Continuing with Rob and Mona.

choices: Rob and Mona find Charlotte and Jade.
1351311121212322111121123332332.content:
Tali's confusion only grew when 'Miranda' and 'Kasumi' requested that she escort them to the Normandy, the same way 'Jack' and 'Jacob' had requested to be led to Shepard. Did nobody have any knowledge of the Citadel's layout anymore? But the polite Quarian was only to happy to lead the hooded master thief and the "Cerberus bosh'tet cheerleader" back to the ship.

"Um... thanks Tali." Rob smiled at the Quarian.

"Sure thing. Now I've got to retrieve more of the crew who seem to be missing." Tali responded. It was clear she was annoyed, but in her own way. And because of her enviroment suit, neither Rob or Mona could tell if Tali was giving them a funny look.

Mona strolled aboard the Normandy, and Rob admired Tali's curves from behind as she walked off before following Mona inside the ship.

Shepard was there waiting for them in CIC (Combat Information Center). The commander was now out of her armor and was wearing an Alliance uniform, which was a portent of things to come. "Not like you to disappear Miranda." Shepard commented, as she stepped down from the galaxy map. Rob's excitement could barely be contained as he watched Commander Shepard approach him.

Shepard then glanced at Mona, and smiled. "I would say it's not like you to disappear Kasumi, but we both know that would be a lie." she smirked.

It took a moment for Rob to respond, and he only did so when Mona nudged him in the back. "Er... sorry Shepard, we um... got waylaid." he muttered, Miranda's sexy voice again leaving his mouth.

"Sure you didn't get lost?" Shepard's eyes narrowed a little.

"Lost?? No way." Rob scoffed, trying his best not to look stupid. "Just sorting out some... stuff, you know... clandestine - stuff." he chuckled nervously.

"Ah ha!" Shepard nodded. It was obvious she wasn't buying it, but she let it drop. "Anyway, don't go far, I'll have something to say to the crew once Tali has rounded up the others." she informed Rob and Mona.

"Others?" Mona inquired, her voice slightly groggy.

Shepard nodded. "Yeah, for some reason Kelly and Engineer Daniels have both left the ship. It seems the whole crew needs a reminder about regulations. But right now, I have to head down to the port cargo bay, Grunt is acting up again." she rolled her eyes.

"Oh?" Rob muttered, glancing to Mona, again sweeping his long black hair from his face. Sounded like they now had an idea where at least three more of their co-workers might be. "All right Shepard, we'll be down in the Crew's Quarters." Rob said. Then he and Mona got in the elevator with their commander and they got off first, allowing Shepard to continue down to the Engineering Deck.
1351311121212322111121123332332.title: Rob and Mona meet Shepard and the other staff.

13513111212123221111211233323323.content:
The moment the elevator doors shut behind him, Rob let out a loud gasp of air. "Aaahh. That was tense! Why did I have to end up as the stuck up priss?"

Mona, meanwhile, narrowed her eyes at him. "You know she didn't buy any of that."

They walked down the hall of the Normandy, ignoring the memorial slab. Mona lightly placed a gloved hand on the green screen in front of one of the doors, causing it to open up and reveal the crew quarters.

"The "waylaid part" was not a lie..."

Rob trailed off and his eyes widened. Standing there, face-to-face with them, was the heavily tattooed body of the violent and bloodthirsty biotic known simply as "Jack." Backing her up was the Cerberus operative, Jacob.

Both parties stared at each other, equally surprised.

Okay, Rob just need to play it cool. Stay in character, make a callous remark about her...

"Jack's" eyes narrowed. "You're not Miranda, are you?"

Rob supposed he shouldn't have been surprised. However, before he could say anything, Mona spoke up first.

"She's Rob and I'm Mona." She ignored the glare that Rob shot her. "And you are?"

"Charlotte and Jade." Charlotte replied tersely, quickly averting her eyes from Rob's body. Something that Rob noticed with a stab of annoyance. Was Charlotte staring at his boobs? He- urgh! He hated this body!

Still, at least from looking at Jacob, he wasn't exactly suffering alone as far as the whole genderbender thing went. Once again, Rob was about to say something when...

"Mona! Thank goodness!" A synthetic voice sounded, causing everyone to jump. Off on one of the terminals, everyone could see a glowing ball of blue light.

Mona was the first to react. "EDI, are you..."

"I'm Laura." EDI's voice said, speaking much more rapidly and cheerfully than any of them ever recalled hearing that voice in the game. "Its just... its just so good to see that you're all okay!"

A brief silence.

"Thank you E... Laura." muttered Rob.
13513111212123221111211233323323.title: Rob and Mona find Charlotte and Jade.

135131112121232211112112333233232.content:
Because of her omnipresent status, Laura knew exactly when anyone left or boarded the ship. And when Tali returned from her third trip around the Citadel's wards with the last two crew members in tow. Laura disappeared briefly from the terminal in the room with the others, then reappeared once she had gone to 'direct' Natalie and Suki in the right direction.

"Natalie and Suki are back and on their way down to this level." Laura announced to the others, who were relieved to hear the news.

A couple of minutes later Natalie and Suki entered the quarters and saw the four other 'characters' standing there. 'Kasumi' and 'Jack' were both sat down, hands placed strategically over their crotches... as if to hide something. Though Rob already knew about Mona's new 'member'. Jacob was stood with his hands on his hips, in a pose that was slightly more 'feminine' than usual. And Miranda had a 'I'm not impressed' look plastered on her face as she stood there with her arms folded underneath her large breasts.

"Um... hey?" Suki waved, nervously initiating the conversation.

"So, who is who?" Rob asked from Miranda's curvacious form.

Laura actually did the honors, to save everyone else the trouble and embarrassment of introducing themselves. "Natalie is now Yeoman Kelly Chambers and Suki is Engineer Gabriella Daniels."

"Um... thanks Laura." Natalie said, glancing over at the blue, pixelated ball at the terminal.

"You are welcome." Laura responded. And she then named the others, for the benefit of Suki and Natalie. "Rob is now Miranda Lawson, Jade is Jacob Taylor, Mona is Kasumi Goto and Charlotte is Jack." she said. "Also, Nicola is Doctor Chakwas, and Kiran is the tank-bred Krogan known as... Grunt." she added. Everyone noticed the 'efficiency' in Laura's synthetic female voice, but didn't say anything.

"Wow! Whatever dragged us here, it certainly wasn't bothered about gender or race was it?" Mona grumbled, still sore about her new anatomy.

"So are we the only ones...?" Natalie asked.

"So far..." Rob nodded. "Maybe there's someone else still on the Citadel, or... who knows. The galaxy is a big place." he said, rocking steadily in his high heels as he looked like at his mouth-watering female form.

"So what's the plan now?" Suki inquired, raising her arms.

Nobody quite knew...
135131112121232211112112333233232.title: "Kelly" and "Gabriella" come down.

choices: Kiran and Nicola rejoin the group.
Everyone needs to get back to business.
1351311121212322111121123332332322.content:
The question just seemed to hang in the air...

What was the plan?

Before, most of them had decided that they needed to find each other, gather everyone back together. For the most part, that plan had worked, although, it was Tali who did most of the searching for them...

But, right before they had woken up here, there were more people in that tea room. Steven, Luke, Liz, and "Waggy" for instance. Their work was not done and each one of them, even the ones who had played the games, had proven they couldn't even traverse the Citadel.

And, another question hung in the air. After everyone was reunited, what did they do next?

For now, even if they knew their way around the galaxy, they were stuck with Shepard...

"This is Commander Shepard speaking." A familiar voice blared from the intercom.

Everyone tensed up; a few even jumped in surprise. Even Laura felt something akin to an electric shock run down her system. While she was essentially omnipresent as long as everyone was on the ship, she was too focused on the reunion. She hadn't exactly been paying attention to that room...

"Lets keep this short. We're breaking away from Cerberus."

Natalie turned to Suki, a tinge of worry entering her voice. "Aren't we part of-"

"Its fine." Suki whispered back. "She's not going to kick us off the ship."

Mona's eyes widened a tinge. Now she knew without a doubt where in the Mass Effect series they were--right after 2. But, being one of the few who played Mass Effect 3 (the beginning of it at least), she knew that this did not happen exactly like this in the game...

"...Harbinger is coming and he won't be coming alone. He is a threat to everything--everyone. The Reapers must be stopped for the sake of every species in Citadel space. I promise you all, we will stop them."

Crap! Had Mona zoned out for what was probably an epic speech?

The intercom cut off, leaving an awkward silence in the room.

...

Natalie was the first to break the silence.

"So...we're supposed to save the galaxy from this Harbinger and his Reapers?" She asked in an oddly monotone voice. This was all so surreal to her. Just a few hours ago from her perspective, she was walking into Wilkos on a stormy day, ready to arrange boxes or something.

Now... this.

Suki looked back to Natalie. "There are some... things I should probably tell you about..."

And Suki began to regale Natalie about the Reapers and the various villains of the Mass Effect franchise. Eventually, Jade walked over to listen in and... while it was hard to tell Laura's expressions, since she was a ball of light, she also listened with a rapt attention.

Meanwhile, Rob found that he had a certain biological need. A cold pit of dread opened up in his stomach when he thought of it. He had been fearing it all this time, but he knew much better than to put off.

He let out a loud sigh and stomped off towards the women's restroom.

Charlotte and Mona knew what was happening, but neither of them laughed. They could completely and totally sympathize with Rob's situation and they both privately feared when they would have to take their turn in the restroom.

Neither of them did, however, seem to notice just how long their eyes lingered on Rob's rear...
1351311121212322111121123332332322.title: Shepard makes an announcement.

choices: Shepard has a one on one chat with 'Miranda'.
13513111212123221111211233323323221.content:
"I've got someone who wants to say hello." Doctor Chakwas'... or Nicola's voice sounded out, alerting the group as she walked through the door. Behind her was the 7' 5" Krogan whom Kiran now was. And thankfully, Kiran seemed to have calmed down a great deal. "It's amazing what a pep talk from our new commander can achieve in just a few minutes."

"Hi guys!" Kiran bellowed in her deep voice, waving at her friends. Natalie and Suki of course had seen Kiran in her current state before, but for the others, it came to quite a shock.

"Glad you're okay." Suki smiled, patting Kiran's armor-clad arm.

"Thanks!" Kiran nodded. "This is just... it took some time for me to wrap my head around this. Where we are, who we've become." Kiran then said, as Nicola sat down in a chair.

Looking at Kiran, both Charlotte and Mona suddenly realized that maybe - they weren't as hard done by as they first thought. Sure they both had a penis, but poor Kiran had it much worse. She was a 'tank', a huge alien lizard in effect. "So, everyone hear what Shepard said?" Nicola asked the others, slowly drawing each one of their attentions.

"Oh, sure did, yeah." Mona was quick to answer.

Nicola arched an eyebrow. "Then what did she say?" she asked Mona.

"Um..." Mona was stumped. Why did she always have to zone out during important stuff anyway?

Suki saved Mona anymore embarrassment. "We all heard, we're splitting from Cerberus. I guess the Illusive Man will be sending his goons after us now." she sighed, as the others just listened.

"I'll probably be his main focus." Rob suddenly chimed in as he returned from the women's restroom. "Miranda was his number one operative, and now she's betrayed him. Yeah... I'm going to get massacred." he grumbled in a defeatist tone. But even that sounded sexy to both Charlotte and Mona, who couldn't get enough of his sexy, Australian accent.

"I'm sure this Illusive Man - whoever he is, will come after us all. But with Shepard leading us, we can do this. She seems very capable." Nicola said.

"Best soldier in the galaxy." Suki smiled, feeling some comfort.

Laura's new voice suddenly sounded out again. "Shepard is on her way down to see you all."

"Here we go." Rob groaned, as he adjusted his breasts a little. He didn't know just what effect he had on Charlotte and Mona every time he touched or adjusted himself now.
13513111212123221111211233323323221.title: Kiran and Nicola rejoin the group.

choices: They arrive on Mars... something is wrong.
They arrive on Mars... it looks relatively normal.
135131112121232211112112333233232211.content:
Rob barely had enough time to adjust his uniform before the door into the crew quarters opened. In stepped the commander herself, followed by Tali, Zaeed, and Garrus. Shepard still wore her Alliance uniform, but Garrus, Zaeed and Tali still seemed to be decked out in full combat armor.

A certain tenseness came over the room. The Shepard that Rob, Kiran, Mona, Charlotte, Nicola and Jade had met before seemed to be a more lighthearted person who was not afraid to joke around.

However, that was not the case this time. She looked a little haggard, but determined. Right now, she was the commander, and she meant business.

"Right now, we're setting a course for an Alliance outpost on Mars." she said. "Something big was discovered there, something that might help us win the upcoming war..."

Almost everyone winced slightly at the last part. To hear about it was one thing, but to think they might actually need to get involved...

"We've received no reading for Mars. Expect things to get violent. I expect you all to be geared up and ready by then."

And with that, Shepard turned back towards the elevator.

"Miranda, if you would come with me?"

The last thing that Rob wanted to hear...

He suppressed a sigh before following Shepard out the door and into towards the elevator. Zaeed muttered something under his breath before he walked back to his quarters, Garrus followed him in the same, vague direction. Tali went back towards the elevator as well, not really in the mood to socialize after having to hunt down three groups of people who had gotten lost. However, she threw a quick glance at Suki and Natalie...

Suki seemed to get the message as she half dragged Natalie to the elevator. As far as their on-ship duties went, they would have to improvise. Still... that was infinitely better than what the others needed to do--catch lasers.

...

"Well, we're fucked." said Charlotte, as loud as she could without Garrus and Zaeed hearing.

"D-don't worry." Kiran muttered, her deep voice sounding more than a little fearful. "I'm sure we can pull... through."

"Really?" Jade stepped up to Kiran. "Shepard probably thinks all of us knows how to shoot like the pack of killers... and use 'biotics.' I don't even know what the second one is."

It was clear that panic was quickly spreading across what would soon be the "ground team."

This mission was about to become much more complicated than Shepard ever thought it was...
135131112121232211112112333233232211.title: Shepard already has her orders.

1351311121212322111121123332332322113.content:
Rob felt a certain level of 'boyhood excitement' as he followed Shepard into her cabin. Quite funny considering he was now in a sexy woman's body. He looked first at the collection of model ships in the glass cabinets, then at the fish tank, and he smiled at the sight of the ruined helmet that Shepard had worn when she was killed by the Collectors aboard the Normandy SR-1.

"Please, take a seat Miranda." Shepard mumbled politely.

"Er, thanks." Rob smiled back.

Shepard then poured them a drink and sat down on the couch next to him. "Is... everything all right Miranda? You seem more than a little tense. And you don't exactly seem the type to get lost on the Citadel." Shepard asked.

Rob had an opportunity now to tell Shepard everything, but would she believe him? He decided against it, if only for the sole reason that Shepard had enough to deal with without learning that half her crew are imposters with no combat experience whatsoever. "No, no I'm fine Shepard." he said, raising his glass and taking a sip of the drink he'd been handed, Asari honey mead.

One swig was enough to make Rob cough violently. "Wow... that's got a kick." Rob winced, his eyes watering. With each cough his large breasts jiggled on his chest, even though they were being 'contained' by his skin-tight uniform.

Shepard smiled broadly. "Yeah, the Asari definitely know how to mix their drinks. Liara tought me that concoction back on Illium." she said.

"Great." Rob forced a smile as he wiped a tear away.

Shepard then got back to trying to find out why Miranda was acting 'funny'. "You heard anything from Oriana lately?" she asked, referring to Miranda's sister.

Rob knew this, so it wasn't hard for him to make something up. "Not for a couple of weeks Shepard, but she's safe. Somewhere my father will never find her." he told the commander, as he set the rest of his beverage on the table. "Look... you don't have to worry about me. We all have our off days. I'll be there for you when you need me Shepard." he continued.

Shepard was very appreciative. "Thanks Miranda, that means a lot to me."

Rob threw her a genuine smile. Then he put his hands on his knees, glanced down at his shapely form, and stood up, steadying himself in his heels. "Now I'm going to make sure the rest of the crew is ready for what's coming." he said.

Shepard stood up too, finishing her drink as she did so. "Okay, sounds good. Joker will alert us when we're approaching Mars." she said, then she escorted him out of her cabin. As he descended in the elevator Rob patted himself on the back. He'd handled that well, he thought. Now he just hoped he could be just as positive in his actions as he was with his words. For he knew he and the others would soon be tested in combat.
1351311121212322111121123332332322113.title: During the trip...

choices: The ground team's mass anxiety attack.
13513111212123221111211233323323221132.content:
...M-92 Mantis... M-15 Vindicator... med-gel...grenades...

For what seemed to be the hundredth time, Garrus ran through the mental checklist of everything he might need on the mission. Once again, all clean. Nothing on the ship really needed calibrating either. That was basically all he had to do on a good day, so he was left to wander about.

To a certain extent, he hated these times on the ship. He much preferred to be out doing... something. Shooting Husks, shooting Collectors, shooting criminals; they all sort of blurred into the same thing at the end of the day. It probably explained why he kept calibrating and re-calibrating the equipment. When he didn't have anything to do, unwelcome thoughts tended to pay him a visit.

For instance, the strange antics of the crew...

Not that there was many hints except, well, them getting lost on the Citadel, Grunt being calmed down in a way that did not involve offers of unadulterated violence, and not hearing Jack swear once.

Basically, a lot of hints.

And... he could've sworn that he could hear fearful whispers coming from the crew quarters once they heard they might be going on what by this point could probably be considered a milk run.

As far as Garrus was concerned, no Collectors or Reapers was a milk run.

Or the Thorian... That thing was creepy.

It was around then that Garrus noticed that he had somehow wandered into Engineering.

Well, now that he was down here, he might as well voice his thoughts. It had been a little while since he and the Quarian, Tali, had talked.

What could possibly go wrong?

With that last sarcastic thought echoing through his head, he proceeded forward.
13513111212123221111211233323323221132.title: Garrus is wandering the ship.

135131112121232211112112333233232211323.content:
After exiting the mass relay in the SOL system, Joker set a course for Mars. But when he got there, he (and Laura) detected something wasn't quite right. The Alliance defense systems in orbit had been destroyed, as evidenced by the debris. And then there was the ship in orbit... "Er... Commander, you might want to get up here." Joker called over the intercom.

When Shepard walked into the cockpit, Joker swung his chair part way around and gestured to the planet. "There's a Cerberus cruiser in orbit over Mars, Commander. Looks like the Illusive Man is up to something. Not that - you know - that's anything new."

"Alliance ships?" Shepard asked, narrowing her eyes.

Joker spun back around and hit a few buttons, running a scan. "None detected. And the defense platforms have been taken out." he answered.

Laura (EDI) then suddenly spoke up, deciding to help out as best she could. "The enemy ship's weapons are powered up Shepard, and I'm picking up several distress signals coming from the planet surface."

"We're going in, there's still personnel alive down there." Shepard said. "Joker, take us in as close as you can, and if that Cerberus cruiser so much as blinks at us..."

"Got it Commander!" Joker nodded firmly. "Thanix cannon is powering up."

Shepard made her way to the ship's armory to put on her N7 armor, then she selected her weapon of choice, the M-96 Mattock, known for it's penetrating power. When she was prepared, she got on the intercom and called the others (including most of our intrepid antagonists) to the debriefing room. She already had an idea on how to proceed, three teams, led by herself, Miranda and Garrus. Their mission, to retrieve Prothean technology that had been kept secret by Alliance scientists for years.

Shepard was determined not to let the Illusive Man get that technology...
135131112121232211112112333233232211323.title: The Normandy approaches Mars.

1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.content:
Rob's hands tightly gripped his submachine gun, his knuckles almost white. He didn't know the name or make of the gun, all he cared about was that in a few short minutes he was going to be firing it.

He had barely heard most of Shepard's briefing. Something about how they were going to split into three groups. One lead by HIM of all people. Shepard and her group were going to land, Shepard's group would make a dash for the main cargo elevator, while Rob's group went for one of the side entrances. Garrus' group, meanwhile, would wait a bit before offloading far off on the other side of the outpost, where they would...

Rob hadn't exactly heard that part.

He did, however, hear the breakup of the groups. Garrus got Zaeed and Tali, Shepard got "Kasumi" and "Jacob," and Rob got "Jack" and "Grunt."

He was quite sure his group wasn't chosen for its chemistry...

With a loud "swoosh" of air, the hanger door opened, letting them get a view of the red and orange surface of Mars. Back when he was on earth, walking its surface would've been a dream come true. Not just for him, but also for much of humanity. Given the circumstances, however...

"This is going to suck." Rob muttered.

*****


"This sucks." muttered Luke in a voice that sounded like, disturbingly enough, his own mother.

Not that he could really hear it over the gunshots, explosions, and the veritable stampede just outside the door.

"Don't just stand there! Do something!" His supervisor shouted at him, as "she" struggled under the weight of a large, metal table. Back when they had been workers at Wilkos, Liz never raised her voice. It was also a stern reproach, never a barked order. Her shouting like a drill sergeant showed just how dire their situation was and just how out of their elements they were.

They were all locked in what looked, humorously enough, like a classroom. It had a rows upon rows of desks and a television-like screen at the front. Just through the double doors out of the room were hundreds of storm trooper knock-offs, probably banging on the doors, if the sound outside were of any indication.

A desk flew right past Luke's head, causing him to jump in surprise. It fell onto the large pile by the door that was their makeshift barricade.

"Luke, help Liz!" Steven yelled as he lifted another desk with... some power that Luke was going to dub "the force" until further notice. "I've got these!"

However, all of them stopped when they heard a rhythmic beeping sound on the other side of the door. A beeping sound that grew faster with time.

"Fuck." They all muttered in unison.

That was the first time Luke had ever heard Liz swear.
1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.title: Mass anxiety among the crew.

1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.content:
"Miranda, stay in contact at all times." Shepard's voice crackled over the radio, loud and clear to Rob and the others in his team as well as everyone else. "Take no chances and pull back if you're outnumbered. No heroics. I'm not losing anyone uneccessarily." she said.

"Affirmative Shepard." Rob replied back, before turning to share a nervous glance with Charlotte and Kiran.

"So what's the plan?" Kiran grunted (no pun intended).

Rob didn't have one. He might have had more knowledge than his two 'squadmates', but he was basically winging this like they were. "Um... try not to get killed, and let's just... move forward cautiously."

"Great plan." Charlotte mumbled sarcastically, in a way that actually reminded Rob of the real Jack's rivalry with the real Miranda.

"If you have a better one, I'm all ears." Rob said, his voice muffled somewhat by his breathing aparatus.

"We're actually on another planet. This is... amazing." Kiran said in awe, looking skywards to the bleak Martian atmosphere. On the horizon - heading their way - was a colossal duststorm that looked like a wall hundreds of meters high.

"Eyes front Kiran, this is serious." Rob told her, as politely as he could.

And so they started moving forward to the nearest building...

********

Meanwhile, Shepard had Jade and Mona backing her up, and they were both equally nervous - with the added pressure of having to 'perform' in front of their new commander. They came across a small structure after walking a short distance, guarded by two Cerberus troopers. Shepard dropped to one knee and raised a clenched fist in the air. Mona and Jade, not knowing what that hand signal meant, kept moving forward. Shepard jerked her head around and snapped at them. "Hey... stop moving!" she said.

"Er... sorry." Jade apologized quietly, peeking through her helmet visor.

"There's only two of them, we need to take them quietly." Shepard said to her two squadmates.

"Any ideas?" Mona asked.

Shepard turned to Jade in response. "Can you take them out with your biotics Jacob?" She phrased it as a question, but it was actually a command. And Jade felt her heart plummet into her stomach. Rob and Suki had managed to teach Jade a little about her new biotic ability before they left the Normandy, but she hadn't had a real chance to try them out much yet. And now here she was... having her first real test.

"Today would be nice, Jacob." Shepard said a minute or so later. She was getting impatient.

"Right." Jade let out a deep sigh, and tried to concentrate....
1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.title: Shepard's and "Miranda's" parti...

choices: Shepard's squad manages to figure out its biotics.
1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.content:
One-by-one, each of them leapt down the sharp incline. First Rob and Charlotte, who landed on their feet. Then Kiran, who-

BOOM!

Rob swore the ground shook. Heck, he saw a small crater where Kiran landed.

"S-sorry." Kiran sheepishly rubbed the back of her head.

God it was so weird hearing Grunt use that tone of voice.

"It's fine." Rob sighed as he threw nervous glances around, his eyes lingering on the large pit in the middle of the base. "Just hope nobody heard that..."

Cautiously, and with guns in hand, they proceeded. Had they been a little more observant, they would have probably noticed the corpses of the Alliance soldiers, strewn out in a pile just behind them...

They travelled down the path at a snail's pace, constantly ducking behind cover and throwing glances down the road. But, eventually, they found themselves at the base of the largest building of the lot...

Or rather, they hid behind a couple of conveniently placed rocks down the path from the building. Except for Charlotte, who strolled out in the open.

"That's it then?" Charlotte asked. Even though an overwhelming anxiety burned in her chest, she couldn't help but admire the base. Being something of a closet Sci-fi fan, just seeing a base like that in real life was a little exciting.

"How do we get in..."

"GET DOWN!" Charlotte let out an uncharacteristically (especially for Jack) loud "Eep!" of surprise as Rob tackled her to the ground.

A large, six-wheeled truck-like transport sailed right over them, landing on the road and careening up to the base. It was soon followed by two more, which pulled up by the side of the first one.

A humorous part of Kiran's mind couldn't help but note that, for a paramilitary force, Cerberus sure sucked at driving...

Rob quickly dragged Charlotte back behind the boulders, just before the backdoors of the transports opened up.

Lots of Cerberus soldiers leapt out, garbed in their white, black and yellow armor. Most carried rifles, but there were some oddities, such as the ones that had large shields strapped to their arms.

None of them knew enough about Cerberus to tell the differences between soldier ranks and functions.

What they were looking at were at least three squads of soldiers, judging from the number of transports that had pulled up. Beyond that, as the soldiers were scattering, trying to get into formation, their exact numbers were hard to estimate.

Could've been twenty... or thirty...

"Um..." Charlotte looked down as she spoke to Rob. "Thanks for that."

"Don't mention it." Rob muttered back as he saw the squads coalesce. Two seemed ready to march down the path, while the last... were just standing there.

"What now?" Charlotte asked, turning to the other two.

Beneath his helmet, Rob bit his lips. This was what he had been fearing this whole time. The road beyond their cover was far too exposed to let them sneak passed.

So, they either needed to force their way through... or retreat to find another path.
1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.title: Back with 'Miranda's' squad.

1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.content:
"Get down!!" Steven screamed, a split second before an explosion tore open the door and scattered the pile of desks and chairs he had placed as a barricade. Cerberus troops then poured through the door, but several were cut down by blind fire from Liz's and Luke's assault weapons. "We need to get out of here." Steven then shouted over the din, as he temporarily broke cover and hurled a singularity at the enemy - lifting a number of them into the air and sapping their health.

"You're pretty good with that power, whatever it is." Liz called over to Steven, even as she kept firing.

"It's easier than I thought it would be." Steven responded, still trying to adjust to being in an Asari's body. Waking up in the Mass Effect universe was a big enough shock in itself, but to find himself in Liara T'Soni's body... was a bigger shock. Luckily, Liara's biotic abilities seemed to come natural to him.

He wasn't the only one in shock of course, Luke was in Ashley Williams' body, stuck as a woman, and Liz was now James Vega, an Alliance marine. The whole gender-bending thing was having an effect on them all. And now here they were, fighting for their lives, and only Steven had any idea who they were fighting.

Luke ejected the heat sink from his weapon and loaded a new one, then he pulled the pin on a shredder grenade and waited two seconds before throwing it. The thing rolled underneath the legs of the Cerberus troopers... and boom. The blast sent armor-piercing shrapnel through the suits of the enemy, cutting them down, while Steven and Liz both ducked behind cover again.

"Nice work!" Steven complimented Luke with a nod, seeing the way was clear for the to make a break for it.

"Thanks." Luke replied, his voice also muffled by the helmet he had on, just like Liz. Steven, with a more simple breathing mask on, had a much clearer view of things.

The three of them rushed to the blown open door and stepped over the blood-soaked Cerberus bodies. When one grabbed Luke's ankle, he instinctively aimed his weapon down and fired a round point blank into the trooper, finishing him off. "Holy shit!" Luke gasped, his heart rate jumping.

"Come on, don't stop!" Steven said to his two co-workers, leading them down several hallways. They stopped abruptly when five more Cerberus soldiers appeared at the end of another hallway. They all aimed their weapons and commenced firing. Steven focused his energy and put up a biotic barrier that shielded Liz, Luke and himself, absorbing the incoming rounds. He then 'screamed' angrily and sent a biotic blast down the hallway - sending the troops flying.

"This way's clear." Liz called out in her deep voice, opening a nearby door.

"You okay?" Luke asked Steven, who seemed to be getting increasingly 'irritated'.

Steven ran a hand over his hair tentacles, then glanced at Luke. "Once we get out of here, I'll be fine." he grumbled.

The three pressed on....
1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.title: Meanwhile, inside the base.

choices: Shepard's squad delves deeper into the building.
Steven, Luke and Liz encounter more resistance.
1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.content:
Mona panted heavily as she leaned against the wall on the elevator. Shepard pressed the buttons on the control panel, which eventually caused the elevator to slowly ascend with a loud grinding noise.

Shepard took off her helmet, so everyone else did the same.

"That... wasn't bad, Jade." she muttered, quiet enough so that Shepard wouldn't hear. back outside, Jade had eventually managed to activate her biotics, levitating the two surprised operatives into the air, letting Shepard make short work of them.

"You weren't bad, either." Jade whispered back.

"Thanks."

Mona was thankful that Shepard had chosen what seemed to be the "easy route" in. Even after those two outside, the only ones they had run into was a squad just outside the front door. They were quickly taken out under Shepard's expert leadership.

...It disturbed Mona a little how easily combat, shooting and killing, came to her...

What disturbed her even more was the throbbing erection she had through all of this. Was she, honest to god, getting off on this?

...Kasumi had issues. She thought this kind of thing to be more along Jack's avenue...

The hatch opened up above them with a loud screech. The elevator sped up, coming up to a large, garage-like area, before grinding to a halt, causing everyone but Shepard to stumble around a little.

Shepard squinted her eyes before ducking behind one of the cars. Mona and Jade quickly ducked behind Shepard.

There was combat in one of the upper levels. Apparently, not all resistance in the base had fallen yet.

*****


"Look." Kiran whispered to Rob.

The squad that was guarding the front of the building suddenly abandoned its post, trudging in the direction the other two had went.

Rob let out a sigh of relief. At the very least, for the next few minutes, they could postpone combat and other nastiness...

Much to Charlotte and Kiran's surprise, and horror, they felt a bit of disappointment when the squad walked away. They kind of wanted to des... fight them.
1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.title: Shepard's squad makes progress.

1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.content:
Rob's squad was able to make progress, more out of luck than combat expertise like Shepard's team. "All right, lets go, move it!" Rob barked an order in his feminine tone to Charlotte and Kiran.

"Got it!" Kiran nodded, running towards the entrance the Cerberus squad had left unguarded. Rob and Charlotte actually felt the 'earth' shake under their feet as they ran alongside Kiran's hefty form. Once inside the building, Rob closed the door and then smashed the control panel with his sub-machinegun. That would hopefully prevent any Cerberus reinforcements from getting in behind them.

"You think the others are all right?" Charlotte gasped, getting her breath back from the little sprint she had just made.

"They'd better be." Rob sighed, looking down at himself as he adjusted his breasts again.

"You gonna keep doing that?" Charlotte rolled her eyes.

"Well I'm sorry, I'm just not used to having these things sat on my chest." Rob snapped back.

Charlotte thought Rob had got off easy being stuck in a sexy woman's body, while she got stuck as some tattoed tranny called 'Jack'. She just glared at him, then looked up into Kiran's 'alien' face.

"Will you two stop bickering already, sheesh." Kiran groaned, thumping the wall and actually putting a dent in it. This actually made Kiran's two co-workers stop arguing and concentrate on the task at hand. "Shepard and our friends are in this place somewhere being shot at, we need to help them." Kiran then said.

Kiran walked towards another nearby door, just as a lone Cerberus trooper burst through. Crap. Kiran thought, as the soldier raised his weapon to fire. As if on instinct, Kiran charged at him and sent him flying with her sheer mass, knocking the guy unconscious. Kiran then looked back towards Rob and Charlotte, and shrugged her broad shoulders.

"I think she should take point." Charlotte muttered, eliciting a silent nod from Rob.

And so they started making their way towards the sound of the gunfire.
1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.title: Rob's squad actually makes progress.

1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.content:
Everyone spared a glance at the crumpled over form of the Cerberus soldier as they filed into what appeared to be a hallway. Seeing Kiran make short work of him certainly boosted morale by a large margin.

Didn't keep them from nervously glancing around and pointing their guns at anything that moved, however...

Kiran squinted slightly as she peered at the various doors. "I think they're... this way."

She wasted not time in pushing open a door that seemed to be barely hinged to the doorway. While she had tried to be gentle, she had completely underestimated her strength, causing the door to fly open and slam against the wall.

Rob let out a squawk of protest, "Kiran! Careful, we- I... Oh..."

Well, that certainly explained why the gunfire and explosions seemed to be moving away from them.

In the middle of the large room full of stands that had glowing computer-like screens on them was the scene of a massacre.

Cerberus operatives, scientists, and other soldiers all lay on the ground. All dead and strewn all over the place like scattered leaves.

"Oh... I... wow..." Charlotte muttered, averting her eyes.

They all exchanged a glance, an involuntary shiver ran down their collective spines. Back in their peaceful life in Rotherham, England, none of them had ever seen a corpse before, let alone, this...

It was a lot for them to take in.

"T-there's a door over there." Kiran muttered, sparing a quick glance at a Cerberus operative who somehow got himself cratered high up into a wall.

They all walked toward it, trying to ignore the destruction around them-

But then, Rob felt something wrap around his ankle.

He let out an impressive squeal of fright and spun around, pointing his gun at... a Cerberus soldier who lay on the ground. The soldier made a gurgling noise that sounded vaguely like "I surrender" before he crumpled to the floor, unconscious.

The three of them just stood there and stared, weapons trained on the unconscious man.

Unbeknownst to them, a certain blue-skinned woman and a pair of humans stood on the glassed-in catwalk just above, sitting and kneeling after getting through a particularly arduous firefight.
1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.title: Further progress.

1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.content:
"Holy shit! This is... a bloody mess." Charlotte grimaced as she walked around. She actually felt weak to her stomach, a far cry from how the original Jack would have behaved at seeing blood-soaked corpses littered around a room.

"Figuratively and literally." Rob nodded in agreement.

Kiran for her part, kicked the body of a Cerberus trooper on his back and tore his helmet off, revealing the 'improvements' the Illusive Man had been making to his army of brainwashed soldiers. They bore a resemblence to Reaper Husks, especially their eyes. This was proof definite of a link between Cerberus and the Reapers, regardless of the Illusive Man's claims to the contrary.

A noise on the catwalk above suddenly caused the three of them to aim their weapons in that direction. It took all the restraint a nervous Charlotte could muster not to squeeze the trigger on her Predator pistol.

Standing on the catwalk were two humans, Lieutenant Ashley Williams and Lieutenant James Vega, and to Rob at least... a very familiar looking Asari. And the two Alliance soldiers had their weapons trained on Rob, Kiran and Charlotte..

"HOLD YOUR FIRE!" The Asari woman shouted to her two companions, "They're friendly."

"You sure?" The male human responded, his finger itching to pull the trigger again.

"Trust me, they're friendly." The Asari nodded.

All weapons were lowered, and the two humans on the catwalk began to make their way down to greet the new arrivals via a nearby staircase. The Asari meanwhile leapt over the side of the catwalk and dropped straight down, using her biotics to slow her fall. It was quite the sight to everyone.

"About time some assistance turned up." The Asari said, as she sashayed towards 'Miranda'.

"D... Doctor T'Soni?" Rob stuttered in surprise, keeping it formal.

For a few brief moments, the two groups of three just looked each other up and down, unsure what else to say...
1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.title: The groups spot each other.

choices: Shepard's group gets to the tram.
1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.content:
For a couple of moments, an awkward silence hung over the room while the two groups stared at each other. As this went on, Charlotte's anxiety from seeing the corpses exponentially grew. She absolutely had to do something, anything to break the silence...

"Um... hi?" Charlotte sheepishly waved.

Her hand flew to her mouth. Crap! That sounded so much better in her head!

All eyes turned to look at her, causing her to shrink back slightly, Liara giving a look of mild surprise and Rob giving the standard "are you kidding me?" look.

Another moment of awkward silence, this time, with Charlotte at the center of it, then-

"Does the word, "Rotherham" or "Wilkos" mean anything to you?" asked the Asari.

Rob leapt backwards in surprise.

"Y-you! Don't tell me! You, too...!"

"Liara" smiled. "I believe we have some catching up to do."

For the next couple of minutes, they reintroduced themselves and explained their situations.
