Liz, Luke and Steven had apparently just woken up on the base, almost as soon as they had found each other, they were attacked by Cerberus and, from that point forward, had been essentially fighting for their lives.

I end up in an alternate universe, and somehow, Liz follows me here? Charlotte thought, rolling her eyes. Despite the sarcasm, however, for the first time in Charlotte's entire life, she was happy that Liz was nearby. Liz was reliable.

However, she frowned slightly as she looked at Luke, her eyes lingering on Luke's new pair of breasts for much longer than they should have.

Great, as if just having to deal with "Miranda" wasn't bad enough.

Rob recounted how they were here under Shepard's orders to secure some sort of Prothean (or was it Reaper?) data.

"Wait, Shepard! He... She's here!?" Steven broke into a wide grin. Both Rob and Charlotte couldn't help but chuckle at the display. Certainly, Rob could sympathize as, just earlier, he was almost just as excited.

"Right." Kiran said in her deep voice. "She's somewhere in the facility, we need to go help her."

"Right then, which way?"

As those two wandered off to go examine one of the doors, Liz walked up to Charlotte and Rob and gave them a smile.

"At any rate, its good to have you back."

"Oh, um... thanks." Charlotte said with a very slight blush. Huzzah, this confirmed it. She was know bisexual.

Rob, on the other hand, frowned slightly at the body of Ashley. Was it a coincidence? Every single one of the male employees he had met so far had gotten a female body... and none of the male (or "male" in the case of Kazumi) members of Shepard's crew had gotten male passengers...

Was he reading too deeply into it?
1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.title: Nervous confirmation...

1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.content:
"You were pretty handy with those biotics Steven. How are you feeling?" Rob asked as the two walked together, out in front of the rest of the group. They had their weapons at the ready incase they ran up against more Cerberus troopers.

"Strange. Pretty much like you're feeling I'm guessing." Steven replied in Liara's melodic voice. His eyes gestured to Rob's ample breasts.

Rob looked down. "Yeah, pretty much." he mumbled. "But you... well - you're an alien too. What's it like having 'hair' like that?" he then asked Steven, while admiring the deep blue texture of Steven's skin.

"Could have been a lot worse." Steven said, thinking of a Salarian and shuddering.

"Kiran seems to be handling being a Krogan well enough though." Rob mentioned, his new Australian accent coming through again.

As the two then peeked around a corner to make sure the next hallway was clear, Steven glanced over to Rob again. "So Shepard is really here?" He could hardly contain his excitement at the thought. "What's she like?" "She as formidable as you thought she'd be? Like she was in the game?" Steven bombarded Rob with questions, making him chuckle a little.

"You'll see for yourself soon enough I hope." Rob replied.

Steven took in a deep breath, he actually had butterflys in his stomach. All he and the others had just been through, and he was getting nervous at meeting Commander Shepard in the flesh.

"Lets keep moving." Rob gestured down the hallway, as Kiran and Liz watched their six.

"So... you're a woman too. I'd say whatever put us here has a bizarre sense of humor." Charlotte grumbled quietly to Luke as they walked side by side. Charlotte couldn't take her eyes off Luke's new shapely body no more than she could stop staring at Rob's tits and Steven's sexy blue ass. This was torture for her. Especially for one 'constricted' part of her...

"I didn't ask to be put in this body." Luke complained back in Ashley's voice.

"I'd rather have that one than this one." Charlotte sighed in despair.

"Yeah well, we are who we are, and we have to deal with it. Now I suggest you keep an eye out for more asshole stormtroopers." Luke was short with her.

Charlotte rolled her eyes. Luke's lack of Sci Fi knowledge was evident, but she couldn't be bothered to correct him."Where are we going anyway?" Charlotte suddenly rushed forward a couple of steps and asked Rob and Steven.

"To the tram station, wherever it is," Steven answered, "Shepard will probably be heading there to get to the Prothean archives."

"We'll probably meet heavy resistance the closer we get." Rob added.

Charlotte hated this. "Awesome!" she mumbled acerbically as the group edged forward through the hallways.
1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.title: The combined group proceeds onward.

1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.content:
The video cut off when the black haired woman fired her pistol at the camera.

"...I guess we know how Cerberus got in." Shepard said.

Mona nodded slowly. It certainly explained why they had been running into so little resistance from Cerberus. It also explained that one room that had the air vented from it...

"So, what now?" said Jade from her post by the door of the security station. Shepard did say that they needed to get to the archives and secure the data there and to do that, they needed to take the tram...

"Give me a second." Shepard said as she rapidly punched a couple buttons. After a couple seconds, a melodic note played from the console.

Shepard got up, unholstering her assault weapon. "Tram is coming, get into position."

They all left the security station, walked down the stairs, and walked right into the plaza-like area that had a bunch of large boxes piled up at random intervals. Mona and Jade found their eyes glued to the large screen at the top that depicted the trams. The one labeled as "A" slowly moved down the faded line, drawing closer and closer to-

"Don't let your guard down." Shepard said, lightly tapping Jade on the back. "Keep an eye out for..."

*Boom!*

At that moment, the door at the opposite side of the plaza (that they somehow missed) burst open, a veritable flood of black and white-armored soldiers flooded in.

"Shit." Mona screamed as she squeezed down on the trigger of her submachine gun. The resulting spray of blasts ricocheted off of the door frame and the stairs leading up to them.

"Secure the tram!" said one of the Cerberus soldiers as he let off an answering volley, all of it falling just short of Mona as she ducked behind a box.

The tram station was soon filled with the sounds of explosions and gunshots.
1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.title: Shepard's squad presses on.

1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.content:
Just when Shepard, Jade and Mona were pinned down and outnumbered, two incendiary grenades landed behind the main body of Cerberus troops, cutting down some and setting fire to several others. A directed volley of armor piercing bullets and laser rounds then rained down on the enemy from above. Mona took advantage of this, and took a deep breath before activating her personal cloaking device.

Now invisible, she flit unseen behind three other Cerberus soldiers who had taken cover. She ducked behind a pillar, then pulled the pin on a flashbang grenade, before throwing it at the enemy. Once the stunning blast had occurred, she stepped from cover and quickly shot all three men dead. Holy crap, I can't believe I just did that.

A lift grenade thrown down from the balcony above then finished off the Cerberus team. Shepard and her squad broke cover, Mona becoming visible again, and they looked up at their 'saviors'. "Thought you could use some back up Shepard." Garrus said in his usual nonchalant tone.

"How many times are we going to have to save you Shepard?" Tali then joked.

Shepard smirked. "Nearly as many as I've saved you I guess." she retorted to the Quarian.

Zaeed jumped down from the balcony, doing a combat roll upon landing. "How many of these goddamn assholes are there?" he grumbled, looking around at the scene of utter carnage.

"Probably a lot more. And we haven't got time to waste. We need to get to those archives." Shepard responded, as the tram slowly arrived. "You heard anything from Miranda and the others? she asked Garrus, who shook his head.

"No, I haven't. But I'm sure they're fine." he replied, staying positive.

Two Cerberus stragglers suddenly stumbled off the tram, but were quickly blown away by a biotic blast from Jade, who was slowly mastering her new powers.

"Nicely done Jacob." Shepard complimented Jade.

"Yeah not bad. You keep down this road, you'll almost be as good as me some day." he quipped, posing with his M-13 Raptor sniper rifle.

Jade just smiled in a sarcastic manner, then rolled her eyes at Mona, who just shrugged. The two of them followed Shepard and the others onto the tram and began their trip to the archives where the Prothean database was stored.
1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.title: Garrus' team makes an entrance.

1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.content:
"I may not be an expert on Mars' climate." Rob said as he scanned the horizon. "But I think the storm will be coming soon."

That large wall of dust that Rob, Kiran and Charlotte had spotted on their way in had advanced significantly. It now menacingly towered over the furthest wall on the base

"No shit." Charlotte grumbled. After being around three really hot ladies (and one handsome man), she was feeling really, really pent up, and that completely soured her mood. However, her discomfort was mitigated somewhat now that they had their environmental suits back on.

The group had tried to follow the signs in order to get to the tram and, hopefully, meet up with Shepard. However, one of the hallways was blocked off by a large pile of rubble. No one had any idea of how it could've gotten there, but explosives were the likely culprit.

So, they had to take the alternate route: smash a window and walk along the roof. They all stood on the top of one of the taller buildings, gazing down at the rest of the facility.

"That's the archives, right?" Liz said as she pointed at a large rectangular building with a glass tube running through it.

"Yeah, it should be..." Steven blanched a bit as he followed Liz's arm. He had no idea they were that close...

"Wow, we don't even need to go to the tram." He pointed at a window of one of the buildings that jutted right out of their building and the archive building. "All we need to do is jump down the side, and enter through that window over there..."

Steven trailed off when he heard the sound of glass shattering below them. A figure leapt up from right below them, and landed in the middle of their group.

For a couple moments, the group and the dark haired woman stared at each other in a shocked silence. The dark-haired woman probably didn't expect to meet this many people up on the roof. As for everyone else, well...

This woman wasn't wearing any kind of protective suit...

The dark haired woman recovered first. She threw a haymaker right into Liz's stomach, followed by a powerful uppercut to her face.

"Guh..." Liz crumpled over and began to slide off the edge.

"Liz!" Steven screamed, calling upon a forcefield of biotics, causing Liz to slowly float upwards.

As if on instinct, Kiran charged the dark haired woman, head lowered slightly. However, the dark haired woman, just ducked under the blow before fleeing down the side of the building.

"Damn! She's fast!" Rob yelled.

"After her!" Charlotte sprang after the dark-haired woman, followed closely by Luke and Rob. Steven and Kiran, however, stayed behind to pull Liz over the edge...
1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.title: Back with 'Miranda' and company.

1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.content:
While the chase was on outside, Shepard and the others were traveling to the actual archives aboard the tram. Mona and Jade had to chat amongst themselves quietly, since the other four people on the tram, were all themselves, including Commander Shepard. They didn't have a lot to talk about anyway, except the constantm life-threatening combat and bloody corpses left strewn in their wake.

"You know you painted a big bloody bullseye on the Normandy's hull when you split with Cerberus right Shepard?" Zaeed said as he checked and cocked his weapon alongside Garrus.

"It had to be done. The Illusive Man has gone too far, he's endangering us all. What he's doing to his soldiers is no different than what the Reapers do to their victims. We need to shut him down now." Shepard responded.

"You regret joining up with him Shepard?" Tali inquired inquisitively.

She recieved a firm shake of the head in reply. "No Tali, I don't. It was a necessary partnership to take down the Collector base. The Illusive Man just never expected me to blow the place to hell instead of handing to him." the commander said in a determined tone.

"Guess you proved him wrong." Zaeed grunted.

The tram then approched the station opposite, and Shepard told everyone to get ready. "Okay, weapons hot people, I see more Cerberus troopers."

"Time to rake up the body count huh Shepard?" Garrus chuckled.

As soon as the tram docked and the decompression had finished, the shield came down and the six-man squad let loose a barrage of fire that dropped several of the enemy instantly. But return fire soon necessitated a duck for cover. "Kasumi, see if you can flank them, Garrus, Zaeed - lay down cover fire, and Jacob - on my six, protect me and Tali with a barrier." Shepard ordered.

"Roger that Shepard!" Garrus nodded, as he commenced putting high velocity, armor-piercing rounds through the Cerberus 'fodder'.

"Let's do this." Tali said in an enthusiatic tone.

"Too goddamn right." Zaeed yelled, throwing a grenade and firing his assault weapon.

"Er... yeah, o-okay." Jade muttered nervously, trying to control her breathing. Mona gave her a pat on the back and smiled, then activated her cloak again and went to flank the enemy once more.

Can this get anymore intense? Jade asked herself as she managed to put up a sufficient biotic barrier that protected her, Shepard and Tali from enemy gunfire.
1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.title: Back in the tram...

choices: Time to investigate the mysterious woman...
Down in the archives, an intense battle rages on.
1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.content:
"Where the hell is she!?" Luke shouted, trying to be heard over the howling winds. The storm had been growing more and more intense since they had walked out. The ominous clouds were almost on top of them.

"I don't know!" Rob yelled, wiping some dust off of his visor. "But she couldn't have gotten far."

They had chased the woman to the top of the archives. It was hard to tell from their previous lookout point, but it was increasingly obvious that this was a dead end. Hell, it was nigh impossible to get to the tram, as a massive, nearly smooth wall stood in that direction.

"Luke! Cover the exit! I want you to make sure that- GWAH!"

A ball of orange energy struck Rob in the back, sending him flying into the wall.

"HOLY SHIT, THERE SHE IS!" Luke yelled as he squeezed the trigger of the assault rifle, bullets clanked off of the woman's skin as she suddenly lunged toward...

"Fucking bitch!" Charlotte screeched as she fired her gun. However, she only got one or two shots off before the dark-haired woman was on top of her.

The first punch sent the gun sailing out of Charlotte's hand. The second punch caught Charlotte in the face, making her stumble backwards, clutching at her cheek, leaving her pelvic area wide open for the woman's knee...

"Agh!" Charlotte let out a pitiful moan before she slumped to the floor.

Luke winced inwardly. Outwardly, however-

"Dammit!" He ejected the cartridge from his assault rifle. However, before he could load another one, the woman sprang towards him, an orange blade forming around her left arm.

Luke's eyes widened and time seemed to slow down. He tried to raise the assault rifle, in order to intercept the impending death in front of him. However, he was knew he wouldn't make it in time. It was aimed right for his...

However, a few shots rang out. The woman's head suddenly jerked to the side at an unnatural angle and she fell to the floor, sliding across it and bumping up against Luke's feet.

Luke just stared at the seemingly lifeless body before he fell to his knees, panting for breath and trying to calm down his rapidly pumping heart. He glanced to his right in order to see the face of his savior...

"T-thanks for that." Luke muttered.

"No problem." Rob muttered, slowly getting to his feet while he clutched his sides. However, when he spotted Charlotte's form sprawled out on the ground, Rob seemed to forget all injury and rush towards her.

"Charlotte! Are you okay!?"

Charlotte weakly squirmed on the ground before letting out a low whimper. "She...kicked me in the dick... Why...? Why did she kick me in the dick?"
1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.title: Just ask 'Miranda' and company.

choices: Shepard's squad is at the archives.
1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.content:
Having gone another way to try and track down the 'woman', Steven, Liz and Kiran finally caught up. "God, are you alright?" Kiran asked, thumping over to Charlotte as she remained on the ground, nursing her painful crotch. It was peculiar seeing a Krogan so 'compassionate'.

"She just got kicked, she'll be fine." Luke mumbled to the huge, imposing Krogan Kiran had become.

"Ha!" Kiran said in typical 'Grunt' style.

Steven and Liz meanwhile walked over to Rob as he stood over the body of the dark-haired 'woman'. It was clear now she was some sort of advanced robot, an Artificial Intelligence created by Cerberus most likely. "Dr. Eva?" Steven asked Rob.

"Looks like her from the game, yeah." Rob nodded, glancing up at Steven. Even Rob had to admire the body Steven now occupied. The Asari were a very attractive, desirable race, not to mention powerful and long-lived. Part of him was jealous, but he kept that to himself.

"So now what?" Liz asked, after she'd holstered her assault weapon on her back.

Rob and Steven glanced at each other, as Luke and Kiran helped Charlotte to her feet nearby. "Can you carry her?" Rob asked Liz. "I mean... you're the strongest of us.. physically now." he asked in a plaintive tone.

Liz sighed. "I suppose so. But why?" she inquired.

"Possible new body for EDI... er - Laura, sorry." Rob answered, correcting himself. "It's what happened in the game."

"Ahh right." Liz mumbled. Liz and Luke had been informed of Laura's state aboard the Normandy, as well as the states of Natalie and Suki. "Can't the Normandy just land and pick us up?" Liz also asked.

Steven shook his head. "Not with the storm so close, too dangerous." he replied.

Rob decided to hurry things up. "Come on, we need to keep moving, get to the archives. Shepard might need us." he said. Steven nodded, agreeing, whereas everyone else just fell in line, and Liz easily picked up 'Dr Eva's' body and hoisted it over her broad, armor-clad shoulders.

First priority, was to get out of the massive duststorm.
1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.title: Steven's group catches up.

1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.content:
Mona did a perfect forward roll to get behind one of the many crates piled within the room. If she had time to think about it and were adrenaline not coursing through her veins, she would've been impressed with herself.

"Stay down!" Zaeed shouted as he popped out from behind cover and plugged a soldier in the face. She also saw Garrus dive out of the way as a grenade landed worryingly close to him...

Right! Mona had a job to do! Conveniently, one of those soldiers carrying shields happened to be right next to her position...

Mona sprang out of cover, deactivating her cloak. The shield-bearing soldier only had time to turn before he was belted across the face with her gun. The shield hit the ground with a clatter and he slumped to the floor...

Mona quickly disappeared behind cover again, just in time to avoid a barrage of gunfire at her previous position.

"One less to worry about." Garrus' voice somehow carried over the din of gunfire. Mona swore that she could hear not one... two... three bodies hit the floor.

Her minor contribution was enough to give her team the upper hand?

She didn't think long on that thought as she peeked out the top of the crate once more, shooting one of the few soldiers remaining in the back...

Pretty soon, the station fell silent, the only thing to show for Cerberus' resistance to their entry being the pile of bodies and occasional crater scattered across the floor.

Mona took a deep breath in, trying to calm her rapidly beating, adrenaline fueled heart. It was... a little disturbing how naturally all of that had come to her. Convenient, yes, but disturbing...

Shepard stepped out from behind the pillar she was using as cover.

"Okay, to the archives."
1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.title: Shepard's squad is at the archives.

choices: The Illusive Man delivers a message.
1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.content:
There was still the main door protecting the archives, which had been sealed shut from the computer terminal. Tali immediately started trying to hack her way through, while the others stood guard. That was when the second tram started approaching. "Take cover." Shepard told Garrus and the rest, including Mona and Jade. It was a precaution, incase more Cerberus goons ran off the tram.

"Miranda!" Shepard said in a relieved tone, when Rob stepped off the tram. Then Shepard smiled when she saw Steven emerge, followed by Liz, Luke, Charlotte and Kiran in turn. "Liara?" Shepard jogged over to Steven, who instantly went from a combat efficient Asari maiden to a nervous, bashful 'schoolgirl'.

"Shepard, I... um... it's good to see you." Steven mumbled with a smile, as they held hands.

"Likewise, Liara." Shepard showed genuine affection towards Steven.

Not having the privacy she would have liked right now, Shepard refrained from taking the 'moment' any further. Insted she looked to the others. "Ash, how are you? You're looking good." she greeted Luke.

"Er... fine, I guess. All things considered." came Luke's droll reply.

"Lieutenant." Shepard then nodded to Liz, recieving one back in return.

"Any idea what Cerberus is after?"Rob asked Shepard, as he watched Tali come close to breaking the hack on the door.

"Prothean tech mostly likely."

"Yes, precisely. Prothean ruins were discoverd on Mars decades ago, your government kept it secret, as any other would do." Steven explained, remembering the scene from the game.

Rob stepped in. "We can't let the Illusive Man have that data." he said, placing his hands on his curvy hips.

"We won't." Shepard muttered determinedly.

As Tali continued her efforts to open the door, Shepard took Steven's hand and led him off to one side for a private chat. Rob and Kiran glanced at each other and smirked at Steven's predicament. Meanwhile, Liz found herself stealing a glimpse at Luke's armor-clad backside, and she felt a definite 'swelling' under the crotch of her own armor as she did so. Maybe all the combat was making her horny.

Then again, she wasn't alone...
1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.title: "Miranda's" group catches up.

choices: Rob brings Shepard's attention to Eva's body.
The Illusive Man finally shows his face
1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.content:
"Done." Tali said as she stepped back from the computer terminals. Rob walked up to the door and lightly tapped it, causing it to hiss open. He blinked.

"That was quick..."

Out of the corner of his eyes, Rob noticed Shepard pout slightly, probably due to having been denied her private talk with "Liara." A theory further reinforced by Shepard letting out a weary sigh while Steven letting out a relieved one.

"To the archives, then."

They all stormed in and were met by a large, circular room. Catwalks formed the perimeter of the room which had paths that lead up to the large, glowing monolith in the center.

"Do you really need that many monitors to study that one thing?" Jade whispered to Mona who gave a noncommittal shrug. She barely knew how data analysis back in her time worked, she had even less idea of how it might work in the future.

"Ash, Zaeed, Grunt." Shepard commanded.

Luke and Kiran had little idea by what Shepard may have meant, but since Zaeed seemed to be walking around the perimeter, they figured they should do the same.

Everyone else approached the terminal just by the artifact-- or rather, Shepard, Tali, and Steven did. The rest, being a less tech-savvy bunch, just stood back and watched. Steven chose not to question how he suddenly had all this knowledge about advanced electronics...

"All the data is still here, Shepard." Steven said. Honestly, he was a little surprised as he remembered that in the game, the data had been taken by the time everyone got here.

And for that matter, the Illusive man was really taking his time in delivering his message...

"It will take some time to upload."

"Noted." Shepard said, stepping away and tapping the side of her helmet. "Shepard to Normandy, come in!"

All she received was static.

"I didn't hear that, repeat!"

More static.

"Dammit!"

"Shepard." Rob stepped towards her. "The storm is already here, I don't think they can land."
1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.title: Tali opens the door.

choices: A fresh Cerberus assault is launched.
The crew wait out the storm.
1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.content:
"Er... Shepard..." Steven mumbled, bringing the commander's attention to a holographic projection of the Illusive Man that had suddenly appeared not far from the imposing monolith in the room.

Shepard raised her weapon on instinct, causing an unwary Jade and Charlotte to do the same.

"Commander Shepard. I expected seeing you here." The Cerberus leader said in a casual tone, as he puffed away on a cigarette.

"What do you want?" Shepard asked in a gruff tone. She was in no mood for politeness when it came to dealing with this individual.

There was a pause, then the Illusive Man replied. "The same thing as you Commander, a secure future for humanity. The other species have been keeping Prothean technology to themselves, using it to advance their own civilizations, to give them an edge over us. Seems only fitting we should do the same, to be able to defend ourselves." he rambled on.

"We don't safeguard our future by isolating ourselves. We do it by working together with the other races. Can't you see that? Haven't I proved that?" Shepard said, gesturing around to her team members, notably 'Liara', 'Grunt', Tali and Garrus.

"Your team were individuals, each talented at their profession. That's what brought you success against the Collectors. I wonder if that's still the case?." The Illusive man said with an apparent smirk.

"What are you talking about? Shepard quizzed him back. While Steven and Rob shared a quick, nervous glance at one another.

"Maybe I'll let you figure it out on your own, Shepard." The Illusive Man told her.

"Leaving that Collector base intact would have violated every moral fibre of my being. A sacrifice I wasn't prepared to make after seeing what those monsters did to tens of thousands of innocent people, all of them - Human." Shepard stated firmly, going back on topic.

"I want that Prothean technology Shepard, and I will have it. The odds are now stacked in my favor." The Illusive Man hinted again...

"You're welcome to try and take it." Shepard told him. "I'll stop you. We'll - stop you!"

"We'll see. Be seeing you soon Shepard." The Illusive Man mumbled.

"Count on it." Shepard said, glaring at him before his image dissipated.

There was a silence in the vast room, that wasn't broken until Luke happened to sneeze. "Sorry..." he apologized.

"Bless you!" Liz said.
1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.title: The Illusive Man finally shows his face

choices: Meanwhile, back with another of the employees.
1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.content:
The terminal gave a low beep and a window with a "thumbs up" sign popped up. Guess some things will never change. Steven thought with a light chuckle.

"Data is done installing!" he called to the rest of the room.

"Good," Shepard called back "all we need to do is get to the Normandy and get off this rock." Shepard called back as she ran towards the exit. She paused right before she entered the tram station.

"Ah."

Rob came up behind Shepard, and also peered out of the window. He immediately saw the flaw in Shepard's plan. The multicolored wall of clouds that had signified the storm was now surrounding the facility, anything an inch beyond the plated glass was completely obscured.

Shepard turned back to the room.

"Change of plan. We sit tight in here until the storm passes, then we call the Normandy to pick us up."

Surprisingly little objection was given. Everyone just relaxed a bit, holstered weapons, and walked to different areas. Tali and Garrus, for instance, went to closely inspect the prothean artifact, while Zaeed leaned against one of the railings.

Rob himself retreated into the tram station and collapsed onto one of the multicolored seats... the one seat that wasn't torn apart by stray bullets. Now that he looked at the station, it looked humorously enough... like one of the subway stations back at home. There were seats to wait in; a women's, men's and "family" restrooms, and even what looked to be a kiosk (but what was probably a security terminal).

Rob took a deep breath in. During the day, he had been shot at, walked into rooms full of mutilated corpses, and, most of all, fought a psychopathic robot. The events were starting to catch up with him... and a pressure was building up in his chest.
1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.title: Steven downloads the Prothean data.

1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.content:
"The enemy ship appears to be on an attack vector." Laura told Joker in the pilot's seat.

"Er... yeah I can see that EDI, thanks." Joker responded in typical fashion. "How about you get in contact with Shepard and tell her what's going on up here." he then continued.

"A massive storm on the planet surface is disrupting communications. Contact is impossible. And launching a shuttle would be suicide." Laura stated.

"Okay then, better tell the crew to hang on to something, this is gonna get a little dicey." Joker said, as he moved the ship and began performing evasive maneuvers. And none too soon, for the Cerberus cruiser in orbit over the planet began firing it's pulse cannons at the Normandy. The Cerberus vessel was bigger than the Normandy, but lacked maneuverability. And with Joker at the helm, the Normandy was able to evade the enemy fire.

"Are our guns ready EDI?"

Laura checked her systems, and immediately knew the answer. "The Thanix cannon is operating at optimal capacity, secondary weapons are also online." she said.

"A simple yes would have done EDI." Joker mumbled, as he shifted the ship into a hard right turn and then came about, heading straight back for the Cerberus ship. The secondary armament fired first, then the Thanix cannon glowed hot before discharging a shot that tore through the enemy vessel, crippling it. That set off a chain reaction of explosions inside the ship that ultimately destroyed it.

"We are victorious!" Laura said in a humorously exaggerated statement.

Joker nodded, acting more casual. "Um... yeah we kicked their asses." he smirked.

"I will keep trying to contact Shepard and the others." Laura told Joker, who nodded in acknowledgement.

Meanwhile, down in Engineering, Natalie was away from her station in CIC again, and was talking to Suki. Engineer Donnelly meanwhile was getting slightly annoyed that he was being left alone to monitor the ship's engines all the time.
1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.title: Meanwhile, out in space...

1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.content:
Natalie took a couple of deep breaths and put a hand to her chest, if only to calm her rapidly beating heart. The ship had finally stopped shaking in the pitched way it did when it was taking and weaving around enemy fire.

"Are you okay?" Suki said, leaning on the wall to her left.

It was still awkward hearing Gabriella speak and knowing that it was Suki inside of there...

"Yeah, I think."

Natalie walked up and leaned up against the wall next to Suki. Natalie had no idea how Suki had remained calm throughout this whole thing, knowing that at any second, they could be vaporized or blown to a thousand different pieces of debris. Still, Natalie was sort of the support column Natalie needed through this whole thing. Ironic as Natalie was the older of the two.

"I guess Cerberus didn't take Shepard's resignation well." Natalie chuckled mirthlessly to herself as she shook her head.

"I think they might've been planning this before Shepard decided to break off..."

"Yeah, I suppose..." Natalie took in another deep breath. "Do you think everyone else is okay down there?"

Now it was Suki's turn to look a little downcast. "I... don't know."

Suki had been a little shocked when she seemed to instinctively know how to do her onboard duties and she prayed, for the sake of her coworkers, that their bodies also came with built in combat instincts. Still, they were all in a warzone...

The terminal next to them lit up and the glowing blue sphere that was Laura appeared. Natalie considered it a minor achievement that she did not flinch in surprise.

"I'm trying to contact everyone." Laura said. "But, there is a storm that is blocking transmission."

"Oh, I see." Natalie muttered.

"I'm sure everyone is alright." Laura said in the best "comforting tone" she could. Whoever designed EDI did not seem to have emotional range in mind...

...Not to mention, it was a little disturbing how formal she sounded when talking. It certainly wasn't a conscious decision on her part...
1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.title: Natalie and Suki's chat.

1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.content:
Steven was busy checking some other data on one of the computer terminals when Shepard appeared behind him. "Liara, can I have word with you?" she whispered, loud enough so only Steven could hear, or so she thought. Actually Rob heard it too, but he didn't let on. He did watch however as a nervous Steven exhaled deeply and followed Shepard behind a pillar. Rob couldn't help but raise an eyebrow...

"Did I say something wrong earlier?" Shepard initiated the conversation.

"What?" Steven replied with a frown.

Shepard for the first time seemed unsure about something, even... nervous. That made two of them, but Steven was definitely the more nervous of the two. "Well, it seemed like you brushed me off earlier. I was a little - surprised." she said.

Steven shook his head, his heart rate slowly creeping up. "Oh no, you didn't... say... um... I mean - do anything. It was just... all we've been through today, it's just took it's toll. I didn't mean to upset you Shepard." Steven stammered his way through his reply.

Shepard shrugged. "We've been through a lot worse than today. Saren, the Geth, and of course the Shadow Broker's ship, and it never seemed to bother you like this before." she mumbled.

"Well, that was different." Steven said, fidgeting as his eyes unconsciously roamed over Shepard's armor-clad form.

"Really? How?" Shepard asked.

"Um...." Steven sighed. He was really bad at this. But luckily for him, his bashfulness, and his nervousness, only made him look 'cuter' in Shepard's eyes.

"I thought you loved seeing me in action." Shepard smirked, admiring the familiar Asari maiden stood in front of her. "Or was that just in bed?" she winked, moving towards Steven, who was frozen to the spot. He backed up against the pillar and his feelings were definitely mixed when Shepard planted a kiss on his lips. He let out a silent moan that told Shepard that 'Liara' liked it.

Steven eventually returned the affection, his hands wrapping around Shepard's waist as he kissed her.

Garrus' voice was the one that brought an abrupt end to the 'session'. "Shepard, might want to check out these schematics." he said, as he brought up a holographic image of something called 'The Crucible'. A possible weapon against a Reaper invasion.

Shepard reluctantly drew away from 'Liara', then smiled at her. "We'll finish this later okay." she said in a soft whisper.

"Fine by me." Steven nodded, a 'playful' smile having replaced his frown.

Shepard then went to see what Garrus had found, while Steven calmed himself down and stepped from behind the pillar. Rob was there, arms folded, eyebrow raised. "Shepard give you a tongue-lashing huh?" he quipped.

Steven cleared his throat. It was a good thing Asari didn't blush like humans did. "Something like that." Steven said, before walking back to the computer terminal.

Rob just smirked away to himself.
1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.title: Back on Mars, Shepard approaches "Liara...

choices: Jade begins figuring out what is wrong with Mona.
1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.content:
Mona stared, somewhat forlornly, out the window at the storm. A couple of times, she could've sworn she saw something, some building or other large shadow, through the heavy clouds of dust. However, she knew this just to be wishful thinking that the storm may end soon.

Her hand slid down the glass before she let out a sigh. "This sucks."

"In a hurry to leave?" said Jade, who had been pacing back and forth just behind Mona.

"No, I like it here." Mona rolled her eyes. "Being with a pile of corpses is definitely my idea of a good time."

Soon after they had secured the data, Mona and Jade had decided they needed some time away from everyone else. Thankfully, the archives section had a side room (that wasn't booby trapped, piled with corpses, or otherwise contaminated by unknown... stuff), so they had closed themselves up in there.

"...sorry about that." said Mona, looking down slightly. "It's just..."

"Everyone's edge right now, don't feel bad about it." Jade sighed.

Mona chewed on her lip. That may have been a major part of Mona's pent up frustration, but there was another... much more humiliating reason. Fighting alongside each other did wonders for Mona and Jade's relationship, after all, back at Wilkos, the two had never shared a word. However, now that Mona was in Kasumi's body and was viewing Jacob's body, she couldn't help but admire it.

Between the strange sense of arousal Mona had gotten during combat and this...

"Um, yes?"

Mona averted her eyes, flushing in embarrassment. "Oh, its nothing, just..."
1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.title: The storm rages on.

1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.content:
While Mona and Jade were having their little chat and Garrus, Zaeed and Tali were talking, Kiran was going from person to person, trying to act as nonchalant as possible, asking a few questions. Despite her own drastic change of appearance, inside - she was still the same old Kiran. And it was as though she could sense the sexual tension and denial of romantic impulses building in the air. Her first port of call had been Charlotte, who was reluctant to open up - for some reason she wasn't telling.

So instead Kiran moved on to talk to Luke, who was sat fidgeting. Occasionally he would reach up to feel his breasts, only to not be able to because of his armor. "So, got used to being a girl yet?" Kiran boomed in her deep, Krogan voice.

Luke looked up at her surprised. "Er... no, course not. This is bat shit crazy." he grumbled in Ashley's voice.

"What do you think I feel like? Yet you don't see me moping around." Kiran said to him with a shrug. "I'm looking on this whole thing as a learning experience, and I'm staying positive that we'll get back to our own world... and bodies soon enough."

"I wouldn't call losing my dick a 'learning experience'." Luke snapped.

"Course it is, stupid." Kiran said bluntly, letting out a slight chuckle. Her Krogan-ness did raise it's head at times.

Luke let out an irritated sigh. "Look, what do you want?" he asked Kiran, who wouldn't go away.

"To help people adjust to their new bodies." Kiran answered, before glancing over to Steven, who still had a 'cute' smile etched on his face. "Steven's already started making the transition, thanks to Shepard." she added contentedly.

"Yeah great, lucky bastard," Luke muttered, burying his face in his hands. "Shepard will probably have his blue ass in bed with her by the end of the day."

Kiran laughed again. "Maybe she will. And boom... there'll go his virginity." she said, doing an imitation baseball swing.

What Kiran was trying to get Luke to admit was that he had been checking Liz out, or rather the body Liz now occupied. But for Luke to admit that would also mean him admitting that he now fancied men. .. just like Ashley always had. He wasn't ready for that... yet.

Kiran wondered whether she should keep pressing Luke, or try her luck with someone else...
1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.title: Meanwhile, with a different group.

1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.content:
After teasing Steven, Rob felt a little bit of tension ebb away. Still, he didn't see much potential for further interaction, as Steven buried his face back into one of the many terminals.

"Some things never change." he said, smirking to himself as he turned away to find some action elsewhere.

He didn't have to look long...

Charlotte, in all of her punk glory, sat out in the tram station, on one of the many torn-up seats. She had a slight frown on her face and --to Rob's slight confusion-- was rubbing at her crotch. However, upon seeing Rob approaching she immediately stopped and looked away.

"So, uh..." Rob sidled up next to her. "How are you holding up after, you know..." Rob gestured down to her crotch. Back in the aftermath of the fight with Eva, he had figured out that some parts of Charlotte's anatomy was not expected.

Charlotte winced. "Does it always hurt that much?"

"Basically." Rob gave a slow nod. Charlotte's eyes twitched and she kicked at the floor.

"Ugh! this sucks!" She threw her hands up in the air.

Rob sat down in one of the shredded cushions and leaned backwards. He thought of mentioning that women had it almost as bad when it came to getting kicked in the genitals, but he chose to drop it there.

...

The silence was starting to get pretty awkward, especially with Charlotte just staring at the floor, refusing to meet his eye.

"So, first mission?" Rob said in an uncertain tone. He himself was really unsure if he should celebrate or not. This whole mission was hell, and he remembered from the game that this was supposed to be part of the freakin' tutorial in the game. He did not even want to think about what Tuchunka was going to look like...

"I sucked, didn't I?"

That was the only way he could describe his performance. He didn't really lead anyone to do anything of value, they helped Shepard in the bare minimum of ways, and the fact that they were not riddled with bullets was due to luck rather than anything. Hell, even Eva. They would have all died had Eva...

"I didn't think you did too bad." said Charlotte, lifting her eyes from the ground.

Rob was a little taken aback. The Charlotte he knew was blunt and sarcastic. He expected her to go along with his statement.

"But..."

"But nothing. You saved my life and Luke's. That is good enough for me." Charlotte said with a smile.

"... thanks." said a flustered Rob.
1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.title: Rob is chatting to Charlotte.

1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.content:
Watching Jade pacing around in Jacob's fit body was definitely giving Mona a hard on. Luckily the material of her outfit kept it well hidden. Part of her was glad it was the future, and that clothing had also advanced along with technology. Still, she knew Rob was probably aware of her 'secret', and she just didn't want anyone else knowing just yet.

Jade soon saw Mona staring at her again, and she walked over to her. Crap. Way to be subtle Mona. Mona mumbled under her breath, sighing as Jade took a seat next to her.

"Something wrong?" Jade inquired, shrugging her broad shoulders.

Mona bit her lip again. "Are you a virgin?" she suddenly asked Jade, much to her surprise.

"Er... where did that question come from?" was Jade's response. She thought it a pretty bizarre inquiry given their current situation. Jade of course had no idea that Kasumi fancied Jacob in the actual game itself. Or that Mona would now have that 'crush'.

"Just curious." Mona muttered. "Trying to keep my mind off other stuff."

Jade smiled a little, shaking her head. Fair enough. "Well, no I'm not. I've had sex four times. Two different boyfriends." she revealed to Mona, who was taken aback by her friend's 'boast'. "What about you?"

Mona thought about making something up, but then decided against it. "Um... yeah, I'm a virgin." she murmured, looking sorry for herself.

"That's nothing to be ashamed of. You just haven't met the right person." Jade told her. "You'll know when you do, believe me." she smiled, patting Mona on her right thigh. That single touch sent a rush of arousal through Mona's already turned on body.

"Thanks, handsome." Mona chuckled nervously, touching Jade's muscular thigh in return.

"Anytime." Jade mumbled in her deep voice, nodding gently. Jade didn't admit it to Mona, but she did find her (Kasumi's body) attractive, and the large black cock she had in her pants was hardening as she looked Mona over. It was a pleasurable experience to be sure.

Mona just let out a deep breath, trying to control her hormones. She was in two minds whether to just tell Jade about her 'secret'. But what if Jade was repulsed after she told her? She didn't want that... Grrr, this sucks!
1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.title: Back with Mona and Jade

1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.content:
At first, Rob and Charlotte had been simply sitting together, offering emotional support, but keeping eyes off of each other. Soon, such emotional support also became a physical support as they leaned on each other, and eventually, they were full on embracing, lips locked in a rather amateurish kiss.

It had all been through a haze of lust that they had gotten to this point, neither Rob nor Charlotte could really say how they had. However, Rob suspected that it started around the time that Charlotte complimented him.

When did I become so sentimental? Rob thought. He blamed his new female hormones.

Eventually, they broke the kiss and pulled back, stopping inches from each other's faces.

"Not bad." Charlotte said with a mischievous grin. Even she would admit, she was not the best judge of that, though. Being a virgin, this was really her first time at kissing and, in most circles, that kiss would've been merely known as a "peck."

"Likewise." Rob grinned back.

They eventually broke eye contact and leaned back in their chairs. Charlotte never imagined that her first kiss would be with a woman. This seemed to be more in her friend, Maddy's, field. How was she doing, anyways? Charlotte thought, a little wistfully. Maddy may have been annoying, but she was still Charlotte's friend.

But, Charlotte only dwelled on that thought for a moment before she returned to the present. Being so close to Rob and kissing he- him made her erect cock twitch and ache. No, that did not do the sensation justice. It felt like her penis would split in half were she not to do something about it.

Charlotte was not alone at all when it came to arousal. Rob, for his part, had noticed that the room temperature had seemed to shoot up by a couple degrees and he was breathing much faster than he normally did. Not to mention, the slight dampness in his... underclothing.

"So... Charlotte?" Rob asked. "Have you ever... you know, done 'it' before?"

"Nope." Charlotte snorted. Well, she may have shoved something up her vagina (oh, how she missed 'her') on a couple occasions, but since those were either her fingers or inanimate objects, she doubted they counted.

1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.title: Back with Rob and Charlotte.

1351311121212322111121123332332322113231.content:
Charlotte had something niggling at her, and she had to get it off her chest. After kissing Rob again and brushing his long black hair out of his face, she drew back slightly and looked downwards. "Rob... you know in the game, um... Jack was always so aggressive..." she started to explain.

"Er... just slightly, yeah." Rob chuckled. "Psychopath more like. You're a vast improvement on the original." he complimented her.

Charlotte paued, then let out a sigh. "Well there might have been a reason actually." she said.

"Oh...?" Rob's interest was peaked.
