Steven waited until a Redanian guard had walked past, then resumed the conversation in a quieter tone. "I said are you alright? Are you... YOU?" He emphasized, pointing at Geralt before putting his manicured hands on his hips.

"Er..." Geralt just murmured, unsure what to say now.

Steven rolled his eyes and took Geralt by the hand, literally dragging him towards a nearby alleyway, next to the Golden Sturgeon Inn. Steven then pushed Geralt up against a wall and repeated his earlier question. "Are you... really Geralt? Answer me!" Steven snapped this time, getting impatient. But even as he asked questions of Geralt, Steven had to admit the witcher looked... handsome. The way the armor hugged his masculine form.... wait... "Stop it!" Steven told himself, shaking his head slightly as he waited for Geralt to answer him.

Eventually, Steven got his reply. "No I'm not, why?" "Geralt" said.

"Because I'm not Triss either. I'm... um... I'm Steven." He revealed to the witcher.

"Steven?? Holy fuck dude, its me, Luke. You're... wow!! You're Triss Merigold!" Luke gasped in shock, surveying Steven's new form.

Steven didn't appreciate the leering. "Yes I am, apparently, and unless you want a fireball up your ass, stop looking at me like that." He barked, sounding quite intimidating even with Triss' melodic voice. He had to concentrate not to admire Luke's new body himself, cursing the female hormones now controlling him somewhat.

"S-sorry, and okay. Now um... what the fuck happened to us? Why are we here? In these bodies?" Luke asked, gesturing down to himself.

Steven shrugged, sighing deeply as he folded his arms under his breasts. "I don't know," he said, peering past the end of his hood, "but we have to find out. And we have to find out if anyone else ended up like us." He continued.
135213331311.title: Steven spots a familiar face.

1352133313112.content:
"M'lady, your horse is ready outside the palace walls, and General Voorhis has been kind enough to assign an escort for you to Novigrad as you reuqested." A palace servant suddenly said to Liz, who now what her name was at least. Yennefer...? Hmm, nice name. She thought, rubbing her chin for a moment before taking a second to nod at the servant. "Thank you!" She said to him gratiously.

The servant, Mererid, nodded, then led Liz to the main exit of the palace where a beautiful black horse was waiting. A stallion, deep black in color, with a black and white saddle, and on their horses nearby, were six heavily armored Nilfgardian elite soldiers, again... mostly in black. Liz was frightfully intimidated by the whole situation, but most of the reason was she was completely unfamiliar with her surroundings, unlike her friends currently in Novigrad.

"I would have thought opening a portal would have been quicker m'lady." A strong, accented voice suddenly startled Liz, who turned to see a immaculately dressed army officer approaching. General Voorhis no less...

"A portal?" Liz answered, frowning intently.

General Voorhis chuckled. "Well you ARE a sorceress are you not? For you opening a portal is as easy as opening a door is to the rest of us. But... considering that magic can be detected by some, I can understand your caution."

Liz's mouth fell partly open as she tried to figure all this out, and then she closed it shut and smiled, nodding. "Um... yes, quite!"

"My best soldiers, from the 7th Daerlan Brigade, at your command. They will make sure you get to Novigrad safely. I will have a second detachment following a few hours behind to be sure." The general then said proudly, gesturing to his mounted troops.

"I appreciate it General." Liz again nodded, trying not to act too out of character for this "Yennefer", whoever she was.

"It is no problem my lady, I wish you a pleasant and safe journey to the so-called "free city" hmm." General Voorhis bowed his head briefly, then signalled to his soldiers to get ready to depart, before disappearing back inside the palace himself. Liz took a deep breath, then glanced back to her horse, the last time she had ridden a horse she had been a teenager. She shrugged, and then managed to mount the magnificent animal without issue. She took hold of the reigns, then turned to one of the soldiers accompanying her, taking a moment to brush her long, luxurious black hair from her face. "To Novigrad then." She stated.

The soldiers all nodded, then formed up around Liz, two in front, one either side and two behind. And Liz's journey to Novigrad began...
1352133313112.title: Back in Vizima.

13521333131121.content:
Always a quick learner, it didn't take long for Natalie to discover she was somehow inhabiting the body of a powerful sorceress named Keira Metz. And from the documents scattered around her countryside 'hideout', she also found out that she had fled from soldiers under the command of King Radovid, sovereign of a realm called Redania who had decided to slaughter eveyone who dabbled in magic. That in turn made Natalie wonder if she had retained all of Keira's magic abilities when she was transported into her body.

After using the smooth skull on the nearby mantlepiece to open up some kind of portal, Natalie had bucked up the courage to step through it and into a... beautiful little garden of sorts, with flowers, animals and a small structure with a warm pool of water to bathe in. This was undoubtedly Keira's 'safe place'. "Right, so if I concentrate... " Natalie mumbled, sitting on the stone steps and holding her hand up in front of her. A quick focus was all that was needed to create a 'ball' of electric (or shock) energy. She then hurled it at a nearby tree and blasted a piece of bark off it. "Holy shit!" Natalie gasped, not quite believing that magic was now real or that she could wield it so easily.

She wondered if any of her friends had been transported into this strange world too, and if they had, then she had to find them ASAP. "But where do I start?" She asked herself in her now refined English accent. Glancing back at the portal gate, she rubbed her chin in wonder. She could probably open up a manual portal perhaps? And use it to take her to those closest to her, meaning her friends? She knew it was a risk, using these magic skills, but Natalie knew also that she had little choice. She had no idea what this land was, but she already knew she was in danger.

"Maybe that can wait a bit." Natalie suddenly said, smirking as she stood up and walked up the steps to the welcoming bath of hot water. "I could use a bathe I think." She told herself, needing little convincing.

She started stripping out of her sorceress garb, and while doing so inspected her much more shapelier, sexy body. It was perfect.... and having such a gorgeous body was the one thing in this new world that she was sure she loved.

Natalie let out a contented moan as she slipped her svelte body under the water, and her worries... at least for now... drifted away to the back of her mind.
13521333131121.title: Meanwhile back with 'Keira'.

135213331311213.content:
"Right, there's got to be more than just us here. So we need to search for any of our friends." Steven said, Triss' voice leaving his painted lips as he strutted back and forth, as Luke just stood there, arms folded, looking impressive. "The Rosemary & Thyme!" He then said, clicking his manicured fingers. "One of them might be in Dandelion's body, maybe..." He murmured.

"Worth a shot I suppose." Luke muttered back in Geralt's gruff voice. "Though I doubt if someone is in his body, they're unlikely to be impressed." He chuckled, which was not typical for a Witcher.

Steven peered past his hood again, raising a shaped eyebrow skywards. "You think I'm impressed being stuck in a woman's body while you get to be a sword wielding Witcher?" He asked Luke, frowning afterwards.

Luke shrugged lazily. "I doubt it, but at least you're sexy! Whoever is Dandelion now, well... basically a ponce am I right?"

"We don't even know if one of our friends IS Dandelion yet, but we need to check." Steven said, ignoring the 'sexy' comment from Luke. "Follow!" He then gestured, walking off briskly back into Novigrad's main square, his heels clonking on the cobbled ground. Luke just smirked slightly, admiring Steven's new ass as he passed, then he followed him.

"Aren't you afraid of being captured and tortured at any minute Steven?" Luke asked, as he noticed the dirty looks he himself was getting from the Novigrad locals and the Redanian soldiers/Witcher Hunters. He followed Steven into another alleyway on the way to Dandelion's Inn, and was surprised when Steven turned around and struck a feminine pose... briefly conjuring a fireball in his palm. "Woah... I see you've got a handle on Triss' magic." Luke said, wild-eyed.

"I can defend myself," Steven said, "and I'd like to see how you do with those swords actually. See if there's a hint of the real Geralt in there somewhere."

"Well, I do feel... stronger, faster..." Luke mumbled, cracking his neck and flexing his arm muscles under his armor.

"Yeah, you're the Six Million Dollar Man. Come on lets keep moving." Steven joked, smirking as he resumed walking. He was oblivious to the effect his wiggling, shapely ass was having on Luke behind him.

"Very funny." Luke muttered sarcastically, as he kept following Steven towards their destination.
135213331311213.title: Back with 'Triss' and 'Geralt'.

1352133313112133.content:
After enjoying her soak in an exquisite bath, Natalie had stepped back through the portal and was now in the hut in Velen again. She was getting quite adept at casting magic spells and illusions thanks to the many books laid about and of course Keira's inherent magical talents. "A big strong, dark-haired man." Natalie smirked, after chanting the Elven words to a Conjuring spell. It was a simple one, that created a 'golem' of a muscular man in his 20's, Natalie's dream guy. It wasn't a real person since the spell was a simple one, but Natalie was nonetheless impressed.

It suddenly occurred to her that she could probably teleport herself to her friends using another portal that she could conjure herself. The alternative was staying in this run-down thatch roof hut doing nothing.

As the golem before her disappeared, Natalie took a deep breath and started reading into a magic book further, in particular the section on portals and how to open them safely. As she thought, portals could be opened and used to teleport the caster where they wanted to go, or near to someone they wanted to see. In Natalie's case it would be the latter.

Putting the book down, Natalie decided to try and find her friends, or even to try and send herself back home. She chose the former, since if there was one thing Natalie hated, it was being on her own, especially when lost in a world he didn't know or didn't understand fully.

"Take me to Liz." Natalie called out, outstretching her arms then spreading them apart... creating a portal. Staring into the blackness of the portal with its glowing edge, Natalie closed her eyes, put her hand to her chest and stepped through.

En-route to Novigrad, Liz, in Yennefer's body, was surrounded by her armed guard when she noticed a strange wind suddenly kick up in a field off to her right, immediately followed by the opening of some kind of portal. When a blonde haired, attractive woman in a dress stepped through, the armed Nilgardians drew their swords and started taking up defensive positions. "Hold!" Their commander said, before then glancing at 'Yennefer'.

Natalie looked shocked to suddenly be facing several heavily armed men in full plate armor on horseback. She gulped hard and stepped back, as the Nilfgardian detachment commander moved his horse forward. "Hold Sorceress! What is your business?" He called out, in broken English.

"Um... I'm trying to find a friend, er... any friend... would be nice." Natalie answered back, sweeping her hair behind her ears.

"What is your name?" Liz called out in Yennefer's voice.

Natalie decided to use her actual name instead of Keira's. "I'm Natalie." She answered.

Liz's beautiful new eyes widened in surprise, then she leapt down off her horse and started walking forward in her high heeled boots. Once she was out of earshot of the Nilfgardians, she spoke up quietly. "Natalie? Its me... Liz." She smiled nervously, glancing back to make sure she had not been heard. Natalie almost burst into tears and the two women embraced each other.

The Nilfgardians looked at each other, and a couple of them shared a dirty grin, chuntering in their native tongue.

"I'm so glad you're safe Natalie. And if you're here too, then there must be more of us here too. We have to find them." Liz mumbled. She then turned to the Nilfgardian commander. "She's coming with us to Novigrad." She said, eliciting a nod from the soldier.

Smiling at Liz, Natalie then shared a horse with her former boss and the group continued on it's way.
1352133313112133.title: At Keira's hut, in Velen.

choices: Back on the road in Velen.
13521333131121332.content:
"My god, its weird seeing all this in real life, uh... you know what I mean." Steven said from Triss' body as he surveyed the outer facade of the Rosemary & Thyme Inn, which he and Luke were now stood outside of.

"Yeah, I know." Luke nodded calmly, showing as much enthusiasm as the real Geralt would have.

"Well, let's head on inside." Steven then said, gesturing with his manicured hands in typical Triss fashion. He briefly adjusted his breasts in his tight fitting top and then pushed the door open to the Inn, revealing a barely occupied room. There were a couple of scantily clad women, including an Elf, and a man behind the bar cleaning some glasses with his cloth.

"You here for some fun Whitey?" One of the women immediately started flirting with Luke, referring to Geralt's white hair. "Your lady friend can be involved too is she likes." The woman then giggled, gesturing over to the hooded female figure that was Steven.

Steven pulled down his hood, revealing his bright red hair which was tied back in two tidy buns. He gave the flirty woman a certain stare, and it was as though she knew who Steven was (a powerful Sorceress). "We're fine, thank you. Come on Geralt." He said, and Luke reluctantly followed as the woman sat back down. Once they were out of earshot, Steven glanced back to Luke. "Try not to be too much like the real Geralt, okay? And by that I mean don't go jumping into bed with every wench who bats her eyelashes at you." Steven said, as they ascended the stairs to the next floor of the Inn.

"I get it, yeah." Luke sighed, eyeing up Steven's new, perfectly shaped ass as he walked ahead of him again.

Emerging on the second floor, Steven looked around, then started knocking on doors, getting no reply from any of the rooms. "Try the third floor, Dandelion's special suite." Luke suggested, eliciting a nod from Steven.

The two went upstairs and knocked on the door. This time a famiilar voice answered. "Er... who is it?" Dandelion called through the door.

"Friends." Steven said, after he and Luke had shared a hopeful glance.
13521333131121332.title: Back in Novigrad.

choices: Liz and Natalie make progress through Velen.
135213331311213322.content:
"Sorry to interrupt m'lady, but the Captain of the Guard wishes to know if you still plan on hiring a witcher to hunt down the beast that is prowling your lands and murdering your subjects?" A handmaiden disturbed Jessica as she was deep in thought.

"Beast?" Jessica looked up, sounding alarmed by the notion.

"Yes, m'lady," The handmaiden frowned, thinking her Duchess was acting a little strange. "If you'll recall you were thinking of hiring a certain Witcher, Geralt of Rivia I believe?" She mumbled. "Shall I show Damien de la Tour in m'lady?" She then asked.

"Um, yes, at once, please." Jessica stated, firmly yet politely, as was her way sometimes (and as it turned out, as was Duchess Anna Henrietta's way too). Jessica then got to her feet, pacing in her modest heels, while looking down at her long, flowing, intricate gown. She had no clue what was going off, where she was, and how she got here, but she was here, and she intended to deal with it and find her answers.

"Your Royal Highness!" The well armored 'knight' bowed as he presented himself before whom he thought was his Duchess. And in body, that was true. But there was a very confused, and scared 23-year old retail store worker from another reality in Anna Henrietta's body, trying to make sense of things.

"Sir." Jessica nodded gracefully.

"Do you still intend on hiring the witcher Your Grace?" Damien asked. "I swear to you, the Ducal Guard is quite capable of slaying this vile monster that stalks your subjects." He continued.

"I have the utmost respect for the Ducal Guard, Captain, but I do think beasts should be taken care of by professionals who exist for that very purpose." Jessica said, winging it a great deal, and doing a very good job of it. Witchers were indeed professional monster slayers, and a dying breed. "Now please, summon the witcher as we discussed." She ordered, actually feeling quite powerful due to her new status. This land of Toussaint, 'her' land was indeed beautiful.

"As you wish, Your Grace." Damien bowed again, before backing up and leaving the room.

"Okay, that went quite well, I think..." Jessica mumbled to herself, holding her stomach. Partly because she had butterflies, but also because the corset she was wearing was too damn tight. She winced and then walked over to a small table where a pitcher of wine and a single glass were stood on a silver tray. She poured herself a drink, hoping that soon she would know a little more about her current situation.
135213331311213322.title: Meanwhile, in Toussaint.

1352133313112133221.content:
Judging from the behavior of 'Dandelion' as they walked through the door, Steven and Luke (in Triss' and Geralt's bodies respectively) glanced at each other and instantly knew they had found another one of their friends. "What's your name?" Steven asked in his sexy new voice.

"Um... Rob!" The badly dressed minstrel replied, making no attempt to hide his real identity, mainly because he didn't really know much about the world or the body he now inhabited.

"Oh, nice one, someone else we've found." Luke breathed a sigh of relief, stepping into the room further.

To Rob, the sight of a white haired, cat-eyed man in heavy armor and wielding two swords on his back was quite intimidating. But this feeling of fear was somewhat offset by the feeling of attraction he felt whenever he looked at the hot redhead also standing before him. Rob's eyes worked their way over Triss's shapely figure, without knowing it was actually one of his friends inside her body.

"Eyes up here Rob." Steven sighed, clicking his fingers and pointing to his beautiful new face.

"Huh?" Rob just mumbled, drawing his eyes up to the face of the 'woman' talking to him.

"That's Steven you're gawking at." Luke said, in Geralt's familiar emotionless tone. This caused Rob's jaw to drop, and he once again looked over at the redhead, not believing what he had heard.

Steven just put his hands on his hips, and nodded. "Its true, I'm Steven. And that's Luke." He said, pointing to 'Geralt'.

"Well, w--what the hell happened to us? Why are we here? In these bodies? And... why are you a woman and we're not? Not that I'm bothered about that last one." Rob threw a plethora of questions at Steven.

Steven rolled his eyes. "We're as much in the dark as you are. We know nothing. But incase you need help identifying our location, its the world of Witcher 3; The Wild Hunt, a video game. And we're some of the characters." Steven explained in length. "I'm Triss Merigold, Luke is Geralt of Rivia, the main character, and you are... um... Dandelion." He continued, pretty much correctly assuming that Rob would hate his new name.

"I'm named after a flower?" Rob grumbled. "Mind you," He then muttered, glancing down at himself, "dressed like this I'm not surprised to be honest. What the hell am I wearing?" He asked.

"A ridiculous outfit." Luke answered honestly. "Love your tights though." He smirked, which was uncharacteristic of Geralt.

"Not the time for jokes." Rob scolded Luke. "And what the hell are we going to do now? How we going to get back home?" He inquired impatiently, pacing the room and rubbing his forehead.

Steven had already formulated a rough plan. "We find other main characters and find out if any of our other friends are in their bodies. Then once we've gathered everyone we can, we try and find a way back home. I mean, in this world magic is real, so there must be a way." Steven said, holding his hand out and conjuring a fireball in it to prove his point. Rob staggered backwards in shock upon seeing this demonstration of Steven's sorceress abilities.

"And I'll try and take care of any monsters along the way." Luke said, drawing his silver sword from it's sheath on his back and swinging it a little.

"And what do I do?" Rob shrugged, holding out his arms.

Steven and Luke glanced at each other, then back at Rob and said in unison. "Play the lute?"

Rob just frowned intently at them both...
1352133313112133221.title: Back at the Rosemary & Thyme.

13521333131121332213.content:
Off in the Skellige Isles, there was another of the store employees equally as lost as her friends, and that was Kiran. She found herself in an unassuming little village called Lofoten on the island of Hindersfjall. Kiran had no interest or experience in video games, much like most of the others, and to suddenly find herself in another world... and in another body... was distressing to her. She was in fact now inhabiting the body of Cirilla Fiona Elen Riannon, or Ciri for short, the Child of the Elder Blood, heir of Lara Dorren's, and with a power inside her like no other. Kiran had no idea that she was now the only one capable of stopping Ithlinne's Prophecy, the White Frost, basically the end of civilization.

"You got Amnesia or something girl?" The elderly village woman asked, standing in front of Kiran, who didn't know what to do, or what to say.

As a young woman then walked up, the older woman's daughter in fact, Kiran looked up, the scar on her left cheek evident, her steel sword, Ziraeal, on her back. "I don't belong here, I don't know... what's happened." Kiran mumbled, holding her hands out in front of her for a moment, then inspecting the stained, torn outfit she was wearing, complete with chunky heeled, knee-high boots.

"That's clear to see lass, you're obviously not from here." The old woman chuckled, folding her arms.

"What's your name?" The younger woman then inquired.

Kiran looked down at herself again, and was about to reply with her real name, but then she realized... she wasn't technically herself anymore. But what was her name now? The identity of the woman whose body she now wore? So many questions were racing through her confused head, and she had no answers whatsoever. She had never felt so lost before. She just wanted to return to her own 'world'. "I can't... I c--can't remember..." Kiran muttered.

"As I thought, Amnesia." The old woman nodded. "Don't worry, we'll take good care of ye."

"Thank you," Kiran managed to force a smile, looking up again, then sighing deeply, "I need to lie down."

"You should spend a while in the sauna first lass, Astrid will take you there." The old woman smiled, gesturing to her daughter. Kiran agreed and followed Astrid to where the village sauna was located. If anything, she could try and relax and think of her next course of action.
13521333131121332213.title: Off in the Skellige Isles.

135213331311213322132.content:
Poor Liam was understandably confused as he was led to the quarters of Emperor Emyr Var Emries for an audience, that was really a summoning. Liam had a vague idea where he was, at least what world he was in, being a casual gamer. But he was still in unfamiliar surroundings, he had dimeritium shackles on his wrists, several heavily armed and armored soldiers around him, and worst of all... he was trapped in a woman's body. It wasn't until Liam was led into the Emperor's quarters that Liam knew what world he was in. He recognized the Nilfgardian banners hung in the room, and the man before him.

"Do you know why you're here Fringilla?" The emperor spoke up, wasting no time.

Liam looked down at his generous cleavage and the revealing dress he had on, and he had to resist the urge to grab his tits and squeeze them. Being in a woman's body was just so damn weird and distracting. At least he now knew who he was too. He was in the world of the Witcher III, and he was somehow inhabiting the body of Fringilla Vigo, one of the former members of the Lodge of Sorceresses. Quite a step up from the slacker he was in Wilkos, back in his own reality.

Having not got a reply, the emperor scowled a little, then dismissed the soldiers. He waited until they were out of the room, then spoke up again, addressing who he thought was Fringilla, one of his Nilfgardian subjects... and currently a prisoner for dissent. "I would advise you not to ignore me."

Liam looked up, cleared his throat and frowned at the sound of his feminine tone. "S--sorry, um... no, I have no idea." He eventually squeaked in reply.

"Oh I believe you do. My daughter, Cirilla has returned, and I want her found. I have hired the Witcher known as White Wolf to find her, but I sense he will need help. You are to find your sisters from the Lodge and assist Geralt however you can. Am I clear?" The emperor explained, pacing around Liam, who looked up nervously at the much taller, intimidating man.

Still not clear why he was in Fringilla's body or why he was now trapped in this world, Liam just wanted to cut and run, but he was clever enough that wasn't possible. "Of course, but I'll need these removed." He said, holding up his feminine hands and bringing Emyr's attention to the dimeritium shackles on his wrists.

"Naturally. It's good to see common sense is prevailing for once, given your past outbursts and misdeeds." Emyr nodded, remaining emotionally cold as always. "I dispatched Yennefer to Novigrad some time ago, and my soldiers have sent back word that Keira Metz is now with her too. But there are still sorceresses out there, most notably Philippa Eilhart, Triss Merigold, and Margarita Laux Antille. At least one of them may be a captive of Radovid. Since there are reports that this 'Wild Hunt' is pursuing my daughter, you will need all the assistance you can muster. Now go, my men will remove your shackles." Emyr explained, then dismissing Liam.

Liam let out a deep sigh, and once more looked down in disbelief at his sexy female form, before turning and walking out of the room, where a Nilfgardian blacksmith and several guards were waiting to remove his shackles. What the hell has happened? Liam shook his head in utter bewilderment.

He needed answers and fast.
135213331311213322132.title: Meanwhile, in occupied Vizima.

1352133313112133221323.content:
While her friends were adjusting themselves to their new bodies and formulating plans of some kind, all a dejected Rebekah could do was sit there on the cold floor of her prison cell, nursing her bruises and cuts. She had stopped crying at this point, but now she was just sat there, silent, being watched occasionally by the two guards who were in the dimly lit room with her.

She suddenly looked up when the large door to the room creaked open and in walked another two men, including the prison warden. He was a stocky built man in plate armor and a scar on his face. A feeling of dread immediately overcame Rebekah as she sat there, peering up through the bars of her cell. The two new arrivals stopped in front of the door to the cell, and the warden soon spoke.

"I'll ask again bitch. WHERE... is Philippa Eilhart?" The warden asked in a gruff, cockney voice.

"I-I d-don't know w-who that is. Please... just... let me out." Rebekah pleaded.

The guards burst out laughing, but then the warden stopped laughing just as quickly. "You telling me you don't know the whore sorceress whose lodge you used to belong to? Do you take me for an idiot? Now tell me where the bitch is, or I'll beat it out of you."

Rebekah was silent for a moment, then she shook her head and started crying again. "I'm telling you, I d-don't know her, I don't even k-know where I am."

"You're exactly where we want you, cunt, and you will tell us what we want to know. Just tell the guards when your little bout of convenient amnesia clears up heh?" The warden chuckled, before he left the room again, leaving Rebekah more despondent than ever.

She needed a way out.
1352133313112133221323.title: Back in Oxenfurt Prison.

13521333131121332213232.content:
"This is as far as we can take you." The commander of the detachment of Nilfgardian soldiers who were escorting Liz and Natalie suddenly said, as his horse came to a stop and he signalled his men to halt.

"What? Why?" Liz responded in Yennefer's voice, managing to turn her own horse around as Natalie held onto her waist behind her.

The soldier pointed to the river up the winding road up ahead. "You should know. Redanian soldiers control all the crossings. We were expressly ordered not to get involved in fighting unless absolutely necessary." He explained.

"Who are Redanians?" Natalie whispered in Liz's ear.

Liz looked back, briefly shrugging her shoulders, indicating she didn't know. "Well, is the crossing up ahead?" Liz asked the commander.

He nodded, but then smirked. "It is, but I'd advise you take an alternate route across the Pontar, since you both are well aware of Radovid's orders regarding witches and sorceresses right?" He chuckled a little, finding it funny for some reason.

"Who the hell is Radovid?" Natalie also whispered, causing Liz to roll her eyes.

"I know as much as you Natalie." She mumbled back, before turning back to the Nilfgardian soldiers as they prepared to leave them. She was going to ask them which way they should go, but decided against it. Liz knew she and Natalie would have to learn to adapt to this new world, since they were stuck in it. As they watched their escort depart, they were both anxious and scared of what lay ahead on the road.

But they would face it together. And it wasn't as though they'd be defenceless, given their new magic abilities.
13521333131121332213232.title: 'Yenn' and 'Keira' approach the...

choices: Liam catches up with Liz and Natalie.
135213331311213322132322.content:
"Velen's a big place to search, not to mention incredibly dangerous." Luke shook his head, not liking Steven's plan to start searching the vast, war-torn expanses of Velen. "And I can't guarantee that my skills at witchering will be as good as Geralt's."

"Yeah well, I might end up cooking us all with mis-aimed fireballs. The fact is, this plan is the only one we've got." Steven replied in Triss' voice, sounding a little irritated.

Luke was doubtful that any of their other friends were even trapped in this world with them. "Okay then we'd set off don't you think? I mean you're not safe in this city anyway, being a sorceress and all. Radovid would LOVE to capture you and burn you at the stake." He then said, gesturing with his hands just like Geralt usually did.

"After he's tortured me you mean, like he did Sile... in the game anyway, depending on what choices you made in the second game." Steven nodded, shuddering at the thought.

"And Rita." Luke mumbled in Geralt's emotionless tone.

"You think its a good idea for me to tag along? I'm... er... Dandelion, this ponce whose body I'm in, he's not a fighter." Rob interjected his friends' conversation.

"We should stick together for safety's sake." Steven answered Rob's question. "Me and Luke will do our best to protect you."

"Okay then. Never argue with a woman I suppose, especially one who can turn you inside out or melt your face off with magic." Rob said, drawing an annoyed stare from Steven. He then started packing a few things into a sack for the upcoming journey out of the city, such as food and supplies. Rob already knew he was going to be the 'pack mule'.

Steven ran his manicured hands down his shapely backside and took a deep breath while looking across at Luke, who surprisingly enough... just like Geralt... seemed cool as a cucumber. They both knew this was not going to be an easy task.
135213331311213322132322.title: Meanwhile in Novigrad.

1352133313112133221323222.content:
After being 'abandoned' by their Nilfgardian escorts, Liz and Natalie now found themselves in a predicament. They apparently needed to get across the Pontar river, which was not that far in front of them, out of direct eyesight, but still close. Considering some of the creatures they had seen along the way as they traveled north, neither of them wanted to swim in the deeper water or even wade through the swampy areas. Not to mention the fact that Liz didn't want to ruin the exquisite outfit she had on. In that respect at least, she and Yenn had a lot in common.

"So now what?" Natalie questioned, hands on hips and sounding very much like the original Keira Metz in her tone.

Liz gave her friend a glare, then with tongue in cheek, shrugged her velvet-draped shoulders. "I suppose we find a spot where we can cross. There's got to be a bridge somewhere."

"Yes, with guards apparently. These 'Redanians' that guy was on about." Natalie emphasized.

Liz puckered her lips and set off walking, the heels of her boots clicking on the crude path they were on. Natalie followed, barefoot of course, as Keira always was. "Well we have to get across one way or another." Liz mumbled.

A few minutes walking later, the two women-turned-sorceresses got to within sight of the river, a bridge was off to the right in the distance and they could see torches and a line of peasants/refugees waiting to escape Velen. But their observation was interrupted by the appearance of three men behind them, wielding an assortment of weapons. "Well, well, what do we 'ave here, two rich bitches ripe for the taking." The man in the middle, who looked very scruffy and had a large scar on his face, said to Liz and Natalie.

"I'd advise against it." Natalie spoke up immediately, startling Liz.

"Oh yeah? Get 'em boys!" The man grunted, his lip curling up.

Natalie stepped forward and raised her hands, as Liz stepped back... in shock. A miniature tornado suddenly appeared out of nowhere, enveloped the three bandits and lifted them clear up off the ground, spinning them around. As they screamed in terror, Liz put her hand to her mouth as she observed Natalie's handiwork. Natalie then abruptly spread her arms apart further and her three 'victims' were flung in random directions at high velocity, one of them hitting a tree and having his back snapped by the impact. The other two were just as dead when they hit the ground, and Natalie just let out a oddly contented sigh as she turned to face Liz with a cheeky smile. "Even though I don't know this world or who we are, these powers are the most AMAZING thing, don't you agree?" She chuckled to a speechless Liz.

"I uh... y-you k-killed them..." Liz eventually muttered, looking down.

"They were going to kill us. We have to defend ourselves, and luckily we have the means to do so." Natalie responded, hands on hips again. "Now I'm sure you have got some incredible powers too, you just have to work up the courage to use them, okay?"

Liz nodded slightly, rubbing her forehead with her gloved hand. "Well, I'll um... cross that bridge when I come to it." She muttered. "No pun intended."

"Come on." Natalie gestured north with her hand, getting her former supervisor to follow her. As she turned away from Liz however, Natalie's confidence disappeared when she realized what she'd just done. Even for her, this 'killing' business would take some getting used to.
1352133313112133221323222.title: 'Yenn' and 'Keira's' progress.

13521333131121332213232223.content:
"Right, Rob just follow me and Luke, we'll lead you out of the city, and don't wander or an overzealous Redanian guard will probably run you through with a pike." Steven said to Rob, who was beginning to panic a little. This whole thing was nerve rattling to Rob, he just couldn't get over what had happened. None fo them could, but Steven and Luke, as Triss and Geralt respectively, were handling it much better.

"You ready?" Steven then asked Luke, who nodded, showing little emotion.

Leaving the Rosemary & Thyme, the trio made their way towards the Tretogor Gate, leading out of Novigrad. Steven was wearing an expensive hood to conceal his identity, especially his fiery red hair. Luke didn't have to conceal what he was, as though people couldn't have known anyway, with two swords on his back.

"We'll never get passed those guards." Rob grumbled in fear as they approached several Redanians.

Luke took the lead, to distract as many of the Redanians as he could, and Steven didn't slow up, his ankle boots clonking on the hard ground as he walked. Rob brought up the rear, posing an unthreatening (if overdressed) individual. Apart from the odd glare from a guard directed at Luke, they got passed without incident. "See, that was easy." Luke commented in Geralt's familiar tone as they got outside the city walls.

"We're not done yet." Steven muttered quietly, gesturing to a party of witch hunters approaching on the path.

"Oh god." Rob gasped, starting to sweat a little.

Luke clenched his fists and Steven prepared his magic, just incase.
13521333131121332213232223.title: Back with 'Geralt' and company.

135213331311213322132322231.content:
Their heart rates increasing as they approached the guards, Luke, Steven and Rob all acted as calm as they could. Luke was out in front, acting surprisingly macho, given he was in Geralt's body. One of the guards spat on the floor as he passed, as was normal whenever someone saw a witcher. Another one mumbled something offensive, but Luke just ignored him.

But that was the extent of the incidents that occurred during their passage out of the city. "Well, I expected that to go a lot worse." Steven announced as they stopped at the boundary of the nearby woods and lowered his hood.

"Yeah, me too actually." Luke mumbled, almost emotionless.

Rob though was still sweating a little, it was as though Dandelion's nerves had been retained by him when he entered his body. "My god, they could have killed us!" He whimpered.

"Relax Rob, jeez." Steven said, putting his hands on his curvy hips.

"Its alright for you, 'little miss - I can throw fireballs'." Rob grumbled, supporting himself against a tree. Steven just rolled his eyes and sighed, before glancing over at Luke, who just shrugged.

"We should keep moving, we're still too near the city. Witch hunters patrol these areas." Luke then announced, pointing to the wooded area that was in front of them. Rob reluctantly followed Luke as he entered the treeline, and then Steven brought up the rear, giving his breasts another quick grope as he disappeared into the trees.
135213331311213322132322231.title: Passing without incident.

1352133313112133221323222312.content:
While Liz and Natalie were searching for a narrow crossing point across the river, they saw a distant figure on horseback behind them, approaching closer by the second. "Who's this?" Natalie asked, hands on hips as she let out a sigh. Liz just shrugged, still shocked by the way Natalie had killed the bandits a short while ago.

"A woman from the looks of it." Liz eventually was able to make out with her (Yenn's) perfect eyesight.

When Liam finally arrived in front of Liz and Natalie, they could both see this woman was confused and frustrated. "Can we help you?" Natalie asked.

"I hope someone can, I have no idea what I'm doing here." Liam replied, shaking his head.

Natalie and Liz looked at each other and something clicked. "What's your name?" Liz inquired.

"Apparently... it's Fringilla... I think." Liam answered.

"Your real name?" Natalie asked.

Liam paused for a moment, studying the two women in front of him. "Erm... Liam..."

Liz's eyed went wide, as did Natalie's to some extent. "Liam?? Oh my... you're... a woman!" Natalie started smirking slightly, looking over Liam's new body. "It's me... Natalie." She revealed.

"Are you okay Liam?" Liz asked, before revealing her identity too.

"Oh, shit.. I can't believe I found you, I'm glad I'm not on my own in this world. But... that begs the question... why are we in this world, and in these bodies?" Liam drolled on, reaching up to adjust his dress as he stared down into his cleavage and frowned.

"We're still trying to work that out ourselves, but I'm glad you're here, we can travel together. There's strength in numbers after all." Liz smiled. "We need to get to Novigrad, which is somewhere across this river, we think." Liz answered.

"Yeah, emperor's daughter, lost, sorceresses and a load of other stuff I have no clue about. I mean, I did play the Witcher III a bit, but not much." Liam nodded, helping his two co-workers afterwards with a bit of information about where they were. And once that was out of the way, the three of them continued searching for a way across the river.
1352133313112133221323222312.title: Meanwhile, at the Pontar River.

13521333131121332213232223121.content:
"Afraid of getting your feet wet?" Natalie asked Liz and Liam suddenly, turning back to them and then standing facing the river. "Watch and learn, because I'm fairly sure you two should be able to do this too." She said, before gesturing wide with her arms. With ease, Natalie opened up a portal, and her two friends stepped back in amazement. It was only a short portal, that took her over the other side of the river.

"See, easy as that." Natalie called out, a smug look on her (formerly Keira's) face. "I'm pretty sure we're all in the bodies of witches or sorceresses, so you two should have that power too." She shouted across.

"From what I remember about this game, we are sorceresses, but how the hell do we..." Liam called back in his female voice, while running his slender fingers through his dark pixie cut.

"Concentrate, and think where you want to end up, it's that easy." Natalie answered, hands on hips.

Liz glanced back at Liam, then sighed before raising her arms and closing her eyes. With her long, dark tresses blowing in the wind, she then made a swift downward motion with both arms... and as she did so the magical energy left her finger tips and opened up a portal exactly the same to Natalie's moments ago. Natalie's blonde, shoulder length hair whipped around violently as the other side of the portal opened near to her. Then Liz came stepping through, a look of astonishment on her face. Natalie could tell she was also proud of what she had just done. "Holy shit!" Liz blurted out, in Yenn's posh English accent.

"See, I told you." Natalie giggled. "We have all sorts of power." She continued, holding up her hand and conjuring a ball of some sort of shock energy for a second, before allowing it to disperse.

"We should use it wisely, I mean... it's dangerous." Liz warned her friend and 'employee'.

"I know, it's okay." Natalie nodded, even as Liam managed to open his own portal. Though it did take him a few minutes to achieve this feat. "Hard to focus?" Natalie joked, looking over to him.

"Hey, it's all new to me, okay. Give me a fucking break." He cussed in Fringilla's sexy voice.

"Alright, let's keep moving, if we're going to find this Cirilla, or whoever it is." Liz said. "And hopefully in Novigrad we'll find some more of our friends. I doubt there's just us trapped in this world."

"Good idea." Natalie agreed, and Liam just let out a sigh, gazing down again at his female form. True he was hot, but he would much rather have been having sex with a hot woman tham actually be in her body. The three co-workers continued on their way north, towards Novigrad, leaving the river behind them and taking a scenic route to avoid Redanian patrols and encampments.
13521333131121332213232223121.title: Across the Pontar... finally.

choices: Oh, not what they were expecting.
135213331311213322132322231212.content:
"I don't think its wise for us to be cutting through a heavily wooded area like this, just saying." Luke mumbled in Geralt's typically 'calm' tone of voice as he, Steven and Rob fought their way through thickets and bushes. "If I remember right, Leshens and other monsters like to hang out in places like this."

"Monsters, in here?" A panicked Rob replied, looking worried and almost paranoid.

"Relax, we're fine." Steven tried reassuring his scared friend, to no avail. "I bet the leshens are bound to take one look at that outfit of yours and run a mile." He quipped, chuckling like Triss normally would.

"Very funny Steven." Rob grumbled.

Steven looked over his shoulder at Rob, stopping walking for a moment. "You'd really better get used to calling me Triss, don't you think?" He told him. "I mean, I am in her body after all."

"Yeah, and how are you traversing this terrain in those boots?" Rob inquired, pointing to Steven's feet.

"Easy, they're not stilettos or anything." Steven shrugged, sticking a foot out and rotating his ankle while keeping balance for a moment.

"Sshh!" Luke suddenly said, raising his hand and stealthily stepping forward, not making even a sound, like a true witcher. Steven and Rob looked over to Luke, who was staring in the direction of a particular thick gathering of trees, where hardly any daylight penetrated through. "I hear something."

"Leshen?" Steven replied, walking over to him, with Rob actually walking directly behind him.

"Perhaps. Or maybe a Fiend, or a Chort." Luke nodded.

"They're all pretty big. This could get interesting." Steven sighed, as he raised his right hand, revealing his palm and casually conjuring a ball of fire in it. Luke reached up and over, unsheathing his silver sword. Rob just gulped, feeling both scared and particularly useless.

A fucking bard!?? Seriously... Rob thought, shaking his head. "I'll be over here, protecting our rear." He then said in a somewhat whiny tone, before retreating to a large tree which had a hollowed out bark near the ground. Steven just glanced back, smirking, whereas Luke never took his eyes off the trees in front of him.

"Get ready!" Luke then stated, and both he and Steven took an aggressive stance.
135213331311213322132322231212.title: Meanwhile, en-route south.

1352133313112133221323222312121.content:
Two large trees were suddenly ripped up out of the ground and pushed over as a Fiend came charging out of the forest. "WHAT THE HELL IS THAT??" Rob screamed out as he backed up away from his two friends. As the monster in front of them growled out loud, pushing it's snout skywards, Luke and Steven both looked at each other for a second, before taking action. Steven started hurling fireballs from his manicured hands... landing successive hits on the beast, setting fire to it's fur and causing it to recoil in initial pain. It then charged at Steven, causing him to open a portal and quickly step through, appearing behind the monster.

As the burning beast turned around, Luke lunged forward and delivered a precise blow from his silver sword across the creature's left hind leg, quickly following up with another slash across it's rear before pirouhetting out of the way of a poorly aimed swipe of the Fiend's front right leg.

While this was ongoing, Rob had taken refuge behind a large, hollowed out tree that had been felled some dozens of years ago, and he watched in a mixture of amazement and shock as his two friends took on this behemoth.

The Fiend charged at Luke again, only to have him hurl a Samum bomb at it, which caused temporary blindness. Running as fast as Geralt's legs would carry him, Luke then slid underneath the Fiend and delivered a powerful slash down it's abdomen... spilling it's guts onto the ground. This happened consecutively with Steven continuously using Triss's offensive magic to wear it down. After hurling several more fireballs, Steven put both his feminine hands together and conjured up an arc of lightning which struck the mortally wounded beast and knocked it down. A dying gasp escaped the creature's bloodied mouth as it's fur continued to smoulder, it's internal organs releasing a slight cloud of steam as they lay on the ground.

"Well, that was bracing!" Steven muttered, stepping over several broken tree branches in his heeled boots as he approached Luke, who was re-sheathing his sword. Steven exhaled deeply, licking his lips as he pushed a rogue strand of red hair from his face.

"Defintely. Shame it didn't know how outmatched it was." Luke mumbled, speaking in Geralt's usual calm, emotionless tone.

Rob suddenly popped his head up again, staring at the fallen beast. "That was... wow!" He gulped, removing his bard's hat and slowly walking up to his friends, who stood looking over their dead adversary."Um.. good work!" He complimented them, chuckling nervously.

"Thanks." Luke replied, tilting his head slightly.

"Come on, we should keep moving. That little battle might have gotten someone's attention." Steven said in Triss's voice.

"Agreed!" Luke nodded, following Steven and taking another admiring look at his voluptuous backside.

Rob stared at the Fiend for a moment longer, before rushing to catch up with 'Triss' and 'Geralt'.
1352133313112133221323222312121.title: Something lunges from the trees.

13521333131121332213232223121211.content:
South being just a few hundred yards away from the trio of Wilko employees now finding themselves inhabiting the bodies of characters from the video game "The Witcher 3: The Wild Hunt."

As Steven-come-Triss, Luke-now-Geralt, and Rob-reluctantly-Dandelion pressed on after their encounter with the now smoldering Fiend, a shadowy figure watched them from behind the cover of brush on a rocky outcropping nearby. Obscured by it's hiding place, the figure's silhouette had long limbs, a pointy nose, and a hunched, nervous posture.

The shadowy observer couldn't help but chuckle as it watched the threesome. Rob brought up the rear, scrambling to catch up with his apparently more confident and dignified co-workers, his foppish attire doing nothing to help him seem more assured. Luke seemed capable enough, the powerful, assured, and manly gait of Geralt growing on him with every step. He smirked a little as he watched Steven's new, delightfully taught little tush sway back and forth before him. Frustrated but determined, Steven blew a strand of crimson hair out of his eyes as he continued to guide them toward he knew not what.

"Well, they took care of the Fiend I flushed toward them with no real effort. I'd say that qualifies as a successful test of their ability to adapt. These dim-witted Brits just might be my ticket out of here." The obscured figure quietly crept down the side of the outcropping, all the while keeping an eye with the trio as it did it's best to track their progress. "Now, how best to introduce myself..."
13521333131121332213232223121211.title: Meanwhile, not too far south.

choices: Back with Liz, Natalie and Liam.
Off with Kiran in the Skellige Isles.
Luke, Steven and Rob continue south.
135213331311213322132322231212112.content:
While Luke and company were being observed by this unseen visitor, back in the prison in Oxenfurt, a dejected, pain-ridden Rebekah was still a cell, any magic abilities she might have been able to summon subdued by the dimeritium shackles that were tight on her wrists. Added to her misery was the constant taunting from the two guards in the room.

Just when she was about to close her eyes again and lay on the cold, hard floor with her hands over her ears, a loud noise and a sudden wind picked up in the room... throwing objects all over the place. Rebekah looked up to see some kind of black, gold-rimmed portal open up... and a rather voluptuous looking woman in a low-cut dress and wearing a blind fold stepped through it. "Been looking for me you miserable wretches?" The woman asked the guards, who had scrambled to grab their swords.

A wave of the woman's right hand threw both guards back against the wall, then with her left hand she made a grasping motion... closing both mens' windpipes and suffocating them. As both men fell dead, Rebekah let out a loud gasp, which drew the woman's attention.

"Rita!!" The woman exclaimed, walking towards Rebekah, who was shocked at the obvious power this woman had as the portal closed up behind her. The woman's blindfold didn't seem to inhibit her at all. "Are you all right? As soon as I found out what these bastards had done to you and your girls at the college, I made efforts to track you down." The woman said to Rebekah, her tone sounding as cold as the floor Rebekah was laid on.

"I... um... who are you?" Rebekah asked the obvious question.

"Who am I?" The woman scoffed, now sounding insulted. "Don't tell me you have amnesia!" She stated, putting her manicured hands firmly on her curvy hips. "I don't need you being as gormless as Triss's pet witcher!"

Rebekah held her head for a moment, then looked up again. "I have no idea where I am, who you are and... who's body I'm in right now." She told the strange woman in a frantic tone.

The blindfolded woman paused for a moment, her mind ticking over. "Hmm, I've knowledge of body swapping spells, but I haven't used one myself for decades. Are you telling me you're not Rita?"

"Yes!! Whoever Rita is." Rebekah said tearfully. "Last thing I remember I was with my friends at work, doing my job..." Rebekah continued, explaining everything to the woman as she used a fire bolt from her finger to melt the lock on the cell. During the conversation, the strange woman also identified herself to Rebekah as Philippa Eilhart.

"So you're from another... world? Or rather another reality? One where magic doesn't exist? Sounds positively dull I have to say!" Philippa sneered, as she removed Rebekah's shackles. She was amazed that inside the body of one of the most powerful, beautiful sorceresses... was a 20-year old girl with no knowledge of the world she now found herself in. "What about religion? Do you have that in your reality?" Philippa inquired.

"Unfortunately, yes. It causes so much problems." Rebekah said meekly.

"Well, some things stay in the same in any reality it would seem." Philippa nodded, not surprised. "Anyway, let's get you out of here before more of Radovid's thugs arrive." She said. quickly turning and opening another portal behind her. "We're going back to my hideout."

"Who's Radovid?" Rebekah asked, as Philippa helped her up off the floor.

"The bastard king who gouged out my eyes!" Philippa answered. "I'll tell you everything, don't worry, and you can tell me about these friends of yours." She reassured Rebekah, just before taking her through the portal and to the underground cavern where she had her hideout. Philippa's mind was already plotting. She knew there was a possibility that Rebekah's friends were also somewhere around, and maybe in the bodies of the other sorceresses, or other people. And if she could find them... and train/manipulate them, reconvening the Lodge of Sorceresses and gaining new allies could be easier than she ever thought possible.
135213331311213322132322231212112.title: At the prison in Oxenfurt.

choices: Back with Liz, Natalie, and Liam.
Off with Kiran in the Skellige Isles.
1352133313112133221323222312121124.content:
The trio of former retail workers, now fantasy adventurers continued on their way, mostly due to Steven/Triss's determination.

"This still seems like a ridiculous long-shot of a plan to me." Luke said with an almost-in-character subdued, gravely voice that could practically have been a ripped audio-file pilfered directly from the actual Witcher 3 game.

"Luke's right! We have no idea if we're heading toward any of the other Wilkos refugees. Hell, we don't even know if any of them have found themselves stranded here as well!" Now Rob was joining in, all while looking around nervously, terrified that they might run into another monstrosity like the Fiend Steven and Luke had dispatched, but also a little afraid they'd bump into someone who'd openly mock his ridiculously foppish ensemble.

Steven continued on his course, marching with an angry, almost stomping cadence as he scissored his lovely new legs back and forth, the tight, supple feel of his leggings hugging every nook and cranny, reminding him that he was in a smooth, lovely body that wasn't his own. Every motion, every sway, felt totally foreign, but also more than a little pleasurable.

Conflicted, afraid that admitting he was enjoying some of what he was experiencing would distract him from keeping his friends safe, and getting them all home, frustration and anger bubbled up within him. Having to contend with all of that AND, his two friends questioning what he felt was the only sensible course of action was too much for him to keep bottled up. He finally snapped.

Stomping both of his chunky heeled ankle boots into the soil beneath him, he balled his fists, furrowed his brow, and closed his eyes before spitting out, "I've played a LOT more of this game than either of you. I know this world. I know this is the best shot we have." he said through clenched teeth.

Taken aback by Triss/Steven's fiery anger, and remembering his newfound ability to hurl flippin' fireballs, Rob went silent and took a step or two back. "Look, I-I'm not making any demands or anything...it's just none of this makes sense and I'm hoping that talking about what we're planning or doing will help something...ANYTHING make sense. Let's not argue."

Luke/Geralt held his open hands and spoke to Steven/Triss, who's back was still facing towards him. "The Dandy's right..." <Rob managed to let out a pitifully exasperated "Hey!" before Luke continued, "There's no need to get pissed off Steven. We're just discussing things. We're all for following your lead, we're just trying to get a handle on your plan." Conciliatory and Geralt's low, masculine voice didn't seem complimentary, but somehow Luke made it work.

Steven's slender new shoulders, clad in Triss's adventuring togs, slunk a little as he calmed down. "I know you blokes don't mean anything, but trust me, I KNOW we're on the right path. I'm sorry I snapped. My blood's still up after we sliced and barbecued that Fiend, and you just don't know how every waking moment I'm this...this...woman...feels so...feels so..." Steven looked down at his delightfully displayed new cleavage.

Overcome with sympathy for his friend who was obviously being pushed to the brink emotionally, and, possibly with a little bit of Geralt's affections and feeling of protectiveness towards the lovely Triss intruding upon his own thought processes, Luke rushed toward the woman in front of him, intending to put a comforting hand on his slender new shoulders.

At the same moment, his anger fading, Steven turned around, eager to give his mates a smile and reassure them that they were right to put their trust in him and that no permanent damage had been done to their fellowship, spun around on his boot heels, stepping toward his friends, his shoulders and head held high.

Luke and Steven, both now moving much too quickly in the same direction, practically collided. Triss's bouncing, perky tits ran smack dab into Geralt's leather and armor ensconced, chiseled, intimidating chest.

The next few seconds were utter turmoil. Luke's Geralt visage looked uncharacteristically shocked, his eyes wide with surprise, his mouth agape. For his part, Steven's delicate, beautiful features looked just as aghast, his new green eyes just as wide, his cheeks flashing a bright crimson that was almost as vibrant as his new crown of gorgeous red hair.

Luke held his hands up, trying to protest, sputtering as his mind whirled and he tried to come up with the words to explain that their impact was NOT what he had in mind. Steven was equally panicked, trying to put some distance between him and his now-towering above him friend, only managing to lose his balance between the elevated heels of his new footwear and the strange new center of gravity he had to contend with between his protruding breasts, and equally showy fanny.

Seeing Steven/Triss was about to tumble onto her backside, Luke Geralt reached out and caught her/him, keeping his smaller companion upright by grabbing his small shoulders with his large, powerful hands and drawing him up and toward him with his exceptionally muscled arms. The unintended consequence of this gallant rescue attempt was the two friends finding themselves in a full-on embrace.

"I...I...I'm sorry, I didn't...whoa..." Luke babbled in a manner very much unlike the Witcher, while his gaze was pulled from looking into Steven's lovely new eyes by some unseen, tractor-beam like force downward, until he was taking in a bird's eye view of Triss's bosom, pulled tight against his massive chest. Still steadying Steven, he drew his smaller form closer, as his left hand went behind his body and inadvertently found itself gripping his wide, but pleasantly tight little tush...a tush he'd been admiring during their entire walk.

Steven's heart skipped a beat. He was still aghast, but he felt something else. He felt so small, so tiny, so fragile in Geralt's embrace. He knew he should be disgusted, but a big part of him felt secure, comfortable, and protected. The musky, leathery smell of Luke's new body was surprisingly pleasant, as was the feel of his massive hands on his soft, quivering body. Luke's protests went quiet, as he continued to pull Steven closer. Steven's tits were squeezed betwixt them even tighter, he could feel his thighs and new womanhood make contact with Geralt's lower body. Steven trembled, and felt a eerie, inner tingling and pleasure as Luke's new manhood pushed against the prison of Geralt's trousers toward Triss's femininity.

"Uhh...I'm pretty sure Wilkos has a rule or 3 against fraternization and displays of affection, doesn't it guys?" Rob coked his head and looked at the hugging pair in awkward disbelief.

That was enough to snap the pair out of their pleasure funk. Luke let go of Steven so forcefully he practically pushed him away. For his part, Steven did his best to catch his breath, put some distance between Triss and Geralt's bodies as possible, and regain his composure. "Ughh...yeah...that was...that was...nothing. Shit...we've wasted too much time with this nonsense! We have to keep moving!"

Practically sprinting on his heeled boots, Steven continued marching forward, so fast that Rob and Luke had to jog to catch up. Rob came up close to Luke and whispered. "Well that was weird. For what it's worth, I don't blame you, Steve's fucking gorgeous now."

Sounding more like Geralt, gave Rob/Dandelion a surprisingly potent backhand smack and barked "Shut up!" in a husky, muffled tone.
1352133313112133221323222312121124.title: Luke, Steven and Rob continue south.

13521333131121332213232223121211242.content:
As things were 'escalating' in occupied Temeria between her equally lost co-workers, Jessica was somehow managing to hold herself together, now in the body and life of the ruler of Toussaint, Duchess Anna Henrietta. Her day had settled into 'routine' actions for a Duchess, including hearing the case of a man accused of causing damage to a vineyard. "Was anyone hurt?" Jessica asked in her new, accented voice as she relaxed on her throne.

"No, your Grace, but the accused did set afire a field, causing significent damage, and distress to the victim of course." One of Jessica's guards responded.

Rebekah had to admit, she really did feel more comfortable after Philippa's magics had cleaned her up and granted her new raiment. She had to fight the urge to primp and pose in front of the mirror, as part of her was actually glorying in seeing the achingly beautiful woman as her reflection. She closed her eyes and shook her head, "this isn't me." she whispered to herself.

Across the room, Philippa smiled. "Don't feel bad child, it's completely understandable to get a bit caught up in admiring Rita's beauty." Philippa's heels clicked on the stone floor as she glided across the room and grabbed Rebekah's new shoulders. "I'm just glad that I was able to save you from that prison. BOTH of you."

Rebekah smiled weakly. "I certainly owe you one or two."

Philippa smiled like the cat who ate the canary. "Perhaps. But think nothing of it for now." She turned and went back to her equipment and book cases.

Rebekah took a few steps after her, her stockinged, high heeled legs crossing the distance gracefully. "So. What next? Can you find my friends?"

Philippa's pretty lips collapsed into a slight frown. "Normally that would be no problem whatsoever. I'd just sense and transport myself to the rest of the members of the Lodge and see if we can confirm that all of them have been replaced by your friends. But something has begun to affect my ability to do so." Philippa rubbed her temples. "It's like a distortion of some kind...a confusion...".

"That sucks. I hope they're not in this place too, but if they are it would feel better if I was with them. I feel so...alone." She lowered her head and her shoulders sunk.

Philippa rushed to her side. "There's no need to feel alone, little one. You're part of a sisterhood now. A powerful sisterhood. I will protect you with my very life." Philippa embraced the young woman, pressing her impressive bosom against Margarita's own ample assets.

"Ugh...thanks..." Rebekah whispered, her 'Rita cheeks blushing.

Philippa continued to hold her, but leaned back a bit. "Not to worry. I have an idea. I think I have an idea how to use your connection to one or more of your stranded friends to find them. I caution you however, it will involve ritual, magic, and you and I deepening our own connection. Are you up for that?"

Rebekah looked a little leery, but finally managed to say, "I guess so." rather meekly.

"Good. Good." Philippa sounded delighted.
1352133313112133221323222312121124242122.title: Checking back with Philippa and 'Margarita&...

1352133313112133221323222312121124242122.content:
Jessica meanwhile had been keeping herself entertained back in the Nilfgardian vassal Duchy of Toussaint, HER Duchy. Striding confidently out of her palace with her three ladies in waiting rushing to catch up, Jessica headed for the stables, riding crop in hand and her luxurious red hair blowing in the breeze. The heels of her black boots clicked rapidly on the expertly laid ground in the courtyard, backed up by the clicking of her companions' heels also. Then there was the clanking of armored guards who were laboring to catch up, sweating under all the polished steel plate. "Keep up girls!" Jessica barked at her female entourage.

Vivienne, Lucille and Beatrice were chatting quietly to each other, no doubt puzzled as to their mistress's 'odd' behavior, her mood swings. But they were also somewhat amused by the way the Duchess was now acting. Besides, they loved horse riding as much as she did.

Approaching an immaculate, black mare which was saddled up ready to go, Jessica gasped at it's beauty. She slowed her walk, so as not to alarm the animal, then smiled as she caressed it's neck and face. "You're beautiful!" Jessica whispered in awe. For a moment she forgot about her predicament, her stranger's body, and even her sexy, accented voice. Snapping herself out of her trance, Jessica then looked at her female companions. "Well, saddle up!" She smirked.

"Yes m'lady!" Vivienne nodded, along with her two friends, before finding their own horses. Vivienne chose a white mare, while Lucille and Beatrice selected a Palomino stallion and a Bay stallion respectively. Quietly addressing the male stable hand who was nearby, Jessica leaned closer. "Remind me of her name again?"

The stable hand, head lowered in respect, stuttered his response nervously. "Um... i-its Sapphire, y-your Grace!"

"Ah, thank you," Jessica smiled, before instantly frowning as she caught scent of the man. "Now, go and bathe will you." She said rather rudely.

"A t-t-thousand p-pardons m'lady!" The man apologized, backing away while groveling.

Turning back to her horse, Jessica lifted one of her shapely, fabric-covered legs and placed a foot in the stirrup, before effortlessly lifting herself into the saddle. As she adjusted her position slightly, straddling her mare, she took the reigns and turned the horse in a full circle, surveying the courtyard and it's inhabitants. She first looked over her motionless elite guard and smirked, correctly guessing that they all had throbbing erections straining their undergarments while watching her. Giggling, she then turned her horse again. "Ready girls?" She asked her ladies-in-waiting, who had also all mounted their horses. They all nodded.

"Captain, you and your men remain here, I will be fine." Jessica ordered her elite guard commander. And maybe take a cold shower. She thought with a giggle.

"Of course, your Grace!" The captain bowed, obeying without question.

Pulling gently on the reigns again, Jessica guided her horse down the spiral pathway that led down to an open area that included a medium sized race course. Once she was out of earshot, she addressed her companions again. "Okay girls, how about a race? And I insist that you do NOT let me win just because I'm the Duchess, am I clear?" Before Vivienne and the others could answer, Jessica grinned and kicked the sides of her horse gently while snapping the reigns... causing her horse to set off in a gallop down the course.

Quickly glancing at each other, the three ladies-in-waiting were startled, but quickly regained their composure and set off in pursuit of their mistress. "Yaah, yaah..." Jessica called out, to spur her horse onwards, but Sapphire didn't go as fast as she wanted her to, at least not at first. It wasn't long before first Lucille, then Vivienne and lastly Beatrice had caught up and edged past her, glancing right as they did so and smiling. "Pass the Duchess on the left hand side... really??" Jessica frowned, before snapping her reigns again and spurring Sapphire to go quicker. Dust was kicked up as the four women thundered down the course on their mounts, garnering the attention of a few of the Duchess's subjects. Jessica's skills at horse riding from her teenage years all came back to her and she was soon able to catch up to and pass each one of her companions in turn. After five minutes, she gave one last slap of her riding crop on Sapphire that carried her over the finishing line, seconds ahead of her ladies-in-waiting.

Bringing her panting horse to a stop, Jessica was all smiles, and she felt her ample (if restricted) bosom heaving as she took in deep breaths of fresh air. "That was fun girls!" She said, obviously brimming at her victory.

"Congratulations on your victory m'lady." Vivienne smiled, nodding from her mounted position while patting her horse's neck to calm her down.

"Thank you Vivienne. You all rode well, you make me proud." Jessica then said, looking at each girl in turn and making them all smile more than they already were. "Now, how about another run when we've rested the horses?" Jessica winked in a manner not completely befitting Royalty.

This was the most fun she'd had in years, and a part of her already didn't want to go back to her own body and humdrum life.
